original: de bas na de ltar rtogs pa'i go rims yin pa'i phyir 'di ni go rims yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar rtogs pa'i go rims yin pa'i phyir 'di ni go rims yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is the order of realization, this is the order.

original: 'dis kyang rtogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag kho na bstan gyi ma tshang ba dang lhag par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rtogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag kho na bstan gyi ma tshang ba dang lhag par yang ma yin no //
translated: And since this also includes all the teachings of realization, only these are taught, not less or more.

original: de bzhin kun rdzob tu rten gyi dngos po 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir don 'di thams cad 'phangs pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kun rdzob tu rten gyi dngos po 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir don 'di thams cad 'phangs pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And in the same way, since the state of support is implied in the conventional, one should understand that all these topics are implied in this perfection of wisdom.

original: nyi khri lnga @47b stong pa las rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas don re re zhing bstan pa'i shes par byed pa nyid kyi gzhung yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nyi khri lnga @47b stong pa las rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas don re re zhing bstan pa'i shes par byed pa nyid kyi gzhung yod mod kyi /
translated: In the Twenty-five Thousand, the text that explains each topic in terms of the state of support is available.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas ma bris so //
translated: But fearing too many words, I have not written it here.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mongs min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //🔽'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mongs min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar // 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
translated: the disciples, the unshared,🔽the order of the benefit of others,🔽and the effortless engagement of wisdom🔽are the support for the engagement of the bodhisattva.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The support for the engagement of the bodhisattvas is called the lineage.🔽This is the explanation of the support for the engagement of the bodhisattvas.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings kho na 'phags pa'i chos rnams rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs chos nyid kyi ming can yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings kho na 'phags pa'i chos rnams rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs chos nyid kyi ming can yin na /
translated: If the dharmadhatu alone is the cause of the realization of the dharmas of the aryas, then the bodhisattva who is of the nature of that dharmadhatu is the lineage that abides as the nature of the unsurpassed dharmas of the Buddha, and is called the dharmata lineage.

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kho na spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kho na spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs so //
translated: At that time, since the dharmadhatu alone is generally abiding, this is the lineage that abides as the nature of that which is obtained by dharmata from beginningless time.

original: 'di ni sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms pas thob pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms pas thob pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
translated: This is the attainment of the lineage of the bodhisattva, which is acquired through the cultivation of the roots of virtue in the past.

original: 'di ni rkyen chen pos kyang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen chen pos kyang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin no //
translated: This is the lineage of the bodhisattva, which is definite as the lineage of the śrāvaka, the pratyekabuddha, and the tathāgata, because it is not carried off even by the great conditions.🔽This is the lineage of the bodhisattva, which is indefinite as the lineage of the śrāvaka, etc., because it is carried off by the conditions.

original: 'di ni rkyen gyis 'phrogs pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su ma nges pa yin no zhes rigs kyi dbye ba tha dad par rung ba ma yin nam zhe na /🔽ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen gyis 'phrogs pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su ma nges pa yin no zhes rigs kyi dbye ba tha dad par rung ba ma yin nam zhe na / ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is not possible to distinguish the lineages in this way, then how is it that the bodhisattva is said to be endowed with the lineage of the bodhisattva?🔽Just as the vehicles of the śrāvaka, etc., are distinguished in terms of the stages of realization,

original: chos kyi dbyings rgyu'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ba'i sgo nas rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rgyu'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ba'i sgo nas rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: in the same way, the lineage is conventionally designated in terms of the dharmadhātu, which is the cause of the realization of the ārya dharmas.

original: yang dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa brten pa sprang rtsi dang / khar la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du rten pa'i chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas rten tha dad pa nyid du btags pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa brten pa sprang rtsi dang / khar la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du rten pa'i chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas rten tha dad pa nyid du btags pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Again, for example, a single lump of clay is the basis for the manifestation of a single flame, and the clay pot, etc. , which is based on it, is different from the honey, molasses, etc. , which are contained in it. In the same way, the three vehicles which are the based phenomena are different in terms of the objects of knowledge, and therefore there is no fault in positing a difference in the basis.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is undifferentiated,

original: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: lineages are not differentiated.

original: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
translated: But because of the differences in the based phenomena,

original: de yi dbye ba yongs su @48a * //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba yongs su @48a * //
translated: its divisions are fully

original: brjod ; ; ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod ; ; ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: expressed.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni yon tan sgrol pa'i don gyis na chos kyi dbyings la rigs zhes bya ste de las yon tan de dag skye zhing 'byung pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni yon tan sgrol pa'i don gyis na chos kyi dbyings la rigs zhes bya ste de las yon tan de dag skye zhing 'byung pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The verbal definition: lineage is called gotra because it is the source of qualities, since those qualities arise and emerge from it.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes nges pa'i tshig ni sems bskyed pa dang thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba de yin pas
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes nges pa'i tshig ni sems bskyed pa dang thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba de yin pas
translated: This is the etymology of the term, since it is the precursor of generating the enlightenment mind, liberation and factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: / dang po kho nar rigs bshad par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: / dang po kho nar rigs bshad par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the lineage to be explained first?

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained in this order?

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true.

original: de ni don gyi go rims yin la /
analyzed: de ni don gyi go rims yin la /
translated: That is the order of the meaning.

original: 'di ni dang po 'bras bu bshad nas rgyu phyis bstan pa yin pas bshad pa'i go rims yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po 'bras bu bshad nas rgyu phyis bstan pa yin pas bshad pa'i go rims yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But this is the order of explanation, since the result is explained first and the cause later.

original: rten gyi 'og tu ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa gang yin snyam pa la dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa🔽gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rten gyi 'og tu ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa gang yin snyam pa la dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should observe all phenomena and so on.🔽Because all phenomena are the object of observation and the basis of comprehension, in order to realize them, they are observed correctly without going beyond the two truths.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i chos thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa'i don du na bden pa gnyis las ma 'das par yang dag par dmigs pas na chags pa med pa der gyur ba na dmigs pa rnam par
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i chos thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa'i don du na bden pa gnyis las ma 'das par yang dag par dmigs pas na chags pa med pa der gyur ba na dmigs pa rnam par
translated: When they are observed without attachment, the object of observation is observed without being observed.

original: dag pa rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pa de'i phyir byang chub la dmigs pa'i dgongs pas rang gi don rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir
analyzed: dag pa rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pa de'i phyir byang chub la dmigs pa'i dgongs pas rang gi don rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir
translated: Because of realizing purity, one fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, but not otherwise. Therefore, because of the intent that focuses on enlightenment, one’s own aim is completely perfect in every way.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that one is called a bodhisattva.

original: de la re zhig dang por spyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad de go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / lung du ma bstan ba'i lus kyi las la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por spyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad de go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / lung du ma bstan ba'i lus kyi las la sogs pa ste /
translated: In this regard, first, in general, all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and ethically neutral phenomena are, respectively, the nature of the spiritual life, such as killing, and so on, and ethically neutral physical actions, and so on.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du phye pa la blang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba'i gnas nyid du rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du phye pa la blang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba'i gnas nyid du rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Thus, having divided them into three categories, one should cultivate them as the basis for what is to be adopted, what is to be rejected, and what is to be left neutral.

original: de nas yang blang bar bya ba nas bzung ste 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs @48b ba ni 'jig rten pa dang yang dag pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa ni 'jig rten
analyzed: de nas yang blang bar bya ba nas bzung ste 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs @48b ba ni 'jig rten pa dang yang dag pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa ni 'jig rten
translated: Then, from the perspective of what is to be adopted, the five appropriated aggregates and so on subsumed by the mundane path are mundane and the four meditative concentrations and so on subsumed by the supramundane ārya path are supramundane.

original: las 'das pa'i yin no zhes sems par byed do //🔽de la bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la ;
analyzed: las 'das pa'i yin no zhes sems par byed do // de la bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la ;
translated: Thus they contemplate mundane and supramundane phenomena.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni zag pa med pa yin no zhes spang ba dang blang bar bya ba nyid du nges par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni zag pa med pa yin no zhes spang ba dang blang bar bya ba nyid du nges par rtog par byed do //
translated: They ascertain what is to be abandoned and adopted by thinking that the five appropriated aggregates and so on are contaminated because they are not antidotes to the view of self and the supramundane meditative stabilizations and so on are uncontaminated because they are antidotes to the view of self.

original: des na zag pa med pa nas brtsams te rgyu dang rkyen la rag las ba 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pas bsdus pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu 'dus byas yin la /
analyzed: des na zag pa med pa nas brtsams te rgyu dang rkyen la rag las ba 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pas bsdus pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu 'dus byas yin la /
translated: Therefore, from the uncontaminated down to those that are included in the desire realm, which depend on causes and conditions, and the factors conducive to enlightenment and so on are all relative compounded phenomena.

original: rgyu la mi ltos pa khams gsum par ma gtogs par de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni don dam par 'dus ma byas yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis su sgom par byed do //🔽de nas 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud las 'byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa ni thun mong gi chos yin la /
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos pa khams gsum par ma gtogs par de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni don dam par 'dus ma byas yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis su sgom par byed do // de nas 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud las 'byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa ni thun mong gi chos yin la /
translated: Therefore, beginning with the uncontaminated, he cultivates the two aspects: the compounded that is, the factors conducive to enlightenment and so on, which are subsumed in the desire realm because they depend on causes and conditions and the uncompounded that is, suchness and so on, which are not subsumed in the three realms because they do not depend on causes.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las 'byung ba'i chos can stobs bcu la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis su sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las 'byung ba'i chos can stobs bcu la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis su sgom par byed do //
translated: Then he cultivates the two aspects: the common Dharma that is, the four meditative states and so on that arise in the mindstreams of all āryas who are classified as uncompounded and the uncommon Dharma that is, the ten powers and so on that arise in the mindstream of a perfect buddha.

original: de lta bu'i rtogs ba'i rim gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pas na dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtogs ba'i rim gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pas na dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the object of observation is just these eleven types, because one observes all phenomena as like illusions through the stages of such realizations.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rim pa ston pa'i gzhung yang /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rim pa ston pa'i gzhung yang /
translated: The texts that teach the stages of the object of observation as they have been explained

original: stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba la sogs pa las gsal pa kho nar 'byung ba las log par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba la sogs pa las gsal pa kho nar 'byung ba las log par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
translated: are very clear in the Twenty-five Thousand and so forth, and one should not misunderstand them.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: The object of observation is all phenomena.

original: de yang dge ba sogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang dge ba sogs pa yin //
translated: They are virtuous and so forth.🔽They are mundane and supramundane,🔽Desired and not desired,🔽Defiled and undefiled,

original: 'jig rten pa yin rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yin rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: Compounded and uncompounded.🔽They are phenomena common to disciples,

original: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And those uncommon to the Sage.

original: gang yang chos kyi dbyings rtag tu rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid ni dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gis rtag tu rnam @49a * //
analyzed: gang yang chos kyi dbyings rtag tu rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid ni dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gis rtag tu rnam @49a * //
translated: The ultimate object is the dharmadhatu, the nondual wisdom that is always pure.🔽

original: par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du 'gro bar ji ltar brjod par bya /
analyzed: par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du 'gro bar ji ltar brjod par bya /
translated: Those who think that the object is the realm of phenomena, which is always pure and nondual pristine wisdom, how could they say that it goes to a higher and higher degree of purity, because it is always pure?🔽The verse says:

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: The elements of water, gold, and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //🔽ces bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod // ces bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: are accepted as pure in the same way.

original: de ltan ni dag pa ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes yin no zhes gnyen po'i khyad par la mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i don gyis 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltan ni dag pa ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes yin no zhes gnyen po'i khyad par la mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i don gyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then because of the attachment to the distinction of the antidote, purity is the pristine wisdom of reality, and so it is projected by the meaning of attachment to the side of the counteragent.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pas phyogs gcig pa'i dag par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pas phyogs gcig pa'i dag par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no abandonment of the conceptualization of the side of the counteragent and the side of the counteraction, it follows that purity is one-sided.

original: khyed kyi phyogs ltar na yang rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bas dmigs pa mthar thug pa ji ltar yin zhe na nyes pa med de /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs ltar na yang rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bas dmigs pa mthar thug pa ji ltar yin zhe na nyes pa med de /
translated: Even according to you, since it is said that the object of the knowledge of all aspects is a non-entity, how is it the ultimate object?

original: gang gi phyir rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin par brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin par brjod la /
translated: There is no fault, because since it accords with reasoning, a non-entity is said to be the correct relative.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin bsgribs pa de rim gyis sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin bsgribs pa de rim gyis sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: That obscuration of the nature of reality is gradually realized to be illusion-like, which is purity.

original: de ltar byas na rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
translated: If that is done, the primary nature is the lineage.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin pas /
translated: The primary transformation is the object.

original: gnyi ga yang gnyi ga yin pa la ni dgag pa med do zhes bya ba ni rten dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gnyi ga yin pa la ni dgag pa med do zhes bya ba ni rten dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: Since both are both, there is no negation. This is the division of the characteristics of the basis and the object.

original: dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is much to be said about the establishment of the object,

original: shin tu spros pas chog go zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes gsungs so //
translated: it is enough to be very elaborate.🔽What is the purpose of the Bodhisattva, who is said to realize the object immediately after the object?

original: dmigs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la dmigs pa rtogs zer pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ched du bya ba gang yin snyam na ched du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la dmigs pa rtogs zer pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ched du bya ba gang yin snyam na ched du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the purpose, the Blessed One said, Thus have I heard, etc.🔽For what reason? means By what necessity is one who has become a Bodhisattva called a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: rgyu ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni dgos ba ci zhig gis na byang chub sems dpar gyur pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi lan du bka' stsal ba ni /🔽sems can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni dgos ba ci zhig gis na byang chub sems dpar gyur pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi lan du bka' stsal ba ni / sems can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is:🔽The great mass of sentient beings, etc.

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great mass of sentient beings

original: sems can gyi tshogs tshad med pa zhes spyir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs tshad med pa zhes spyir brjod pa'o //
translated: is a general expression for the immeasurable multitude of sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med par 'jug pa gcig kyang @49b che ba nyid kyis chen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phung po zhes smos so //🔽sems can gyi rigs chen po zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i ris la sogs pa'i dbye bas rigs mi mthun pa las bzlog pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med par 'jug pa gcig kyang @49b che ba nyid kyis chen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phung po zhes smos so // sems can gyi rigs chen po zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i ris la sogs pa'i dbye bas rigs mi mthun pa las bzlog pas /
translated: Since it is great by virtue of its greatness, it is called aggregate.

original: sems can spyi las skal ba mnyam pas bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can spyi las skal ba mnyam pas bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase great class of sentient beings is a particular class of sentient beings included within the same destiny, because it is the opposite of a class that is heterogeneous due to the distinctions of spiritual lineage, stage, and so on.

original: mchog nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is supreme because it is the best of all sentient beings.

original: de'i ched du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi sems che ba nyid rtogs nas spyir de thob par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston pa la sogs pas mchog nyid rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi sems che ba nyid rtogs nas spyir de thob par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston pa la sogs pas mchog nyid rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Having realized the greatness of mind that is supreme among all sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings who desire to attain that in general, and he perfects their supremacy through such activities as teaching the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir de zhes bya ba rgyu des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhes bya ba rgyu des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva, a great being, because of that reason.

original: 'di la sems che ba yod pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la sems che ba yod pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “great being” because it has a great mind.

original: sems chen po yod pa la ni spong ba chen po nyid yod pas spong ba chen po bstan par bya ba'i phyir bla ma la rag las bas na gnang ba zhu ba'i don du /
analyzed: sems chen po yod pa la ni spong ba chen po nyid yod pas spong ba chen po bstan par bya ba'i phyir bla ma la rag las bas na gnang ba zhu ba'i don du /
translated: Since there is great abandonment in one who has a great mind, in order to teach great abandonment, in order to request permission from the guru,

original: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: Śāriputra says, “Blessed One, I too would like to ask permission to speak on this topic.”

original: don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gi don de'i don la bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang spobs par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gi don de'i don la bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang spobs par 'tshal lo //
translated: I too would like to speak on the meaning of the term “great being,” the meaning of the term “bodhisattva.”

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “too” means not only the Blessed One.

original: rjes su gnang ba nyid kyi don du sh'a ri'i bu da de'i dus la bab bar shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba nyid kyi don du sh'a ri'i bu da de'i dus la bab bar shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to give permission, [the Buddha] says, “Śāriputra, if you think the time is right, speak.”

original: don gang smra par bya ba'i phyir da zhes bya ba da ltar dus la bab pa ste /
analyzed: don gang smra par bya ba'i phyir da zhes bya ba da ltar dus la bab pa ste /
translated: Now is the present time, the occasion for speaking about the matter at hand.

original: skabs yin par shes na don de la spobs par byos shig ces bya ba yang dag par mngon du phyogs par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: skabs yin par shes na don de la spobs par byos shig ces bya ba yang dag par mngon du phyogs par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If you understand that the occasion has arrived, then be confident about that matter, that is, be fully committed to it.

original: gnang ba thob pa dang bdag tu lta ba chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: gnang ba thob pa dang bdag tu lta ba chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: Having received permission, he said, I am a great self-appraiser, and so on.

original: de la nga rgyal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i don gyis na bdag ste 'di la nga rgyal skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i don gyis na bdag ste 'di la nga rgyal skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, self means the basis of pride, because pride arises in regard to it.

original: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can no //
translated: It is a sentient being because it has the nature of perishing.

original: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis skal ba mnyam pa'i ris yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas pas na srog go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis skal ba mnyam pa'i ris yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas pas na srog go //
translated: It is life because it endures as long as the life faculty is intact.

original: 'gro ba rnams su yang dang yang du gnas pas na gang zag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su yang dang yang du gnas pas na gang zag go //
translated: It is a person because it repeatedly exists in the destinies of rebirth.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is becoming because it comes into existence.

original: med par 'gyur pas na 'jig pa'o /
analyzed: med par 'gyur pas na 'jig pa'o /
translated: It is destruction because it ceases to exist.

original: sngon byung ba da ltar med pas na chad @50a * //
analyzed: sngon byung ba da ltar med pas na chad @50a * //
translated: It is annihilation because what previously existed no longer exists.

original: pa'o ; / ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa gang yin pa de med par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa gang yin pa de med par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: It is permanent because that which exists by intrinsic reality does not become nonexistent.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam pas phung po lngar lta ba ni rang gi lus su lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam pas phung po lngar lta ba ni rang gi lus su lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the five aggregates as the self and entities connected to the self is the view of one’s own body.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i lta ba la sogs pa log par lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs par lta ba bdag la sogs pa dang chos sgro btags pa'i rnam
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i lta ba la sogs pa log par lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs par lta ba bdag la sogs pa dang chos sgro btags pa'i rnam
translated: The view of this sort and so on refers to the view of the self and so on, such as the view of the perishable collection, wrong view, and the view grasping rules and ritual as paramount, which are the nature of superimposition of the self and so on and of entities onto the aggregates.🔽The teaching of the Dharma is for the sake of abandoning the nature of adherence to the aspects of the self and so on and of entities, that is, for the sake of completely abandoning the latent states together with their associated factors.

original: pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin spang ba'i slad du zhes bya ba bag chags dang bcas pa yongs su dor bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam pas na zhes bya ba spangs pa chen po dang rtogs pa chen po nyid thob pas zhes bya bar🔽bsams pa ste /
analyzed: pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin spang ba'i slad du zhes bya ba bag chags dang bcas pa yongs su dor bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam pas na zhes bya ba spangs pa chen po dang rtogs pa chen po nyid thob pas zhes bya bar🔽bsams pa ste /
translated: The thought is that by attaining great abandonment and great realization,🔽one should reflect on the meaning of the Dharma that has been taught.

original: gzhan du na de kho na nyid lkog tu gyur pas de bshad par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de kho na nyid lkog tu gyur pas de bshad par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be difficult to explain that reality, since it is hidden.

original: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus par spangs pa la rtogs pa khyad par can yod pas de bzhin du rtogs pa chen po nyid bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi bar spobs
analyzed: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus par spangs pa la rtogs pa khyad par can yod pas de bzhin du rtogs pa chen po nyid bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi bar spobs
translated: Therefore is in the sense of “for that reason.”

original: so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is a special realization of the complete abandonment of attachment and so on, the great realization is explained in the same way: “Blessed One, I also have the confidence to speak about the meaning of why a bodhisattva is called a ‘great being.’ ”

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word also means not only others.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub don du gnyer ba'i sems te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub don du gnyer ba'i sems te /
translated: The mind of enlightenment is the mind that seeks enlightenment.

original: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the mind that has the nature of aspiration and engagement.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa la gzhol ba'i sems te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa la gzhol ba'i sems te /
translated: The mind of omniscience is the mind that is directed toward omniscience.

original: lhag par mos par byed pas mos pa spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos par byed pas mos pa spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the stage of action in faith, because it is the cause of faith.🔽The pure thought is on the seven stages, because it is the pure thought of the stage of action in faith.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so sor rtogs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sems te sbyor ba'i sa bdun pa la bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so sor rtogs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sems te sbyor ba'i sa bdun pa la bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The unequalled thought is on the eighth stage, etc., because it is the thought born of evolution.

original: mnyam pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid kyis mnyam pa med pa'i sems te /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid kyis mnyam pa med pa'i sems te /
translated: The thought equal to the unequalled is on the Buddha stage, because it is the thought of equality with all Buddhas, who are unequalled.🔽Or else, the thought of enlightenment is the thought which has become the nature of enlightenment, which is the essence of the non-arising of all things.🔽The pure thought is the thought of the stage of action in faith, because it is the cause of the pure thought.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs par smin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The unequalled thought is on the eighth stage, etc., because it is the thought born of evolution.

original: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pa'i sems ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems te /🔽sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pa'i sems ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems te / sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'o //
translated: The thought equal to the unequalled is on the Buddha stage, because it is the thought of equality with all Buddhas, who are unequalled.

original: yang na byang chub kyi sems ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi rang bzhin du @50b gyur ba'i sems so //
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi sems ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi rang bzhin du @50b gyur ba'i sems so //
translated: Or else, the thought of enlightenment is the thought which has become the nature of enlightenment, which is the essence of the non-arising of all things.

original: de nyid du rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes dang 'brel pas ldog pa'i cha 'ga' zhig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid du rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes dang 'brel pas ldog pa'i cha 'ga' zhig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bshad do //
translated: In that very same way, the yogi/nī's conventional mind is connected with the mirror-like intuition, etc. , and so is explained as having four aspects, the omniscient mind, etc.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: And all of these are not shared in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems de la yang zhes bya ba ni don che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir phyogs su lhung bar 'ongs pa'i sems de lta bu la ma chags pa ste mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: sems de la yang zhes bya ba ni don che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir phyogs su lhung bar 'ongs pa'i sems de lta bu la ma chags pa ste mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: And in that mind means that, because it is of great import, the bodhisattva is not attached to, does not cling to, such a mind that has fallen into a position.

original: yongs su ma zin pa ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma zin pa ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Not seized means not dwelling.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni rtogs pa che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni rtogs pa che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this teaches the greatness of realization.

original: yang gi sgra ni gzhan dag la ha cang yang ches bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gzhan dag la ha cang yang ches bya ba yin no //
translated: The word and means and also.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa dang gnas pa med pa la bsgom pa mi 'thad pas gnyis po 'di dag ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa dang gnas pa med pa la bsgom pa mi 'thad pas gnyis po 'di dag ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to the doubt, “Why is that?” he says, “It is thus,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir brjod ma thag pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems de ni sngar brjod pa'i sems thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa dang chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pas zag pa med pa dang / gnas pa'i gnyen por gyur pas mi gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bur sgom par byed do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod ma thag pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems de ni sngar brjod pa'i sems thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa dang chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pas zag pa med pa dang / gnas pa'i gnyen por gyur pas mi gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bur sgom par byed do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Since that omniscience just mentioned is the antidote to the attachment that is the basis of all the previously mentioned minds, it is uncontaminated, and since it is the antidote to their endurance, it does not endure. Therefore, it is cultivated like an illusory person.

original: sems gang yin pa'i sems de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gang yin pa'i sems de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu pa yin no //
translated: “Whatever mind” and so on concludes the topic.

original: zag pa med pa yin du zin kyang dngos po yod pas mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs par mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin du zin kyang dngos po yod pas mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs par mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, “Why is that?”

original: de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not produced in reality.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Excellent!”

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gsungs pa ltar ston pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gsungs pa ltar ston pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad zin to //
translated: Up to “You are the foremost of those who dwell in the absence of afflictions,” as explained above.

original: don gzhan gyi skabs las 'phros pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan gyi skabs las 'phros pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is a digression on a different topic, there is no fault of repetition.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos//
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos//
translated: The master Dignāga also said:

original: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas //
analyzed: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas //
translated: Again, based on a different meaning,

original: don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin //
analyzed: don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin //
translated: that very meaning is repeated.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: des na de ltar rgyal ba ma pham pa'i ched du bya ba dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //🔽dmigs pa dang ched du @51a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar rgyal ba ma pham pa'i ched du bya ba dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o // dmigs pa dang ched du @51a * //
translated: Thus, the three kinds of aims of the bodhisattva should be understood as being similar to the three aims of the Victorious One, Ajita.

original: bya ba la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /🔽'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'bem la phog pa dang 'dra bar de'i tshe nye ba na gnas pa na dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: bya ba la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na / 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'bem la phog pa dang 'dra bar de'i tshe nye ba na gnas pa na dmigs pa yin la /
translated: What is the difference between the object and the aim?🔽Ārya Vimuktisena explains that the object is like the target, which is close by at the time of the aim,

original: phyis kyi thag ring ba ni phyed du bya ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyis kyi thag ring ba ni phyed du bya ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: and the aim is like the arrow, which is shot far away later.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽The mind of the supreme among all beings,

original: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs dang gsum po la //🔽chen po gsum gyi rang byung gi //
analyzed: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs dang gsum po la // chen po gsum gyi rang byung gi //
translated: the abandonment, and the realization,🔽are the three great aims

original: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: of the self-arisen one.

original: ched du bya ba'i rjes la da ni rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ched du bya ba'i rjes la da ni rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to complete the subject matter, the practice should be stated.

original: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi la mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi la mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the domain of the three knowledges, it is the practice in general of the virtues, and in the four aspects such as the clear realization of all aspects, etc., each clear realization has the practice of the six perfections as its basis.

original: chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa la na mi yin te 'bras bu nyid yin pas de la bya ba yod mi srid do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa la na mi yin te 'bras bu nyid yin pas de la bya ba yod mi srid do //
translated: The clear realization of the body of truth is not a practice because it is the result and it is impossible for it to be a practice.

original: de la 'phags pa thogs med kyis go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub ba dag ni go rims bzhin du brgyud pa dang dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa thogs med kyis go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub ba dag ni go rims bzhin du brgyud pa dang dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the practice of armor and the practice of engagement are respectively the nature of indirect and direct application and are subsumed by the levels of accumulation and the path of earnest aspiration.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub ba ni brtse ba nas brtsams te gzungs kyi bar ni mngon sum du sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos kyi mchog chen pos bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub ba ni brtse ba nas brtsams te gzungs kyi bar ni mngon sum du sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos kyi mchog chen pos bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The group practice beginning from the loving attitude up to the dhāraṇī is included in the great supreme mundane quality, which has the nature of the path of preparation.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la brten pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la brten pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The group practice that has the nature of the first ground, the Joyous, is based on the path of meditation.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin zhing gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni lam gnyi ga'i spyod yul can yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin zhing gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni lam gnyi ga'i spyod yul can yin no //
translated: The group practice that has the nature of the second ground and so on is the essence of the path of meditation and the group practice that is the antidote is the domain of both paths.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la brten pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la brten pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The practice of definite emergence is based on the path of meditation.

original: de ltar sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas dang po go cha'i sgrub
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas dang po go cha'i sgrub
translated: Thus, the nature of the path of preparation, seeing, meditation, and distinction is the nature of the armor, engagement, accumulation, and definite emergence.

original: pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa gang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa gang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: From among them, since it is the nature of effort, in order to teach the first, the armor practice, it is said, “Then the venerable Pūrṇa to the Bhagavān...” and so on.

original: gang po byams ma'i bus zhes bya ba ni gang po nyid la ming gzhan du na byams ma'i bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang po byams ma'i bus zhes bya ba ni gang po nyid la ming gzhan du na byams ma'i bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra is another name for Pūrṇa.

original: yang na rang gi ma byams ma zhes @51b bya ba'i bu yin pas na byams ma'i bu'o //
analyzed: yang na rang gi ma byams ma zhes @51b bya ba'i bu yin pas na byams ma'i bu'o //
translated: Or he is the son of his mother Maitrāyani, so he is Maitrāyaniputra.

original: gang lags pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lags pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is called... is the just-past entity.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sgrub pa 'di don gyis 'phangs pa yin te /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sgrub pa 'di don gyis 'phangs pa yin te /
translated: The great armor is donned is the implicit meaning of this armor practice.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos kyi spyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos kyi spyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha yin no //
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva practices the perfection of generosity, he makes the gift of the Dharma, etc.

original: de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su spangs pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su spangs pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: That very [practice] is the armor of the perfection of morality, because it completely abandons the mental activities of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams la bzod pa dang mos pa dang nye bar rtogs pa dang skye bo thams cad kyi mi snyan par smra ba nyid bzod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams la bzod pa dang mos pa dang nye bar rtogs pa dang skye bo thams cad kyi mi snyan par smra ba nyid bzod pas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: That very [practice] is the armor of the perfection of patience, because it is patience, belief, and realization regarding the dharmas of omniscience, and because it is patience with all beings' unpleasant speech.

original: de nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba gong nas gong du mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs pa bskyed pas na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba gong nas gong du mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs pa bskyed pas na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: That very [practice] is the armor of the perfection of effort, because it generates zeal, etc. in order to increase the roots of virtue more and more.

original: de nyid theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sdo bar byed pa la dmigs pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sdo bar byed pa la dmigs pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the perfection of meditation is the dedication of that root of merit to supreme perfect enlightenment by means of the onepointed mind of that very non-confusion with other vehicles.

original: de nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu'i 'du shes la nye bar gnas pas sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po nye bar ma dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu'i 'du shes la nye bar gnas pas sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po nye bar ma dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the perfection of wisdom is the non-apprehension of the gift, giver, and receiver by means of the perception of the illusion-like nature of that very non-confusion.

original: de ltar na go cha'i sgrub pa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na go cha'i sgrub pa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the first establishment of armor, there are six perfections of giving.

original: de bzhin du de nyid kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the second is the practice of the perfection of morality by means of that very non-confusion.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the practice of the perfection of patience by means of that very non-confusion.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the practice of the perfection of effort by means of that very non-confusion.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the practice of the perfection of meditation.

original: de nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni drug pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na de dag so sor drug tshan drug tu 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag so sor drug tshan drug tu 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Thus, each of the six perfections is sixfold.

original: go cha drug chos mthun pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa drug tu bshad do //
analyzed: go cha drug chos mthun pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa drug tu bshad do //
translated: But the establishment of the armor is explained as sixfold because of the similarity of the six perfections and because of the similarity of the six perfections beginning with giving.

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa las kyang go cha'i sgrub pa bstan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa drug tshan drug tu gsal po kho nar bstan pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa las kyang go cha'i sgrub pa bstan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa drug tshan drug tu gsal po kho nar bstan pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: And in the Twenty-five Thousand, the establishment of the armor is taught, and the six perfections beginning with giving are clearly taught as six groups of six.

original: de la dang por longs spyod la ltos pa med na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: de la dang por longs spyod la ltos pa med na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: There, first, if one is not concerned with wealth, one undertakes morality.

original: @52a * // tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs na bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @52a * // tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs na bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one guards morality, one becomes patient.

original: sdug bsngal bzod na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzod na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: If one is patient with suffering, one undertakes effort.

original: le lo dang bral na bsam gtan rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: le lo dang bral na bsam gtan rdzogs par byed do //
translated: If one is free from laziness, one will perfect meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs ba ni 'jig rten las 'das ba'i shes rab thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs ba ni 'jig rten las 'das ba'i shes rab thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one has perfect meditative stabilization, one will attain supramundane wisdom.

original: de lta pu la sogs pa ni rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir na rim pa 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta pu la sogs pa ni rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir na rim pa 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The order is just as it is stated in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras because it is taught in accordance with the order in which the realizations occur.

original: de skad du yang /🔽de dag so sor sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: de skad du yang / de dag so sor sbyin la sogs //
translated: As it is said:🔽Each of these is included

original: rnam ba drug tu bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: rnam ba drug tu bsdus pa yis //
translated: In the six aspects of generosity and so forth.

original: go cha'i sgrub ba gang yin de //🔽drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub ba gang yin de // drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
translated: The armor practice that is🔽Is explained by six sets of six.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The armor practice is explained by six sets of six.🔽The practice of engagement

original: de ltar go bgos pa la 'jug pa 'byung bas gnyis par 'jug pa'i sgrub ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar go bgos pa la 'jug pa 'byung bas gnyis par 'jug pa'i sgrub ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the practice of engagement, which is the second, the text says:

original: sems dpa' chen po de theg pa chen po la yang dag bar zhugs pa theg pa chen po la yang lag par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de theg pa chen po la yang dag bar zhugs pa theg pa chen po la yang lag par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The great bodhisattva who has properly engaged in the Mahayana, who is established in the Mahayana.

original: theg pa'i sgra ni las dang byed pa sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po 'jug pa'i sgrub pas theg pa chen po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi chos la 'jug pa yin la phyis gong nas gong du khyad par rtogs pas yang dag par gnas
analyzed: theg pa'i sgra ni las dang byed pa sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po 'jug pa'i sgrub pas theg pa chen po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi chos la 'jug pa yin la phyis gong nas gong du khyad par rtogs pas yang dag par gnas
translated: The first two lines state that the Mahayana is the vehicle that enters the Dharma, which is the nature of cause and effect, and the latter two lines state that it is the vehicle that perfectly abides, since it realizes the special qualities of the Mahayana.

original: pa yin pas tshig gnyis smos so //🔽de yang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa 'di don gyis 'phen pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin pas tshig gnyis smos so // de yang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa 'di don gyis 'phen pa yin te /
translated: This is also implied by the first line, which states that🔽it is the vehicle that enters the Dharma, which is the nature of cause and effect, since it is the means of entering the Mahayana.

original: 'di lta ste dang po sems brtan bar byas pas rang gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dang po sems brtan bar byas pas rang gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The first line states that it is the vehicle that enters the Dharma, which is the nature of cause and effect, since it is the means of entering the Mahayana.

original: de'i 'og tu sems brtan par gyur ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la slob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems brtan par gyur ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la slob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug
translated: Then, when the mind becomes stable, one enters the six perfections with the complete purity of the three spheres, i.e., the object given, the giver, and the receiver, in order to train in the collections of merit and intuition.

original: pa'o // de'i 'og tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa kho na la lhag par mos pa'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob ba dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de'i 'og tu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa kho na la lhag par mos pa'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob ba dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, because of the special resolve to accumulate the collections of merit and intuition, one enters the noble path, which has the nature of the paths of vision, cultivation, and no-more-learning.

original: de'i 'og tu chos nyid la gzhol ba ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos nyid la gzhol ba ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, because of the inclination toward reality, one enters the four immeasurables, i.e., love, etc., in order to accomplish the aims of others in accordance with their thoughts.

original: de'i 'og tu gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i 'ching ba ni dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa la sbyor pa'i 'jug pa'o//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i 'ching ba ni dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa la sbyor pa'i 'jug pa'o//
translated: Then, because the bond of engagement for the aims of others is the objective, one enters the non-apprehension of the objective.

original: @52b de'i 'og tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ji ltar 'jug ces las dang byed ba po dang bya ba ma dmigs pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du dngos po thams cad la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: @52b de'i 'og tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ji ltar 'jug ces las dang byed ba po dang bya ba ma dmigs pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du dngos po thams cad la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, endowed with the yoga of realitylessness, how does he engage? By not objectifying action, agent, and object, like an illusory person, he engages in the complete purification of the three spheres with regard to all things.

original: de'i 'og tu de ltar yongs su da par spyod pa rnams rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la 'bad pa'i phyir sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po la sogs pa ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum gyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de ltar yongs su da par spyod pa rnams rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la 'bad pa'i phyir sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po la sogs pa ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum gyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, those who thus engage in complete purification, in order to strive for their own goal, engage in the three kinds of aims, the great thought of supremacy over all beings, and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu ched du bya ba la 'bad pa byas pa rnams ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lha'i mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa drug gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ched du bya ba la 'bad pa byas pa rnams ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lha'i mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa drug gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Then, those who have striven for the aims, in order to strive in the knowledge of others' minds and so forth, engage in the six superknowledges, such as the divine eye.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid du spro ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid du spro ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Then, those who have attained the higher perceptions are engaged in the knowledge of all aspects because they are intent on attaining enlightenment.

original: de ltar na rtogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon pa'i ngo bo nyid 'jug pa'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa dgu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon pa'i ngo bo nyid 'jug pa'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa dgu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the essence of the Great Vehicle that is characterized by correct placement through the stages of realization is the practice of engagement, which has nine aspects.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa ston par byed pa'i gzhung stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs par 'gyur bas 'dir shes par bye dpar ma bris so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa ston par byed pa'i gzhung stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs par 'gyur bas 'dir shes par bye dpar ma bris so //
translated: The text that teaches the practice as explained above is the Twenty-five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra. Fearing too many words, I have not written it here for you to know.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams pa la sogs dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams pa la sogs dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug //
translated: the special practices, and the six superknowledges,

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: in the method of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
translated: are the practice for entering the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should know that it is the ladder🔽for ascending to the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni cho ga dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni cho ga dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means because of possessing the armor and engagement practices.

original: grangs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni btags par ro //
analyzed: grangs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni btags par ro //
translated: “Are counted” means are designated.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes btags pa yin no zhes brjod ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes btags pa yin no zhes brjod ba yin no //
translated: This is saying that because of possessing the two, the armor and engagement practices, one is designated a “great being.”

original: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la tshogs skye ba yin pa'i phyir gsum pa tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bcu bdun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la tshogs skye ba yin pa'i phyir gsum pa tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bcu bdun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the accumulation of merit arises in one who has thus engaged, the third, the practice of the accumulation, should be explained as seventeenfold.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: brtse dang sbyin la sogs ba drug //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin la sogs ba drug //
translated: The six consisting of love and giving,🔽and calm abiding and insight,🔽the path of union,

original: zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas ba dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa @53a * //
analyzed: zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas ba dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa @53a * //
translated: and skill in means,🔽and knowledge and merit,🔽and the path, and the powers, and the ten stages,

original: gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
translated: and the accumulation of antidotes,

original: rim pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa yin par shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the sequence should be understood.

original: de lta bas na de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa ni /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: go cha chen bo bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: go cha chen bo bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The great armor is donned,” and so on.

original: ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni grangs ji tsam du nges par 'chad pa'i don gyi chos gzhan dang ldan pas zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni grangs ji tsam du nges par 'chad pa'i don gyi chos gzhan dang ldan pas zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: “To what extent?” means “by how many is it determined?” The meaning is that it is explained as having other qualities.

original: gang gi phyir go cha'i sgrub pa dang snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang ldan pa go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa de las don gyis 'phangs pa'i go cha'i sgrub
analyzed: gang gi phyir go cha'i sgrub pa dang snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang ldan pa go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa de las don gyis 'phangs pa'i go cha'i sgrub
translated: The practice of armor that is implied by that is endowed with the practice of armor.🔽The donning of the great armor has just been taught.🔽Now, it is endowed with the collection of compassion, etc.

original: ba dang ldan pa go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes ni bstan ma thag pa yin la da ltar ni snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa la yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ba dang ldan pa go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes ni bstan ma thag pa yin la da ltar ni snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa la yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: khong nas phyung ba'i tshig gi lan btab pa ni rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: khong nas phyung ba'i tshig gi lan btab pa ni rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The reply that is drawn from within is stated by “Subhūti, here” and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi nye bar dgod pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi nye bar dgod pa la'o //
translated: “Here” refers to the presentation of the words.

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni sems 'di lta bur skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni sems 'di lta bur skye ba'o //
translated: “Thinking like this” is the arising of this kind of thought.

original: de nyid ni bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: “That itself is mine” and so on is stated.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be measured by direct perception and other means of valid knowledge.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is nirvana because it causes the attainment of nirvana in the three vehicles according to the aspirations of beings.

original: grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is incalculable because it is beyond the count of one, two, etc.

original: 'di skad du ston te snying brtse ba dang bral zhing thabs dang mi ldan pas ni gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang mya ngan las zlo ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston te snying brtse ba dang bral zhing thabs dang mi ldan pas ni gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang mya ngan las zlo ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is taught because it is impossible for anyone to attain nirvana without compassion and skill in means.

original: snying rjes yid gdungs pa rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'das pa'i dus kyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / bzod pa dang / spro ba dang sems rtse gcig pas 'bras bu gcig tu nges pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir bzod pa dang /
analyzed: snying rjes yid gdungs pa rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'das pa'i dus kyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / bzod pa dang / spro ba dang sems rtse gcig pas 'bras bu gcig tu nges pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir bzod pa dang /
translated: Those whose minds are tormented by compassion are helped to past happiness by the perfection of generosity, to future happiness by the perfection of moral discipline, and to the attainment of the definite goodness of liberation by the perfections of patience, diligence and concentration.

original: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis gcig tu nges pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gtan du pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrubs pas na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis gcig tu nges pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gtan du pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrubs pas na /
translated: And they are helped to the definite goodness of happiness by the perfections of patience, diligence and concentration and to the eternal bliss of buddhahood by the perfection of wisdom.

original: @53b thabs su gyur pa sbyin ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin ba drug la gnas pa dang 'dra bar /
