analyzed: @53b thabs su gyur pa sbyin ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin ba drug la gnas pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: Thus, by the six transcendent perfections, which are the means, they are cared for and become like the buddhas themselves, abiding in the six transcendent perfections.

original: de nyid la yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'jog pa dang rab tu 'jog pas mi g-yel bas rab tu gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don gyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'jog pa dang rab tu 'jog pas mi g-yel bas rab tu gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don gyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the indirect suggestion of the meaning.

original: de ltar na tshogs bdun bstan par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshogs bdun bstan par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the seven stores are taught:

original: 'di ltar snying rje'i tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang / bzod pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / shes rab kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje'i tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang / bzod pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / shes rab kyi tshogs so //
translated: the store of compassion, the store of giving, the store of morality, the store of patience, the store of effort, the store of meditation, and the store of wisdom.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin thob pas byed pa po dang las su nye bar dmigs pa med do zhes gsungs pa ni /🔽gang gis gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems de dag kyang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin thob pas byed pa po dang las su nye bar dmigs pa med do zhes gsungs pa ni / gang gis gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems de dag kyang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the statement, The one who attains concentration does not apprehend an agent or an action,🔽 means that there is no mind whatsoever that attains nirvana.

original: de ltan ni dmigs su med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltan ni dmigs su med do zhe na /
translated: If one says, But it is not apprehended,🔽 the statement is,

original: des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: By that, etc.

original: snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sems can gzhal du med pa grangs med pa ji snyed pa de dag kun rdzob tu yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sems can gzhal du med pa grangs med pa ji snyed pa de dag kun rdzob tu yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar byed pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses the collection of compassion and so on completely liberates all those sentient beings, as many as there are, who are immeasurable and innumerable, conventionally.

original: gal te de lta na ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, then there is an object of observation?

original: gang gis gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: gang gis gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: It is said, “By whom is that which is completely liberated,” and so on.

original: don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it is because ultimately it is not an object of observation.

original: dngos po gcig la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med par ji ltar rung snyam pa'i dogs pa de de ci 'phyir zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med par ji ltar rung snyam pa'i dogs pa de de ci 'phyir zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt, “How can it be both an object of observation and not an object of observation in one thing?” is anticipated with “Why is that?”

original: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and it is said, “Subhūti, the reality of an illusion,” and so on.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i chos nyid ni mthong ba ji lta bar bden gyi rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i chos nyid ni mthong ba ji lta bar bden gyi rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin te /
translated: For example, the reality of an illusion is seen as it is, but it is not true because it is not tenable by reasoning.

original: des na rigs pa'i 'jug pas sun ma phyung la /🔽'jig rten thams cad kyis snang ba tsam du gtogs pa ste dpe nyid du nye bar bzung zhing blangs ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na rigs pa'i 'jug pas sun ma phyung la / 'jig rten thams cad kyis snang ba tsam du gtogs pa ste dpe nyid du nye bar bzung zhing blangs ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, it is not refuted by rational cognition.

original: yul tha dad pa las ldog pa la ltos nas rab tu brtags pas na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa rang bzhin 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir te 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa las ldog pa la ltos nas rab tu brtags pas na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa rang bzhin 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir te 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the nature of phenomena such as form, etc., because, in dependence on the exclusion of different objects, the imagined object and non-object are not mutually exclusive.

original: yul gcig la ldog pa la ltos te chos gnyi gar rtogs na ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gcig la ldog pa la ltos te chos gnyi gar rtogs na ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one understands both phenomena in dependence on the exclusion of one object, there is a fault.

original: gnyis po @54a * //
analyzed: gnyis po @54a * //
translated: These two

original: 'di dag ni phan tshun du phyin ci log ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan tshun du phyin ci log ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: are stated in order to eliminate mutual error.

original: de kho na nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not in reality,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as previously explained.

original: 'dis ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the requisites for meditative serenity.

original: zhi gnas thob pa rnams la lhag mthong skye bas lhag mthong gi tshogs ni ;
analyzed: zhi gnas thob pa rnams la lhag mthong skye bas lhag mthong gi tshogs ni ;
translated: For those who have attained serenity, insight arises.🔽The equipment for insight is as follows.

original: rab 'byor dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: mkhas pa ni byang ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni byang ba'o //
translated: Skilled means trained.

original: sgyu ma bye dpa'i nye gnas ni de'i slob ma'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma bye dpa'i nye gnas ni de'i slob ma'o //
translated: The magician's apprentice is his student.

original: lam po che'i bzhi mdor zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: lam po che'i bzhi mdor zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The crossroads is mentioned

original: sgyu ma sprul ba'i gnas kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma sprul ba'i gnas kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the main place for conjuring illusions.

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen po ni sems can yi tshogs rnams so //🔽mngon par sprul te zhes bya ba ni sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen po ni sems can yi tshogs rnams so // mngon par sprul te zhes bya ba ni sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: A great crowd of people is a multitude of sentient beings.🔽Manifesting means conjuring.

original: mi snang bar byas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar byas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Having made them invisible means having withdrawn them.

original: de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag par gsungs pa'i don gyi tshogs de la ji snyam du sems shing khong du chud ces spyir dri ba mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag par gsungs pa'i don gyi tshogs de la ji snyam du sems shing khong du chud ces spyir dri ba mdzad nas /
translated: What do you think about this? Having asked in general about the meaning of the just-mentioned equipment,

original: 'on te 'di snyam du sems sam zhes gsungs ba ni de la chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du sems sam zhes gsungs ba ni de la chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase Or do you think? refers to the passage that begins There is no dharma that is killed.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i tshogs de'i nang nas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i tshogs de'i nang nas so //
translated: There refers to the group of people.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma byed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma byed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: By someone is meant a magician, etc.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: By someone else is meant Devadatta, etc.

original: bsad pa 'am zhes bya ba ni tshe nyams pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bsad pa 'am zhes bya ba ni tshe nyams pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: By killed is meant the destruction of life.

original: shi ba ni thams cad du rgyun chad bas so //
analyzed: shi ba ni thams cad du rgyun chad bas so //
translated: Dead means that the continuum has been completely severed.

original: bshig pa ni lus ma tshang ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bshig pa ni lus ma tshang ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: Destroyed means that the body has been mutilated.

original: mi snang bar byas pa ni mi mthong bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar byas pa ni mi mthong bar byas pa'o //
translated: Made to disappear means that he is no longer seen.

original: yod kyi sgra ni de lta bu'i don la yin la /
analyzed: yod kyi sgra ni de lta bu'i don la yin la /
translated: The word only has that meaning.

original: dam pa'i sgra ni srid pa la yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i sgra ni srid pa la yin no //
translated: The word existence means existence.

original: 'di snyam du de kho na nyid du na chos can med pas 'di dag thams cad yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de kho na nyid du na chos can med pas 'di dag thams cad yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The idea is that In reality, since there is no dharma that is killed, none of this is the case.

original: ji ltar mthong pa ni srid pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong pa ni srid pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: What is seen is only existence.

original: dgongs pa shes pa nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: dgongs pa shes pa nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One is not so means that he is not so in reality.

original: de kho na nyid du na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is clear.

original: dpe'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i dngos po mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i dngos po mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the meaning of the example and to apply it to the intended meaning,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says Subhūti, it is just so, etc.

original: de la rgya cher bstan pa nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rgya cher bstan pa nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize the extensive explanation, he says If, etc.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'o //
translated: Such refers to the immediately preceding.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las ma 'das pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las ma 'das pas so //
translated: Such refers to not transcending conventional and ultimate reality.

original: ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni gang brjod pa @54b de'i lan du 'di tsam gyis zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni gang brjod pa @54b de'i lan du 'di tsam gyis zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: To what extent? refers to the question, and To this extent, etc. is the answer.

original: 'di skad ston te snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs 'di tsam dang ldan pas kyang go cha chen po bgos pa zhes btags pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad ston te snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs 'di tsam dang ldan pas kyang go cha chen po bgos pa zhes btags pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught: even one who possesses this much of a collection of compassion and so on is designated as “one who has donned the great armor.”

original: lhag mthong gis stong ba nyid la dmigs pa na nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ltung bar 'gyur bas de'i de ma thag tu zung du 'brel pa'i tshogs ni /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis stong ba nyid la dmigs pa na nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ltung bar 'gyur bas de'i de ma thag tu zung du 'brel pa'i tshogs ni /
translated: When one focuses on emptiness with insight, one falls into the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and so on. Therefore, immediately after that, the collection of the union is taught:

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: “Oh! Just as the Bhagavān has taught…” and so on.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni des par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni des par bzung ba'o //
translated: The word “oh!” is an expression of certainty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: “Just as the Bhagavān has taught” refers to “if one takes up the reality of illusion…” and so on.

original: /'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni 'di yin pa'i phyir zhes sgyu ma'i chos nyid khyab par byas pa'i rnam pa gang gis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba'i rnam pa des na sgyu ma'i chos nyid las ma 'das pas byang chub
analyzed: /'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni 'di yin pa'i phyir zhes sgyu ma'i chos nyid khyab par byas pa'i rnam pa gang gis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba'i rnam pa des na sgyu ma'i chos nyid las ma 'das pas byang chub
translated: “I think that the Blessed One has taught the illusion-like reality of phenomena in such a way that I understand the meaning in terms of the pervasion ‘because this is the reality of phenomena.’ In that way, since it does not go beyond the reality of illusion,

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos pa lags pa'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos pa lags pa'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: that bodhisattva mahāsattva is one who has donned the armor of non-armor.”

original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because of the correctness itself, it is said, “Subhūti, it is so,” and so forth.

original: lhag mthong gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang sems can gyi don sgrub par go cha bgos pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang sems can gyi don sgrub par go cha bgos pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it that by means of insight one dons the armor for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings through the knowledge of all aspects and through the sky-treasury meditative stabilization and so forth?

original: ji ltar na go cha med pa yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na go cha med pa yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhuti, etc.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rig pas byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rig pas byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unmade means that there is no cause for its making by a creator.

original: rnam par ma bsgyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par ma bsgyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unaltered means that there is no cause for its destruction.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed rkyen gnyi ga yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed rkyen gnyi ga yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-compounded means that it is not tenable that both co-operating conditions exist.

original: yang na tshig gsum go rims bzhin du med pa las byung ba dang / de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pa'i dbang du mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig gsum go rims bzhin du med pa las byung ba dang / de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pa'i dbang du mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the three words should be understood as referring to the arising from non-existence, the going beyond that, and the realization of the attainment of the result, respectively.

original: dig pa ldan pa nyid kyis na khas blangs ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: dig pa ldan pa nyid kyis na khas blangs ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
translated: Since he is endowed with the virtue of non-attachment, he says, Blessed One, it is so, etc.

original: 'ching ba dang 'grol ba yod na ma byas pa la sogs pa 'di ji ltar yin zhes 'ga' zhig rtsod pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du @55a * //
analyzed: 'ching ba dang 'grol ba yod na ma byas pa la sogs pa 'di ji ltar yin zhes 'ga' zhig rtsod pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du @55a * //
translated: If there were bondage and liberation, how could there be non-performance, etc.?

original: zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Someone might argue thus:🔽Why is it so, Blessed One?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One replies:

original: gzhan du khas blangs nas rnam par spyod pa mi 'thad pas 'di ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du khas blangs nas rnam par spyod pa mi 'thad pas 'di ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since it is not tenable to engage in analysis by accepting something else, this would be incoherent.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others as well.

original: lhag par sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa sems dang sems las byung ba khams gsum pas bcings pa me dpa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa sems dang sems las byung ba khams gsum pas bcings pa me dpa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings pa'o //
translated: Form is not bound because the mind and mental factors that engage in the aspect of superimposition are not bound by the three realms.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i rtogs pa dang bral ba me dpas grol ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i rtogs pa dang bral ba me dpas grol ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba ste /
translated: It is not liberated because it is devoid of the realization described above, and there is no liberation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de kho nar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de kho nar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, etc. do not exist in reality.

original: 'o na chos bcings ba dang grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos bcings ba dang grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, phenomena would be bound and liberated!

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhuti, form is not bound, nor is it liberated.

original: chos can med na chos yod pa mi 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
analyzed: chos can med na chos yod pa mi 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
translated: Since the existence of a phenomenon is not tenable without a basis, the emptiness of form, etc. is not bound nor liberated.

original: ji ltar mthong ba ltar ni gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i de bzhin nyid dag bcings pa dang grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba ltar ni gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i de bzhin nyid dag bcings pa dang grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that, as it is seen, form, etc. and its suchness are bound and liberated.

original: rab 'byor gyi bsam pa ma shes nas brgal ba'i sgo nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi bsam pa ma shes nas brgal ba'i sgo nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: Not understanding Subhuti’s intention, he objects, “Venerable Subhuti . . .

original: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of the question is this:

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i de bzhin nyid ma bcings ma grol zhes zer na spyir ni de skad brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i de bzhin nyid ma bcings ma grol zhes zer na spyir ni de skad brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: If you say that form, etc. and its suchness are not bound nor liberated, in general, that should not be said,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it would contradict direct perception, etc.

original: ji ste 'o na de khyad par du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste 'o na de khyad par du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is a special case,

original: 'on te tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'on te tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Or, Venerable Subhūti, and so on is stated.

original: rnam par brtag cing gzhig mi bzod pa nyid kyis na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid sgyu ma'i skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas spyi'i sgo nas /
analyzed: rnam par brtag cing gzhig mi bzod pa nyid kyis na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid sgyu ma'i skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas spyi'i sgo nas /
translated: Since it cannot be analyzed and destroyed, the thought The Buddha, Bodhisattvas, and so on are illusory beings is generally held.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i gzugs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i gzugs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, the form of the illusory man and so on is stated.

original: 'di dag ji ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar thal bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar thal bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Fearing that this would lead to the consequence of contradicting direct perception and so on, Why is that? is said.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Since it is not real, and so on is stated.

original: kha cig na re rigs pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir te brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par brtags pa ni dben pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rigs pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir te brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par brtags pa ni dben pa'i phyir te /
translated: Some say: Form and so on imputed by reasoning are not real because they are false and imputed form is devoid of form because it is isolated from form.🔽

original: @55b rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dang / chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba zhes 'dod do //🔽gzhan dag ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad mas gzhigs na mi snang bas na /
analyzed: @55b rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dang / chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba zhes 'dod do // gzhan dag ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad mas gzhigs na mi snang bas na /
translated: Some believe that the form etc. imagined by reasoning is not real because it is false, and that the form etc. discriminated is not real because it is void, i.e. devoid of its own essential nature, and that the essential nature of the dharmata is not real because it is unarisen.🔽They believe that these are not bound and not liberated.

original: de kho na nyid du skye ba la sogs pa rnam par bkag cing bsal bas yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du skye ba la sogs pa rnam par bkag cing bsal bas yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others believe that the three phrases beginning with unreal refer to the negation and refutation of origination etc. in reality because they are not perceived when investigated by the valid cognition of direct perception, inference and scriptural tradition.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa /
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa /
translated: That which is the nature of appearance

original: de ni dgag pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni dgag pa ma yin te //
translated: is not a negation.

original: nyams su myong ba gang yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gang yin no //
translated: That which is experienced

original: dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: is not suitable as a negation.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ji ltar snang ba bzhin du bcings pa dang grol ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar gal 'gyur zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ji ltar snang ba bzhin du bcings pa dang grol ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar gal 'gyur zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: In this way, since bondage and liberation are posited just as they appear, how can there be a contradiction with direct perception, etc.?🔽This is the thought.

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: These are the summaries.🔽The great armor is the absence of armor.

original: go cha chen po ste go cha med pa'o zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du snying rje dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po ste go cha med pa'o zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du snying rje dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate are the remainder.

original: lan med par cang mi smra bar gnas pa ni de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan med par cang mi smra bar gnas pa ni de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The reply is the silence.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag ni mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gcig la ji ltar srid ce na /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag ni mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gcig la ji ltar srid ce na /
translated: Since calm abiding and insight are incompatible, how can they exist in one place?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe zhi gnas kyis dmigs pa la sems brtan par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba skye bas snang ba byung bar gyur pa'i mun pa dang 'dra bar sgrib pa rnam par
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe zhi gnas kyis dmigs pa la sems brtan par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba skye bas snang ba byung bar gyur pa'i mun pa dang 'dra bar sgrib pa rnam par
translated: Thus, when the mind becomes stable on the meditative object through serenity, the light of perfect knowledge arises from the discernment by wisdom.

original: sel ba yin no //
analyzed: sel ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it removes obscurations, as light removes darkness.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis ni mig dang snang ba dang 'dra bar yang dag pa'i ye shes skyed pa dang phan tshun rjes su mthun par gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mun pa dang snang ba dang 'dra bar phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis ni mig dang snang ba dang 'dra bar yang dag pa'i ye shes skyed pa dang phan tshun rjes su mthun par gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mun pa dang snang ba dang 'dra bar phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not mutually exclusive, like light and darkness, because they are like eyes and light, producing perfect knowledge and abiding in mutual harmony.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mun pa'i rang bzhin la yin gyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mun pa'i rang bzhin la yin gyi /
translated: Concentration is not of the nature of darkness.

original: 'o na ji zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: It is the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes gsungs pas gcig tu shes rab dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes gsungs pas gcig tu shes rab dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Moreover, it is said that one who is equipoised knows the reality of things just as it is. Thus, there is no contradiction, since it is entirely consistent with wisdom.

original: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyi tshogs dang ldan pa la thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa 'byung bas thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhu ba'i don du gleng slong ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyi tshogs dang ldan pa la thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa 'byung bas thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhu ba'i don du gleng slong ba ni /
translated: Thus, since the accumulations of the path of union give rise to skill in means and so on, in order to teach the accumulations of skill in means and so on, the questions are raised.🔽The questions are raised in the passage beginning with the words,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs @56a * //🔽pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs @56a * // pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Blessed One, in that way.

original: sngar brjod pa'i tshul de ltar go cha chen po bgos par gyur pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de la theg pa chen po ma shes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i tshul de ltar go cha chen po bgos par gyur pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de la theg pa chen po ma shes pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the great armor is donned in the way described above, one will enter the Great Vehicle. Since the Great Vehicle is not understood,

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba dang / de gnyis phan tshun tha mi dad pa dang ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'das pa dang gnas skabs nges pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtogs pa po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba dang / de gnyis phan tshun tha mi dad pa dang ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'das pa dang gnas skabs nges pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtogs pa po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: and the realization of the result.🔽With regard to the one who realizes,

original: gang gang ltar gong nas gong du gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gang ltar gong nas gong du gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is said, “Whatever, in whatever way, from whatever, and to whatever extent,🔽how is there definite emergence?”🔽This is the sixfold question of the teacher.

original: gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa'i dris pa drug yin no zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa'i dris pa drug yin no zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said by Ārya Vimuktisena.

original: de la thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to teach the collection of skillful means and so on,

original: dris pa dang po'i lan ni /
analyzed: dris pa dang po'i lan ni /
translated: the answer to the first question

original: rab 'byor theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is “Subhūti, the so-called Mahāyāna” and so on.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las //
translated: In the noble Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra,

original: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med gnyis kyi dngos por ni //
analyzed: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med gnyis kyi dngos por ni //
translated: The Mahayana is summarized in the five topics, the nature, the eight consciousnesses, the two kinds of selflessness,

original: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
translated: and the three natures.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin yang tshogs kyi skabs kyi stobs kyi thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas 'di gtsor btags pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin yang tshogs kyi skabs kyi stobs kyi thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas 'di gtsor btags pa yin no //
translated: Although this is stated, the term “Mahayana” is primarily designated to the incalculable collections of skillful means such as the powers that are mentioned in the context of the collections.

original: yang ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la gzhal du med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la gzhal du med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is the collection of skillful means and so on called incalculable?

original: 'di ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said that “it is immeasurable because it is beyond measure.”

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos po nyid ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su ma bcad pas na gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos po nyid ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su ma bcad pas na gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The things that are explained cannot be measured because they are not ascertained by means of valid cognition such as direct perception.

original: 'di skad ston te zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad ston te zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught: the accumulation of the path of union is the accumulation of skill in means because it is the mental attention that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs shes pa ni ye shes la slob pa yin pas ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs shes pa ni ye shes la slob pa yin pas ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The knowledge of the accumulation of skill in means is the training in wisdom, and so it is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de yang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa nyi shur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa nyi shur shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as having twenty aspects through the divisions of inner emptiness and so on.

original: de la stong ba nyid nyi shu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la stong ba nyid nyi shu ni 'di yin te /
translated: The twenty kinds of emptiness are as follows.

original: 'di lta ste nang gi dngos po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ther zug tu gnas pa dang @56b 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nang gi dngos po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ther zug tu gnas pa dang @56b 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the inner refers to the eyes and so on, because their nature is not to be found as permanent or perishable.

original: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the outer refers to outer forms and so on, because their nature is like that.

original: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin de lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since the nature of the internal and external sense-fields is thus, there is emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: de la nang gi skye mched rnams ni dbang po'i rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //🔽phyi ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi skye mched rnams ni dbang po'i rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o // phyi ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The internal sense-fields are those which are included in the nature of the sense-faculties.🔽The external are those which are included in the nature of the sense-objects.

original: phyi nang ni dbang po'i rten gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang ni dbang po'i rten gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The internal and external are those which are included in the nature of the sense-faculties and their objects.

original: de ni sems kyis zin pa nyid kyis na nang yin la /
analyzed: de ni sems kyis zin pa nyid kyis na nang yin la /
translated: They are internal because they are taken hold of by the mind.

original: dbang pos ma bsdus pa nyid kyis na phyi'ang yin no //
analyzed: dbang pos ma bsdus pa nyid kyis na phyi'ang yin no //
translated: They are external because they are not included in the nature of the sense-faculties.

original: stong ba nyid 'di gsum ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la yin no //
analyzed: stong ba nyid 'di gsum ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la yin no //
translated: These three kinds of emptiness are on the stage of action through faith.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong ba nyid kyang stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong ba nyid kyang stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the emptiness which is the nature of the knowledge that has the emptiness of the internal, etc. as its object, because all dharmas are empty.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa tsam nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa tsam nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: The mere knowledge that all phenomena are emptiness is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: des kyang stong pa nyid stong pa yin te der 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang stong pa nyid stong pa yin te der 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is the emptiness of emptiness because it eliminates the conception that apprehends emptiness.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i lam la'o //
translated: This is on the path of preparation.

original: phyogs bcu po ni phyogs kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu po ni phyogs kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po stong ba nyid de /
translated: The ten directions are the emptiness of the great because they are empty of the ten directions.

original: de rnams ni dbyibs che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni dbyibs che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the great because they are the great shape.

original: 'di ni kun tu 'gro ba'i don gyis nas dang po la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun tu 'gro ba'i don gyis nas dang po la'o //
translated: This is on the first ground, in the sense of being all-pervading.

original: don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa stong ba nyid de /
translated: The ultimate, nirvana, is the emptiness of the ultimate because it is empty of the nature of the meaning of nirvana.

original: de ni bral pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bral pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is merely the absence of that.

original: 'di ni mchog gi don nyid kyis na sa gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog gi don nyid kyis na sa gnyis pa la'o //
translated: This is on the second ground, in the sense of being the supreme.

original: 'dus byas pa khams gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa khams gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is because the conditioned, which is the three realms, is empty of the desire realm, etc.

original: de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du bya bar nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du bya bar nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is capable of acting as the antidote itself, due to its very nature of being unproduced.

original: 'di ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog nyid kyis sa gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog nyid kyis sa gsum pa la'o //
translated: This is on the third stage, due to the supremacy of the goal that is its natural outcome.

original: 'dus ma byas skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa ni de nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa ni de nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned is because the unconditioned, which is unarisen, unceasing, and not otherwise, is empty of just that.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi btags pa'i rgyu mtshan mi mthun pa'i zlas skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi btags pa'i rgyu mtshan mi mthun pa'i zlas skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the reasons for the designations of the unarisen, etc., are incompatible with the opposites, such as arising, etc.

original: 'di ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis na bzhi ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis na bzhi ba la'o //
translated: This is on the fourth stage, due to the meaning of being without appropriation.

original: mtha' ni mthas @57a * //
analyzed: mtha' ni mthas @57a * //
translated: The extreme is the extreme of existence.

original: stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' las 'das pa nyid kyis na mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' las 'das pa nyid kyis na mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is emptiness, it is the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes, because it transcends extremes.

original: mtha' ni cha ste de la chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi dbus na de dag gi cha rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis de'i rang bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa de ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: mtha' ni cha ste de la chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi dbus na de dag gi cha rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis de'i rang bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa de ni ci yang med do //
translated: An extreme is a part. In the middle between the two extremes of annihilation and permanence, there is no reason for positing the nature of that, since it is the exclusion of those parts.

original: 'di ni rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis na lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis na lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth, in the sense of the nondifferentiation of causes.

original: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams kyi de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis mtha' nyid shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams kyi de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis mtha' nyid shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the emptiness of those, beginning, middle, and end, it is the emptiness of beginningless and endless, etc., because the nature of those is utterly nonexistent.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par dag pa'i don gyis na drug pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par dag pa'i don gyis na drug pa la'o //
translated: This is the sixth, in the sense of the purification of the absence of afflictions.

original: bral zhing spangs la yongs su btang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dor ba las bzlog pa nyid kyis na dor pa med pa ste de ni des stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral zhing spangs la yongs su btang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dor ba las bzlog pa nyid kyis na dor pa med pa ste de ni des stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the opposite of the rejection which has the characteristic of being separated from, abandoned, and given up. It is not rejected because it is empty of that.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni dor ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyis na spangs par btags pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni dor ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyis na spangs par btags pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of nonrejection is not a basis for the designation of abandonment because it is not the nature of an action such as rejection, etc.

original: 'di ni tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis na bdun pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis na bdun pa la'o //
translated: This is the seventh emptiness, in the sense of the nondifference of the two.

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pa ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pa ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of all noble ones is not made by any noble one.

original: de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is empty of that, hence the emptiness of nature.

original: de la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par 'gyur pa dang rnam par mi 'gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par 'gyur pa dang rnam par mi 'gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not impaired by the transformation or nontransformation of the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: chos rnams ni chos rnams kyis stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong ba nyid de 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi tshogs thams cad ni phan tshun ltos pa can yin pas na rang bzhin yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams ni chos rnams kyis stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong ba nyid de 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi tshogs thams cad ni phan tshun ltos pa can yin pas na rang bzhin yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is that phenomena are empty of phenomena, because all phenomena are empty of their own specific natures.

original: stong ba nyid gnyis ni 'grib pa dang 'phel pa med pa'i don dang rnam par mi rtog pa dang zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba gnyis kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sa nyid yin pas so sor rtog pa yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas
analyzed: stong ba nyid gnyis ni 'grib pa dang 'phel pa med pa'i don dang rnam par mi rtog pa dang zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba gnyis kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sa nyid yin pas so sor rtog pa yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the level of fruition, because it is the basis for the two kinds of nonconceptual gnosis and for mastery of the completely pure buddha field, and because it is the meaning of the absence of decrease and increase.

original: sa brgyad pa la'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the eighth level,🔽because it is the level of overmastering the dhyana and other kinds of concentration of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni de'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i spyi dang khyad par ni btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni de'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i spyi dang khyad par ni btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form and so on are empty of the characteristics of form and so on, such as being suitable as form and so on, because the universals and instances that are posited as characteristics are mere imputations.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams la phan tshun bzlog na dmigs su med pa nyid kyis na mi dmigs ba stong pa nyid de dus rnams ni dngos po la btags @57b pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams la phan tshun bzlog na dmigs su med pa nyid kyis na mi dmigs ba stong pa nyid de dus rnams ni dngos po la btags @57b pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past and so on are empty of the nonobservation of the past and so on, because the past and so on are mere imputations on things.

original: stong ba nyid gnyis po 'di dag ni ye shes la dbang pa'i rten nyid yin pas na de bzhin du dgu pa la'o //
analyzed: stong ba nyid gnyis po 'di dag ni ye shes la dbang pa'i rten nyid yin pas na de bzhin du dgu pa la'o //
translated: These two kinds of emptiness are the basis for mastery of wisdom, and so they are the ninth.

original: sbyor ba las byung pa'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas tshogs ni des stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung pa'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas tshogs ni des stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid de /
translated: Since the collection is empty of that, it is the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings.

original: dngos po rnams ni tshogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni tshogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things are merely a collection.

original: dngos po nye bar len pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po nye bar len pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po stong ba nyid de /
translated: Since the essential nature of the appropriated aggregates is empty of that, it is the emptiness of things.

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don yin la spungs pa yang don med pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don yin la spungs pa yang don med pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of “aggregate” is the meaning of “collection,” and since a collection is meaningless, it is not suitable as the reason for the essential nature of appropriated things.

original: stong pa nyid gnyis po 'di dag ni las la dbang ba'i rten du gyur pa nyid kyis na snga ma bzhin dus bcu pa la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gnyis po 'di dag ni las la dbang ba'i rten du gyur pa nyid kyis na snga ma bzhin dus bcu pa la'o //
translated: These two kinds of emptiness are in the tenth ground, as before, because they are the basis for mastery over karma.

original: dngos po med cing 'dus ma byas pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po med cing 'dus ma byas pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of nonthings is that space and so on, which are not things and are not compounded, are empty of themselves.

original: dngos po'i chos sgrib par byed pa la sogs pa med pa las de btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos sgrib par byed pa la sogs pa med pa las de btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is imputed from the nonexistence of the phenomena of things, such as obscuration and so on.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grags pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi shes pa dang mthong bas ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grags pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi shes pa dang mthong bas ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo stong ba nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the emptiness of its own entity because it is not created by the knowledge and seeing of noble beings.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge and seeing are the clear manifestation of the correct meaning just as it is.🔽The emptiness of other entities is the emptiness of that which is created by another because it is empty of another creator, as it is said, “Whether the tathāgatas appear or not, this dharmatā of phenomena remains.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di gnas pa'o zhes bya bas byed pa po gzhan gyis stong ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid de stong ba nyid la brten pa'i skyes bu'i bya
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di gnas pa'o zhes bya bas byed pa po gzhan gyis stong ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid de stong ba nyid la brten pa'i skyes bu'i bya
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena because they are not observed.

original: ba ni dub pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;🔽; stong pa nyid gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ba ni dub pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ; ; stong pa nyid gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: because it is exhausted in some places.

original: rang byung nyid yin pa'i don gyis na sangs rgyas kyi sa la yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byung nyid yin pa'i don gyis na sangs rgyas kyi sa la yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds of emptiness should be known as existing on the Buddha ground, because they are the very abandonment of the afflictive obstructions together with their instincts, because they are the very basis of the abandonment of the objective obstructions together with their instincts, and🔽because they are the very meaning of self-arising.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes skabs don yang phyogs 'dis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes skabs don yang phyogs 'dis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Ārya Vimuktisena also should be understood in this way.

original: gang dag gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig kho na rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig kho na rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Those who say that emptiness is only expressed by way of negating other things

original: de dag la mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba @58a * //
analyzed: de dag la mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba @58a * //
translated: say that there is not the slightest order of realization in those.

original: de dag gi ltar na skabs kyi don kho na brjod par bya ba yin gyi bstan bcos kyi don ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na skabs kyi don kho na brjod par bya ba yin gyi bstan bcos kyi don ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: According to them, the topic at hand is the only thing to be expressed, and the meaning of the treatise is not the main point.

original: des na stong pa nyid kyi bye brag rnams sod zin pa dang bgrod par bya ba'i go rims dang bral ba'i phyir na ched du bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid kyi bye brag rnams sod zin pa dang bgrod par bya ba'i go rims dang bral ba'i phyir na ched du bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since the distinctions of emptiness are already finished, and there is no order in which they are to be traversed, the purpose is lost.

original: yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'di'i dmigs pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'di'i dmigs pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of this nonconceptual wisdom?

original: kha cig ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it is emptiness.

original: gzhan dag ni de chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid la dmigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid la dmigs par 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that it observes the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena.

original: 'di nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the correct position.

original: gang dang gang zhes pa yin pa de dang de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong ba nyid la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes pa yin pa de dang de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong ba nyid la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is the case, it observes the emptiness that is the nature of all phenomena.

original: dper na rmi lam du rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid la dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam du rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid la dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like observing the emptiness of the nature of horses and so on in a dream.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid 'di yang shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //🔽dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid 'di yang shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
translated: This nonconceptual mind, which is the basis of dispute, is also a consciousness. This is a natural inference.🔽An object is not directly perceived.

original: don mthong rab tu 'grub ma yin /
analyzed: don mthong rab tu 'grub ma yin /
translated: Seeing an object is not established.

original: zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it exists in similar instances, it is not contradictory.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du yod pa ni phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du yod pa ni phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The existence of the nature of all phenomena as reality will be refuted later, so it is not indefinite.

original: gang dmigs pa de ni med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa de ni med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't an object that is observed nonexistent?

original: dper na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a second moon and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'di yang dmigs pa yin pas med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'di yang dmigs pa yin pas med par 'gyur la /
translated: Since this emptiness of the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is also an object, it would be nonexistent.

original: des na chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena would exist.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' lha spyin lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe sod par byed pa rang gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' mchod sbyin dang 'dra ba de stong pa nyid kyis bsad pa na slar 'byung pa ma yin pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' lha spyin lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe sod par byed pa rang gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' mchod sbyin dang 'dra ba de stong pa nyid kyis bsad pa na slar 'byung pa ma yin pa'i
translated: When that is killed by emptiness, it does not arise again.

original: phyir ro // gzhan yang dmigs pa ni de kho na nyid du mi 'grub kyi /🔽kun rdzob tu yul du gnas pa nyams su myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pas 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod par mi bya'o//
analyzed: phyir ro // gzhan yang dmigs pa ni de kho na nyid du mi 'grub kyi / kun rdzob tu yul du gnas pa nyams su myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pas 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod par mi bya'o//
translated: Moreover, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality,🔽but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.🔽In the context of the object of negation, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality, but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.🔽In the context of the object of negation, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality, but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.

original: stong ba nyid la dmigs pa'i phyogs la ye shes stong pa'i spyod yul can dang stong pa nyid 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong ba nyid la dmigs pa'i phyogs la ye shes stong pa'i spyod yul can dang stong pa nyid 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the context of the object of negation, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality, but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.🔽In the context of the object of negation, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality, but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.🔽In the context of the object of negation, one should not say that the object of negation is not established in reality, but that it is a contradiction because it is ultimately experienced as an object in the conventional.

original: go rims bzhin du ye shes dang de'i stong pa nyid dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad pa dang tha dad pa yin par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ye shes dang de'i stong pa nyid dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad pa dang tha dad pa yin par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the order, i.e., the emptiness of the intuition and the object of intuition are not discriminated as different or not different, as entity and non-entity.

original: me long lta bu'i @58b ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod de ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par gzhag pa ni phyogs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i @58b ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod de ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par gzhag pa ni phyogs tsam du zad do //
translated: There is much more to be said about the differentiation of the mirror-like intuition, etc., but this is only a brief presentation of the accumulation of intuition.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni zhar la brjod pa yin gyi da lta kho na ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni zhar la brjod pa yin gyi da lta kho na ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The differentiation is a digression, but the entire accumulation of intuition is not understood at this time,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims lhag ma ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims lhag ma ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the remaining order of realization is to be taught.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: And so it is to be understood in the other cases as well.

original: ye shes la goms pa dang ldan pa la ni shes rab rnam par dag pa dang yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa las bsod nams 'byung pas na bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ye shes la goms pa dang ldan pa la ni shes rab rnam par dag pa dang yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa las bsod nams 'byung pas na bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: For one who is familiar with intuition, merit arises from the performance of the aims of beings by means of pure wisdom, right concentration, etc. Thus, it is the accumulation of merit.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la goms par byas bas ni dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa la 'bad pas na lam gyi tshogs so //🔽lam dang ldan pa ni yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ri mor byed pa'i yi ge de des bskal ba mang por chos ston pa rgyu'i dran pa yongs su
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la goms par byas bas ni dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa la 'bad pas na lam gyi tshogs so // lam dang ldan pa ni yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ri mor byed pa'i yi ge de des bskal ba mang por chos ston pa rgyu'i dran pa yongs su
translated: For one who is familiar with the accumulations of merit and intuition, the path of thorough understanding, etc. is the path of effort. Thus, it is the accumulation of the path.

original: gtugs pa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na dran pas kyang gzhung dang don 'dzin pas na gzungs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gtugs pa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na dran pas kyang gzhung dang don 'dzin pas na gzungs kyi tshogs so //
translated: For one who is endowed with the path, the letter A is the door of all dharmas because it is originally unborn. Thus, by means of that letter, the accumulation of retention is the retention of the text and meaning by memory, because one is able to teach the Dharma for many eons without exhaustion of the cause, and because of the method called retention.

original: de ltar thabs mkhas pa'i tshogs la sogs pa lnga po 'di dag stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las theg pa chen po'i sgras rgya cher bstan pa yin pas som nyi mi bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar thabs mkhas pa'i tshogs la sogs pa lnga po 'di dag stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las theg pa chen po'i sgras rgya cher bstan pa yin pas som nyi mi bya'o ;
translated: Thus, these five, the accumulation of skillful means and so on, are extensively taught in the Twenty-five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra with the word “great vehicle,” so do not doubt this.

original: / gzungs thob pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par nyid ni /
analyzed: / gzungs thob pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par nyid ni /
translated: The distinctive state of attaining retention

original: rtogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i rten byed pa'i tshul gyis dang / de la brten pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi yin pa'i tshul gyis sa yin no zhes sa'i tshogs bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: rtogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i rten byed pa'i tshul gyis dang / de la brten pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi yin pa'i tshul gyis sa yin no zhes sa'i tshogs bstan pa'i don du /
translated: is the ground because it serves as the support for the realization of each subsequent stage and because it is the basis for the qualities that are supported by that.🔽In order to teach the accumulation of the grounds,

original: rab 'byor gang yang 'di skad du theg pa chen po la ji ltar yang dag par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa'i tshig 'brel par bya ba'i don du brjod nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang 'di skad du theg pa chen po la ji ltar yang dag par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa'i tshig 'brel par bya ba'i don du brjod nas /
translated: Subhūti, in order to connect the discussion with the question, “How does one enter the great vehicle?” and so on,

original: lan gsungs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgo nas yang dag par 'jug go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan gsungs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgo nas yang dag par 'jug go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the answer is given: “One enters correctly by means of the perfections.”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par shas che ba sa bcus bsdus pa bcu po rnams kyis rim gyis yang dag par 'jug go zhes 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas sa'i tshogs brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par shas che ba sa bcus bsdus pa bcu po rnams kyis rim gyis yang dag par 'jug go zhes 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas sa'i tshogs brjod pa yin no //
translated: The ten stages are included in the ten perfections, such as generosity, which are predominant. He enters them gradually. This is the statement of the stages in terms of the result.

original: 'di skad ston te /🔽de la gang gi tshe chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bsgoms pas cha med pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs su zin kyang des pa bskyed pa la ltos nas kun tu 'gro pa'i don @59a * //
analyzed: 'di skad ston te / de la gang gi tshe chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bsgoms pas cha med pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs su zin kyang des pa bskyed pa la ltos nas kun tu 'gro pa'i don @59a * //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gyis so sor rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo med par mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa shin tu gsal par skye bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par zhugs pas mthong pa'i lam thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyis so sor rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo med par mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa shin tu gsal par skye bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par zhugs pas mthong pa'i lam thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one meditates on the selflessness of all phenomena, one realizes the realm of phenomena in its entirety through its partlessness. However, in dependence on the generation of the perfection of wisdom, one realizes the meaning of the all-pervading through the realization of the individual. Therefore, the knowledge that directly perceives the realitylessness of all phenomena arises very clearly. At that time, the bodhisattva who has entered the faultless state attains the path of seeing.

original: 'dir yang 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin
translated: Here, desire, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view, the afflicted view of holding a view as paramount, and the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices

original: pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa bzhi'i dbye bas bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa bzhi'i dbye bas bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: are each divided into four in the desire realm by way of the four truths.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su ni de dag bden pa bzhi'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba khong khro ba brgyad bton na bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su ni de dag bden pa bzhi'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba khong khro ba brgyad bton na bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, in the form and formless realms, if one removes the eight types of anger that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the four truths, there are seventy-two.

original: spyir bsdom sa na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong ste /
analyzed: spyir bsdom sa na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong ste /
translated: In general, one abandons one hundred and twelve afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: bden pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realization of the truths is the same.

original: de bas na dang po'i skad cig ma dang po ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dang po'i skad cig ma dang po ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: Therefore the first moment is the path of seeing.

original: de las gzhan pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje lta bur brjod pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam gang las de ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyis kun tu 'od 'thob pa'i bar 'di dag ni mchog gi don la sogs par chos kyi dbyings
analyzed: de las gzhan pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje lta bur brjod pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam gang las de ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyis kun tu 'od 'thob pa'i bar 'di dag ni mchog gi don la sogs par chos kyi dbyings
translated: The second moment and so on until the vajra like concentration are the uninterrupted path that is the supreme state and so on.🔽

original: so sor rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam yin par bshad do //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam yin par bshad do //
translated: The path of meditation is explained as the path of meditation that is the supreme object and so on, because it individually realizes the dharmadhatu.

original: de la yang nyon mongs pa bcu drug ci rigs par rim gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: de la yang nyon mongs pa bcu drug ci rigs par rim gyis spong ngo //
translated: Moreover, it gradually abandons the sixteen afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste 'dod par spyod pa drug go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste 'dod par spyod pa drug go //
translated: They are the six that are engaged in the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, the afflicted view of the self and the extreme view.

original: de dag nyid pas zhe sdang bton na gzugs dang gzugs med par spyod pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid pas zhe sdang bton na gzugs dang gzugs med par spyod pa bcu yin no //
translated: If anger is extracted from those, there are ten that are engaged in the form and formless realms.

original: mthong pa dang bsgom pa'i lam la yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi dbye bas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mthong pa dang bsgom pa'i lam la yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi dbye bas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcur rnam par gzhag go //
