translated: The path of seeing and the path of cultivation are established as the ten stages, such as the Joyous, by the classification of the dharmas of thorough purification.

original: de la yang sa gang gi yongs su spyod bar gyur pa'i chos gang yin ba rnams ji srid ma rdzogs pa de srid du ni sa de yin la /
analyzed: de la yang sa gang gi yongs su spyod bar gyur pa'i chos gang yin ba rnams ji srid ma rdzogs pa de srid du ni sa de yin la /
translated: Moreover, as long as the dharmas of thorough purification of a certain stage are not complete, that is that stage.

original: yongs su rdzogs nas ni sa gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs nas ni sa gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: But when they are complete, it should be known that it is another stage.

original: de la yongs su spyod par gyur pa'i chos 'di rnams ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba las bstan to //
analyzed: de la yongs su spyod par gyur pa'i chos 'di rnams ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba las bstan to //
translated: These dharmas of thorough purification are taught in the Twenty-five Thousand.

original: 'di lta ste dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don du theg pa chen po'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / @59b tshad med pa bzhi sgrub pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor pas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don du theg pa chen po'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / @59b tshad med pa bzhi sgrub pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor pas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang /
translated: They are as follows: the accomplishment of all wholesome dharmas, the retention of the Mahayana dharmas for the sake of sentient beings, the accomplishment of the four immeasurables, the giving away of all possessions through nonconceptual application,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la ltos pa med pas dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa ma lus pa yongs su tshol pa dang / rtag tu khyim gyi gnas la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la ltos pa med pas dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa ma lus pa yongs su tshol pa dang / rtag tu khyim gyi gnas la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral pa dang /
translated: They are to delight the spiritual masters, to seek the entire focus of the sacred teachings without regard for the vehicle of the listeners, to never delight in the household life, to never be separated from keeping in mind the unsurpassed body of the Buddha in all its aspects,

original: mdo la sogs pa'i dam pa'i chos ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa dang / dam bcas pa'i don rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i dam pa'i chos ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa dang / dam bcas pa'i don rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: to teach the sacred teachings of the sutras and so forth in accordance with reality and to fulfill the meaning of one's promises.

original: rgyu'i khyad par yongs su sbyong pa'i chos bcu po 'di rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba rnams kho nas dang po sngon ma byung
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par yongs su sbyong pa'i chos bcu po 'di rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba rnams kho nas dang po sngon ma byung
translated: These ten qualities of thorough training are the causes that completely generate the distinctive qualities of the first bodhisattva level.

original: ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pas rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pas rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa yin no //
translated: Because of realizing the reality of the Dharma, one attains the first stage, the Joyous, because of attaining the joy.

original: de skad du yang /🔽yongs su sbyong pa rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: de skad du yang / yongs su sbyong pa rnam bcu yis //
translated: And it is said:

original: sa ni dang po 'thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: sa ni dang po 'thob 'gyur te //
translated: The first stage is attained by ten kinds of thorough preparation:🔽the nature of thought and benefit,

original: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
analyzed: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
translated: equality of thought toward all beings,🔽giving, reliance on spiritual benefactors,🔽seeking the holy Dharma,🔽always having the thought of renunciation,

original: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas bkur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
analyzed: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas bkur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
translated: the desire to honor the Buddha,🔽joy,🔽teaching the Dharma,🔽and the words of truth.

original: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //🔽'di ga rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //🔽yong su spyor par shes par bya //
analyzed: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod // 'di ga rang bzhin mi dmigs pas // yong su spyor par shes par bya //
translated: These are considered the ten.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The thorough preparation is to be understood as the nonapprehension of their intrinsic reality.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dang sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byed pa rnam par spangs pa dang / gzhan gyi phan pa byas pa chud mi gzan pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dang sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byed pa rnam par spangs pa dang / gzhan gyi phan pa byas pa chud mi gzan pa dang /
translated: The morality of gathering virtuous dharmas is to be completely pure in all aspects of morality, to avoid the mental engagements of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and to not waste the benefit done to others.

original: sems can rnams kyi thad du gnod pa la sogs pa'i sems med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa la 'gyod pa med pa dang / sems can gcig gi don du yang dus ring bor dmyal pa la sogs par gnas par spro pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi thad du gnod pa la sogs pa'i sems med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa la 'gyod pa med pa dang / sems can gcig gi don du yang dus ring bor dmyal pa la sogs par gnas par spro pa dang /
translated: The morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is to have no thoughts of harming sentient beings and so on, to have no regret about ripening sentient beings, and so on, and to delight in remaining in the hells and so on for a long time for the sake of a single sentient being.

original: skye bo thams cad la 'dud pa nyid dang / bla ma'i thad nas des bstan pa'i tshig bsgrub cing ston par 'du shes pa dang / las gzhan med par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhing spro ba ste /🔽de lta bu'i yongs su @60a * //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad la 'dud pa nyid dang / bla ma'i thad nas des bstan pa'i tshig bsgrub cing ston par 'du shes pa dang / las gzhan med par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhing spro ba ste /🔽de lta bu'i yongs su @60a * //
translated: The morality of subduing the māras is to bow to all beings, to practice the words taught by the guru and to perceive the guru as a buddha, and to be diligent and delight in the perfections such as generosity without other activities.

original: spyod ba snga ma bzhin du yongs su spyad ba byas pa'i khyad par can gyi chos rnam pa brgyad kyis tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral pas sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod ba snga ma bzhin du yongs su spyad ba byas pa'i khyad par can gyi chos rnam pa brgyad kyis tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral pas sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa thob pa yin no //
translated: By means of the eight special qualities of the practice of the former perfections, he attains the second stage, the Immaculate, because it is free from all stains of immorality.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:🔽Morality, gratitude,

original: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
analyzed: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
translated: patience,

original: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che ;
analyzed: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che ;
translated: great joy, great compassion,

original: / bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
analyzed: / bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
translated: respect for the guru,

original: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson //
analyzed: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson //
translated: and the eightfold noble path

original: zhes bya ba gzungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzungs pa yin no //
translated: are the causes of the second stage.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'dzin pa'i bsam pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams de nyid du yongs su bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'dzin pa'i bsam pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams de nyid du yongs su bsngo ba dang /
translated: The eight special qualities of the practice of the former perfections are: the intention to hold the Dharma taught by all the Buddhas; the teaching of the true Dharma without regard for profit, etc.; the dedication to that very stage of the qualities which purify the Buddha-field;

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phir nam yang sems skyo ba med pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa la sogs par rang dang gzhan la ltos na ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa ste de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa lnga po snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mi rtog par yongs su
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phir nam yang sems skyo ba med pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa la sogs par rang dang gzhan la ltos na ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa ste de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa lnga po snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mi rtog par yongs su
translated: Thus, through the five kinds of thorough training, as before, without conceptualizing an intrinsic nature,

original: sbyang ba byas pas /
analyzed: sbyang ba byas pas /
translated: they thoroughly train in the three vehicles.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because they illuminate the light of supramundane wisdom, they realize the third ground, The Luminous.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As said:

original: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
translated: Not being satisfied with listening,🔽giving the gift of Dharma without materiality,🔽purifying all buddhafields,🔽not being discouraged by saṃsāra,

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //
analyzed: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //
translated: and being ashamed and embarrassed—

original: rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: these five are the self without conceit.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa'i sbyor pas thob par bya ba'i byang chub la yang 'dod pa med pa dang / dngos bo khyad par can thob tu zin kyang rom pa med pa dang ; chos zab mo la bzod pa'i nges par rtog pa pa la sogs pa yongs su me gtong ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa'i sbyor pas thob par bya ba'i byang chub la yang 'dod pa med pa dang / dngos bo khyad par can thob tu zin kyang rom pa med pa dang ; chos zab mo la bzod pa'i nges par rtog pa pa la sogs pa yongs su me gtong ba dang /
translated: It is to be isolated from the mental engagements of śrāvakas and so forth, to have no desire for the enlightenment that is attained through the application of reference points, to have no attachment even though one has attained special things, to never give up the ascertainment of the realization of the forbearance of the profound dharma,

original: bslab pa blangs pa thams cad srog gi phyir yang yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa la sems kyang mi bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / rang gi lus la sogs par yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bslab pa blangs pa thams cad srog gi phyir yang yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa la sems kyang mi bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / rang gi lus la sogs par yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang /
translated: to never give up any of the trainings even for the sake of one’s life, to not give rise to desire, to not form concepts about any phenomena, to not grasp at one’s own body, and so forth,

original: dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa la sems mi zhum pa dang / dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa la sems mi zhum pa dang / dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and to not be discouraged about focusing on virtuous dharmas. It is to not pay attention to anything at all.

original: de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma lta bu rnam pa bcus nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa'i 'bar ba dang nye bar ldan pa'i phyir sa @60b bzhi ba 'od 'phro ba can gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma lta bu rnam pa bcus nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa'i 'bar ba dang nye bar ldan pa'i phyir sa @60b bzhi ba 'od 'phro ba can gnod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the fourth stage, the Blazing, is so called because it is endowed with a blaze that burns up all the fuel of the addictions by means of the ten kinds of thorough clearing away as described above.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:🔽Dwelling in the forest, having few desires, being content,🔽being pure, being disciplined, not forsaking the training,

original: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
analyzed: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
translated: despising the desires, renouncing all one has,

original: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
translated: not shrinking from the teachings, and having no false views.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so it is said:

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du khyim pa dang rab tu byung pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar mi rton pa dang / skye bo mang por 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du khyim pa dang rab tu byung pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar mi rton pa dang / skye bo mang por 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa dang /
translated: Not associating with householders and monks for the sake of profit, etc. ; not relying on the faithful; not going about among many people; not praising oneself or disparaging others;

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bcu dang / thos pa la sogs pas rlom zhing gzhan la mi 'dud pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas la sogs pa'i blo gros ngan pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bcu dang / thos pa la sogs pas rlom zhing gzhan la mi 'dud pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas la sogs pa'i blo gros ngan pa dang /
translated: and the six perfections such as generosity that are not fully completed are the ten bad thoughts.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mngon du phyogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mngon du phyogs par byed pa ste /
translated: All the afflictions such as attachment are directed toward objects.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcu ni byang chub kyi bar du gcod par 'gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spong zhing don gyis 'phangs pa go bzlog pa'i chos yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa bcus /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcu ni byang chub kyi bar du gcod par 'gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spong zhing don gyis 'phangs pa go bzlog pa'i chos yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa bcus /
translated: Since these ten characteristics of Dharma are obstacles to enlightenment, they are abandoned. Through the ten trainings that reverse the meanings of the above,

original: snga ma bzhin du shin tu dka' bas rgyal ba'i phyir sa lnga ba sbyang dka' ba 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du shin tu dka' bas rgyal ba'i phyir sa lnga ba sbyang dka' ba 'thob pa yin no //
translated: one attains the fifth ground, Hard to Overcome, through great difficulty, as before.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As said:🔽Familiarity, attachment to home,

original: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni ;
analyzed: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni ;
translated: and dwelling in crowds,

original: / bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log //
analyzed: / bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log //
translated: conceit, arrogance, and error,

original: blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
analyzed: blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
translated: bad thoughts and the afflictions.

original: bcu po 'di ni rnams spangs na //
analyzed: bcu po 'di ni rnams spangs na //
translated: Having abandoned these ten,

original: sa lnga ba ni yang dag 'thob //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa lnga ba ni yang dag 'thob // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one attains the fifth ground.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la mngon par 'dod pa dang / ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la skrag pa'i sems dang / slong mo pa'i skye bos bslangs na zhum pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la mngon par 'dod pa dang / ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la skrag pa'i sems dang / slong mo pa'i skye bos bslangs na zhum pa'i sems dang /
translated: By perfecting the six perfections such as generosity, one abandons the desire for the states of Hearers and Solitary Realizers, the fear of not observing the nature, the discouraged mind when asked by beggars,

original: bdog pa thams cad rang gi dang gis gtong bar zhugs pa la mi dga' ba dang / dbul pas slong mo ba'i skye bo spong ba'i sems 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad rang gi dang gis gtong bar zhugs pa la mi dga' ba dang / dbul pas slong mo ba'i skye bo spong ba'i sems 'dor ba ste /
translated: the displeasure in engaging in giving away all one's possessions, and the mind that abandons those who beg from the poor.

original: de lta bu'i snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyor ba bcu gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa kun shes par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyor ba bcu gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa kun shes par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, through the twelve thorough preparations as before, all the qualities of buddhahood are actualized, and so the sixth ground, The Manifest, is fully understood.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Through the perfection of generosity, ethics, patience, diligence,

original: bsam gtan shes rab rab @61a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab rab @61a * //
translated: Meditative stabilization, and wisdom,

original: rdzogs pas // slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
analyzed: rdzogs pas // slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
translated: The disciples and the rhinoceroses🔽Abandon the minds of joy and fear,

original: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs dang // bslangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
analyzed: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs dang // bslangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
translated: And when asked, they do not despair,🔽And even if they have nothing, they give everything away,

original: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas //
analyzed: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas //
translated: And even if they are poor, they do not reject the beggars.

original: sa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
analyzed: sa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
translated: Thus they attain the sixth ground, The Manifest.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //🔽stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med ba dang / smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no // stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med ba dang / smon pa med pa ste /
translated: And so it is said.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yang dag par shes pas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yang dag par shes pas /
translated: Through the correct understanding of the three doors of liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—

original: go rims bzhin du bdag dang / sems can dang / srog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa mi gtong bas /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bdag dang / sems can dang / srog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa mi gtong bas /
translated: It is the complete perfection of the ten virtuous actions, which are free from the grasping at self, sentient being, and life, and are completely pure of the three spheres.

original: gang zag gcig tu 'dzin pa spong ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i skye po thams cad la dmigs pa'i snying brtse ba rtogs pas /
analyzed: gang zag gcig tu 'dzin pa spong ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i skye po thams cad la dmigs pa'i snying brtse ba rtogs pas /
translated: It is the abandonment of the grasping at a single person and the realization of the compassion that focuses on all beings who are tormented by suffering.

original: chad par 'dzin pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su rdzogs pa nas nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: chad par 'dzin pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su rdzogs pa nas nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the grasping at annihilation and the realization of the complete perfection of the buddha-field.

original: dngos po thams cad la nye bar ma dmigs pas rtag par 'dzin pa las rnam par bzlog pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la nye bar ma dmigs pas rtag par 'dzin pa las rnam par bzlog pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas /
translated: It is the abandonment of the grasping at permanence, which is the non-apprehension of all things, and the realization of the equality of all phenomena.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa dang / theg pa chen po nyid du theg pa gcig par gtogs pas rgyur 'dzin pa spangs pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ma skyes par yongs su shes pas phung por 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa dang / theg pa chen po nyid du theg pa gcig par gtogs pas rgyur 'dzin pa spangs pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ma skyes par yongs su shes pas phung por 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
translated: It is free from apprehending characteristics, free from apprehending causes by being included in the single vehicle of the Mahāyāna, free from apprehending the aggregates by thoroughly knowing that name and form and so on are unarisen,

original: chos zab mo la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa rtogs pas khams su 'dzin pa spangs pa dang / chos thams cad theg pa chen po'i sgo nas ston pa'i phyir skye mched du 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rtog pa thams cad gcod pas khams gsum pa la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa bcad pa dang /
analyzed: chos zab mo la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa rtogs pas khams su 'dzin pa spangs pa dang / chos thams cad theg pa chen po'i sgo nas ston pa'i phyir skye mched du 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rtog pa thams cad gcod pas khams gsum pa la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa bcad pa dang /
translated: free from apprehending the sense bases by teaching all phenomena through the Mahāyāna, free from apprehending the three realms by cutting the abode of the three realms through cutting all conceptuality,

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sbong bas /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sbong bas /
translated: and free from apprehending the view of the transitory collection and so on and the afflictions such as attachment by abandoning apprehending characteristics.

original: chags par 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / zhi gnas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems kun tu zhum pa'i 'dzin pa las bral ba dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: chags par 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / zhi gnas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems kun tu zhum pa'i 'dzin pa las bral ba dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: They are free from the grasping of attachment, free from the grasping of mental depression due to the power of their cultivation of serenity, and free from the grasping of mental excitement due to the power of their cultivation of insight.

original: sangs rgyas su lta ba la mngon par zhen ba ma yin pa dang / chos bdag med pa bsgoms pas sems nye bar zhi ba'i phyir chos su lta ba la mngon bar zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes skyes pas dge 'dun du @61b lta ba la mngon par zhen pa bsal ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su lta ba la mngon par zhen ba ma yin pa dang / chos bdag med pa bsgoms pas sems nye bar zhi ba'i phyir chos su lta ba la mngon bar zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes skyes pas dge 'dun du @61b lta ba la mngon par zhen pa bsal ba dang /
translated: They are not fixated on the view of the Buddha because of their skill in wisdom and means. They are not fixated on the view of the Dharma because of the pacification of the mind through the cultivation of the selflessness of phenomena. They have eliminated the fixation on the view of the Saṅgha because the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to form and so on, which is based on the two truths, has arisen.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i ye shes thob pas tshul khrims su lta ba la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba dang / chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mnyam du 'gro bas na stong pa nyid la rtsod par 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i ye shes thob pas tshul khrims su lta ba la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba dang / chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mnyam du 'gro bas na stong pa nyid la rtsod par 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
translated: Since they go everywhere in all buddha realms as they wish in order to perfectly discern phenomena, they are free from the grasping that disputes emptiness.

original: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du bdag gi lus ji ltar mthun par ston pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du bdag gi lus ji ltar mthun par ston pas na /
translated: Since they display their bodies in all realms in whatever way is suitable in order to liberate the realms of sentient beings who cling to objects,

original: stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar brjod pa'i 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar brjod pa'i 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: they have completely abandoned the grasping that describes emptiness as contradictory.

original: de ltar na yongs su sbyong ba'i chos rnam pa nyi shu po snga ma bzhin du khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su sbyong ba byas pa rtogs pas na ji skad du bshad pa'i chos rnam pa nyi shu dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par lhun
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su sbyong ba'i chos rnam pa nyi shu po snga ma bzhin du khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su sbyong ba byas pa rtogs pas na ji skad du bshad pa'i chos rnam pa nyi shu dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par lhun
translated: Thus, the twenty aspects of complete training are the complete training that has the characteristics of distinction, as before.🔽

original: gyis grub pa'i lam dang 'brel pas shin tu ring du 'gro ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gyis grub pa'i lam dang 'brel pas shin tu ring du 'gro ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba thob pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one attains the seventh ground, Gone Far Beyond, because one is connected with the path of authentic spontaneous accomplishment, since one has realized the twenty aspects of thorough training, which are characterized by distinction, as before, and because one is utterly far advanced.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As said:

original: spang bar bya ba'i chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the phenomena to be eliminated,🔽clinging to self and sentient beings,🔽to life force and person, to annihilation and permanence,

original: bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtag dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag pa ni //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtag dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag pa ni //
translated: to characteristics, causes, aggregates,🔽elements and sense sources,

original: khams gsum pa la gnas dang chags //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la gnas dang chags //
translated: to abiding in and attachment to the three realms,🔽to a completely deflated mind,

original: sems ni kun tu zhum pa dang ; ; dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims la //
analyzed: sems ni kun tu zhum pa dang ; ; dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims la //
translated: and to the three jewels and discipline,

original: der lta ba yi mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni //
analyzed: der lta ba yi mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni //
translated: The clinging to the view of the perishable aggregates,🔽The dispute about emptiness, and the faults🔽That contradict it,

original: nyi shu gang la rnam chad pa //
analyzed: nyi shu gang la rnam chad pa //
translated: Are all eliminated.

original: de yis sa ni bdun pa 'thob //
analyzed: de yis sa ni bdun pa 'thob //
translated: And so one attains the seventh ground.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin la de bzhin du blang bar bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin la de bzhin du blang bar bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: And similarly, with regard to what is to be adopted,🔽One knows the three doors of liberation,🔽The three spheres are completely pure,🔽One has compassion, is free of conceit,

original: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rje dang ni rlom med dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rje dang ni rlom med dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes //
translated: Knows the sameness of phenomena and the single principle,🔽Knows nonarising and cessation,

original: mi skye ba dang zad shes dang // chos rnams rnam pa gcig tu ston //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang zad shes dang // chos rnams rnam pa gcig tu ston //
translated: And teaches the single mode of phenomena.🔽One completely destroys all concepts,

original: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
analyzed: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
translated: And abandons the view of discriminations and afflictions.🔽One is certain in one's mental quiescence,

original: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa ngang //🔽sems dul ba dang thams cad la //
analyzed: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa ngang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la //
translated: And skilled in special insight.🔽One's mind is disciplined,🔽And one has unobstructed gnosis with regard to everything.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gar 'dod par //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gar 'dod par //
translated: One is not on the level of attachment, but goes wherever one wishes.

original: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
translated: and they manifest their own bodies everywhere.

original: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa @62a * //
analyzed: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o // zhes gsungs pa @62a * //
translated: These are the twenty.

original: yin no // sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs su sems can gyi don du rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang / rten gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su sgyur ba dang /
analyzed: yin no // sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs su sems can gyi don du rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang / rten gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su sgyur ba dang /
translated: They know the mental behavior of all sentient beings, they play with the superknowledges for the sake of sentient beings in various worldly realms, they transform the support, the buddha-field, into the nature of gold and so forth,

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos yongs su brtag par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par byed pa dang / lha'i mig skyed pa dang / rten pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing sems can yongs su spyod ba dang / thams cad du sgyu ma lta bur gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos yongs su brtag par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par byed pa dang / lha'i mig skyed pa dang / rten pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing sems can yongs su spyod ba dang / thams cad du sgyu ma lta bur gnas pa dang /
translated: they please the tathagatas in order to fully investigate the Dharma in all aspects, they generate the divine eye, they purify the support, the buddha-field, they abide like an illusion everywhere,🔽and they manifest the body of the tathagata.

original: sems can gyi don mthong nas blo sngon du btang ba'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mthong nas blo sngon du btang ba'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “taking up birth in order to see the welfare of sentient beings and to be of service to them.”

original: de lta bu'i yongs su spyod pa'i chos rnam pa brgyad snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyangs pas mtshan ma dang rtsol bas bskyod du med pa'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yongs su spyod pa'i chos rnam pa brgyad snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyangs pas mtshan ma dang rtsol bas bskyod du med pa'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, by completely purifying the eight aspects of conduct, as before, one experiences the eighth bhumi, Unshakable, because it cannot be shaken by signs or effort.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:🔽Knowing the minds of all sentient beings,🔽playing with the superknowledges,🔽accomplishing a good buddhafield,

original: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang sgrub pa dang // yongs su brtag phyir sangs rgyas bsten //
analyzed: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang sgrub pa dang // yongs su brtag phyir sangs rgyas bsten //
translated: and relying on the Buddha for the sake of investigation.

original: dbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi //🔽zhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
analyzed: dbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi // zhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
translated: The knowledge of the faculties,🔽purifying the buddhafield, abiding like an illusion,🔽taking rebirth as one wishes,

original: ces bya bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: these are explained as the eight kinds of activity.

original: smon lam mtha' yas pa dang / lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / spobs pa chu bo ltar mi zad pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa dang / rgyal bo la sogs par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: smon lam mtha' yas pa dang / lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / spobs pa chu bo ltar mi zad pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa dang / rgyal bo la sogs par gnas pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the languages of all sentient beings, including gods, the inexhaustible eloquence that is like a river, entering the womb with the praise of all beings, being born in a royal family,

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i rus dang / ma la sogs pa dang legs bar 'brel ba'i gnyen dang / rang dbang du 'gyur ba'i 'khor dang / brgya byin la sogs pas mngon par bstod par skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pas bskul te nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i rus dang / ma la sogs pa dang legs bar 'brel ba'i gnyen dang / rang dbang du 'gyur ba'i 'khor dang / brgya byin la sogs pas mngon par bstod par skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pas bskul te nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: having a name such as Sūrya, having relatives such as a mother who are well connected, having a retinue that is independent, being born with praise from Śakra and so on, being urged to definitely leave by buddhas and so on,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i shing aa shvad tha la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i shing aa shvad tha la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: having a birth tree such as an aśoka tree that is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, and the perfection of the qualities that are the essence of all buddhas.

original: de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba bcu gnyis snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par dag gis chos ston pa la mkhas pa kha na ma thob med pa'i phyir sa dgu ba legs pa'i blo gros mngon🔽du byed pa yin @62b no ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba bcu gnyis snga ma bzhin du yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par dag gis chos ston pa la mkhas pa kha na ma thob med pa'i phyir sa dgu ba legs pa'i blo gros mngon du byed pa yin @62b no ;
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has thoroughly purified the twelve characteristics of excellence, as before, manifests the ninth ground, Good Intelligence, because he is skilled in teaching the Dharma without fault.

original: ; de skad du yang /
analyzed: ; de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:🔽Infinite prayers,🔽knowledge of the languages of gods and so on,🔽confidence like a river,

original: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa'i mchog dang ni //
analyzed: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa'i mchog dang ni //
translated: and the best entry into the womb,🔽family, clan, and caste,

original: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni //🔽nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi //🔽yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni // nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi // yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin //
translated: retinue, and birth,🔽and renunciation, the tree of enlightenment,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: are the excellent qualities of the bodhisattva.

original: rigs kyi sa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs so //
translated: The family stage is the family of śrāvakas and so on.

original: brgyad pa'i sa ni 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa ni 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The eighth stage is the entry to the first result.

original: mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: The level of seeing is the level of the stream-enterer.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The level of thinning is the level of the once-returner.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o ;
translated: The level of separation from attachment is the level of the non-returner.

original: ; byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: ; byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The level of the realized is the level of the arhat.

original: khyad par gyi tshig med pas zhugs pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig med pas zhugs pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
translated: Since the words “special” are not mentioned, the three approachers are the levels of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sa'o //
translated: The level of the pratyekabuddha is the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnams pa dgu po ji skad du bshad zin pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnams pa dgu po ji skad du bshad zin pa rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattva levels are the nine levels of the bodhisattvas as they have been explained.

original: sa dgu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sa dgu po rnams las 'das nas sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas nyid ces brjod bar bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs
analyzed: sa dgu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sa dgu po rnams las 'das nas sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas nyid ces brjod bar bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs
translated: Having transcended the nine such levels, the bodhisattva on the tenth level is called a buddha but not a perfect buddha.

original: pas / sangs rgyas kyi sa gang yin pa la las la dbang ba'i rten nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes gang gis gnas pa ni des thob nas chos kyi char 'bebs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas / sangs rgyas kyi sa gang yin pa la las la dbang ba'i rten nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes gang gis gnas pa ni des thob nas chos kyi char 'bebs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the stage of the Buddha is the tenth bodhisattva stage, Cloud of Dharma, because one abides in that stage by means of the gnosis of mastery over karma and so on, and having attained it, one rains down the rain of Dharma.

original: de skad du yang /🔽sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //🔽gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
analyzed: de skad du yang / sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni // gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
translated: As it has been said:🔽The gnosis by which one passes

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
translated: beyond the ninth stage to abide on the stage of the Buddha

original: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: is to be known as the tenth stage

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: of the bodhisattva.

original: sa'i tshogs ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las rgya cher gsungs pas de las gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: sa'i tshogs ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las rgya cher gsungs pas de las gzung bar bya'i /
translated: The collection of stages is taught extensively in the Twenty-Five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, so it should be understood from there.

original: gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas bdag gis 'dir rgya cher ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas bdag gis 'dir rgya cher ma bris so //
translated: Fearing too many words, I have not written it here in detail.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can kho na sa'i tshogs yin pas de'i rjes la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas gnyen po'i tshogs nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa gsum pa la sogs pa'i lan gdab pa'i sgo
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can kho na sa'i tshogs yin pas de'i rjes la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas gnyen po'i tshogs nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa gsum pa la sogs pa'i lan gdab pa'i sgo
translated: Since the collections of the grounds are only the nature of the paths of seeing and meditation, after that, in order to teach the collection of antidotes that are the divisions of the occasion of abandoning the factors incompatible with those, the reply to the third request and so on is stated.

original: nas khams gsum nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la dang por dngos po @63a * //🔽tsam dang gnyen po'i rten can te gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can te /
analyzed: nas khams gsum nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la dang por dngos po @63a * // tsam dang gnyen po'i rten can te gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can te /
translated: The reply to the third request is stated from the perspective of the door of reply, “the three realms” and so on.🔽Therein, first, the two conceptions of apprehended objects, which are the bases of mere entity and antidote, and the two conceptions of apprehender, which are the bases of the substantial existence of the person and the imputed existence of the person, are abandoned on the path of seeing.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam la spong ba yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam la spong ba yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the occasion of the antidote is realized through the divisions of the factors incompatible with those,

original: go rims bzhin gnyen po'i tshogs ston pa lhur byed pa /
analyzed: go rims bzhin gnyen po'i tshogs ston pa lhur byed pa /
translated: the collection of antidotes is taught in order.

original: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The four lines beginning “They will definitely emerge from the three realms” and so on are to be applied in dependence on conventional truth.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po tsam dang gnyen po'i rnam pa la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bsgom pa'i lam la spong bas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po tsam dang gnyen po'i rnam pa la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bsgom pa'i lam la spong bas /
translated: Then, on the path of meditation, the two conceptions of apprehended objects are eliminated, which are based on mere things and the aspects of antidotes, and the two conceptions of an apprehending subject are eliminated, which are based on the person as substantially existent and the person as imputedly existent.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs su rtogs pa'i phyir gnyen po'i tshogs gzhan rnam pa bzhi grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sngar brjod pa'i bya ba bkag pas don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs su rtogs pa'i phyir gnyen po'i tshogs gzhan rnam pa bzhi grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sngar brjod pa'i bya ba bkag pas don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: Because of the classification of the discordant class, the four other sets of antidotes are realized in the context of the antidotes. The four sets of antidotes are taught in dependence on ultimate truth by the negation of the four actions mentioned above.

original: ston par mdzad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ston par mdzad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The teaching of the four sets of antidotes is stated in the lines beginning “But still.”

original: gnas pa dgag pa nyid gsal par byed pa ni gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dgag pa nyid gsal par byed pa ni gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The negation of abiding is clarified by “abiding in omniscience through the mode of non-abiding.”

original: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Here, abiding is the observation of things,

original: sems rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: the mind’s firm abiding.

original: de bkag pas gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bkag pas gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Its negation is non-abiding.

original: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should analyze as follows:

original: gal te re zhig gnas pa med pa tsam yin na de lta na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te re zhig gnas pa med pa tsam yin na de lta na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs su mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is merely the absence of abiding, then it is not suitable as the antidote because it is non-existent.

original: 'on te gnas pa ma yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnas pa ma yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not abiding, then it would follow that even the eyes and so on are that.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul ltar tshul 'di la yang blta bar bya ba yin pas rgyas par ma spros so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul ltar tshul 'di la yang blta bar bya ba yin pas rgyas par ma spros so //
translated: Just as it was explained in the case of non-apprehension, this method should be applied here as well. Therefore, I will not elaborate.

original: dus gsum pa'i dngos po rnams bkag pas gang yang nges par 'byung bar ma gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i dngos po rnams bkag pas gang yang nges par 'byung bar ma gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By negating the three times, it is said that “nothing whatsoever is liberated.”

original: yang dag pa'i don la goms pa nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ji ste de ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don la goms pa nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ji ste de ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Since one definitely emerges from the cultivation of the meaning of reality, why is there the doubt, Will it be like that?

original: gang nges par 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang nges par 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In response to that, he says, What is the emergence, etc.?

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub @63b sems dpa' gang dang lam gang gis nges par 'byung ba de dag de kho na nyid du na med cing mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub @63b sems dpa' gang dang lam gang gis nges par 'byung ba de dag de kho na nyid du na med cing mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Both means that the Bodhisattva and the path by which he emerges are non-existent and non-apprehensible in reality.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The summary is stated by Thus, etc.

original: kun rdzob tu ni yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that they exist conventionally.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths of seeing and cultivation,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog brgyad //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog brgyad //
translated: the eight conceptualizations of object and subject,

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //🔽gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir // gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: in order to pacify them,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the eight kinds of antidotes are taught.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i go rims kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bar theg pa chen po ma lus pa snying rje la sogs pa rnams kyis rjes su bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i go rims kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bar theg pa chen po ma lus pa snying rje la sogs pa rnams kyis rjes su bsgrubs pas /
translated: The accumulations are established as being of seventeen kinds because they are the means of accomplishing the great enlightenment, since the entire Great Vehicle is subsequently accomplished by means of compassion and so on, without transgressing the conventional and ultimate truths in the order explained above.🔽The accumulations of merit and wisdom are the means of accomplishing the great enlightenment.

original: byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa'i phyir na snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni rnam pa bcu bdun yin no //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa'i phyir na snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni rnam pa bcu bdun yin no //
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom are the means of accomplishing the great enlightenment, since they are the accumulations of compassion and so on, which accomplish the great enlightenment by their very nature, without transgressing the conventional and ultimate truths in the order explained above, since the entire Great Vehicle is subsequently accomplished by means of compassion and so on.

original: de ltar tshogs bsags pa rnams ni ji ltar 'phags pa byams pas brnyes pa ltar nges par 'byung ba yin pas bzhi pa nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs bsags pa rnams ni ji ltar 'phags pa byams pas brnyes pa ltar nges par 'byung ba yin pas bzhi pa nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since those who have accumulated the accumulations are definitely delivered just as the noble Maitreya was, the fourth, the accomplishment of definite delivery, should be expressed.

original: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yod pa las dang po gtso bo yin pas ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yod pa las dang po gtso bo yin pas ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it exists as eight kinds by way of the classification of objects. Since the first is the principal one, it is the definite delivery of the objective.

original: de yang sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi /
analyzed: de yang sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi /
translated: It is the supreme of all sentient beings.

original: sems chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / spong ba chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / spong ba chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The three greatnesses are the greatness of renunciation, the greatness of relinquishment, and the greatness of realization.

original: rnam pa gsum yod pa de bas na ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yod pa de bas na ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, in terms of the three greatnesses that are its objects,🔽the Bhagavān taught the Mahāyāna, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Mahāyāna is so called🔽because it possesses these greatnesses.

original: dmigs pa chen po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po nyid dang ni //
translated: The greatnesses are the greatness of its object,🔽the greatness of its practice,🔽the greatness of its wisdom,🔽the greatness of its diligence,🔽the greatness of its skillful means,🔽the greatness of its accomplishment,

original: de bzhin sgrub pa gnyis dag dang // ye shes brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang // thabs la mkhas par gyur pa dang // yang dag 'grub pa chen po dang // sangs rgyas phrin las chen po ste //🔽chen po 'di rnams dang ldan pas //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrub pa gnyis dag dang // ye shes brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang // thabs la mkhas par gyur pa dang // yang dag 'grub pa chen po dang // sangs rgyas phrin las chen po ste // chen po 'di rnams dang ldan pas //
translated: and the greatness of its buddha activity.🔽Because it possesses these greatnesses,

original: theg chen zhes ni nges par brjod //
analyzed: theg chen zhes ni nges par brjod //
translated: it is called the Mahāyāna.

original: ces bya ba'i chen po nyid bdun dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i chen po nyid bdun dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the path of the bodhisattva together with its result, because it possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa tsam nyid kyi don ma yin bar mngon par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu can yin te de nyid 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa tsam nyid kyi don ma yin bar mngon par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu can yin te de nyid 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Great Vehicle is not just a matter of fame in the world; it has the result of perfect enlightenment, because it is the cause of that.

original: de lta ma yin na theg pa chen po'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na yang dag pa @64a * //🔽ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir log par snang ba'i rang bzhin lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams de'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis mi bden pa'i don nyid du rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes
analyzed: de lta ma yin na theg pa chen po'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro // de bas na yang dag pa @64a * // ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir log par snang ba'i rang bzhin lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams de'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis mi bden pa'i don nyid du rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes
translated: If it were not so, the cultivation of the antidotes to the Great Vehicle would be pointless.

original: pas zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: pas zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Therefore, because it is mere imagination of what is unreal, the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, which has a false appearance as its intrinsic nature, is surpassed by the bodhisattvas, who, by the very fact that they are the antidote to that, know its unreal nature.

original: gang gi phyir bgrod par bya ba'i gnas sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid la sogs pa chen po nyid du nges pa kho nar 'byung ba de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bgrod par bya ba'i gnas sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid la sogs pa chen po nyid du nges pa kho nar 'byung ba de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to /
translated: The meaning of the statement is this: because the destination, the state of being the highest of all sentient beings, and so on, is certain to be great, therefore it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa med par ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung bar mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa med par ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung bar mi 'byung bas /
translated: Since the definite emergence of the object of attainment does not occur without the realization of sameness,

original: de'i 'og tu mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to teach the definite emergence of sameness, after that, it is said, “By the sameness of space,” and so on.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag khyab pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa yin zhes bya ba'i phyir de ni theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag khyab pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa yin zhes bya ba'i phyir de ni theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: The Great Vehicle is so called because it is the stainless pristine wisdom that pervades the entire sphere of objects of knowledge by means of the sameness of space, which is emptiness.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba med par bsod nams bsags ba mi srid pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid yang dag par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba med par bsod nams bsags ba mi srid pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid yang dag par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Because it is impossible to accumulate merit without working for the welfare of sentient beings, one does not realize the perfect equality.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can gyi don nges par 'byung ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can gyi don nges par 'byung ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, after that, the definite emergence for the welfare of sentient beings is stated by “how?” and so on.

original: theg pa chen po la sems can gyi sgo skabs yod do zhes brjod pa'i phyir na theg pa chen po des de dag gi don du nges par 'byung bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la sems can gyi sgo skabs yod do zhes brjod pa'i phyir na theg pa chen po des de dag gi don du nges par 'byung bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: Since it is said that there is an opportunity for sentient beings in the Great Vehicle, it is taught that they should definitely emerge for their welfare by means of that Great Vehicle.

original: de lta ma yin na don bya bas stong na go skabs yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don bya bas stong na go skabs yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were empty of working for the welfare of sentient beings, it would not be tenable that there is an opportunity.

original: bcom ldan 'das grangs 'dis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das grangs 'dis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ Bhagavan, by this enumeration” and so on is the summary.

original: rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba ni don gzhan 'dis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba ni don gzhan 'dis so //
translated: “ By this enumeration” means by this other meaning.

original: 'bad pa yod na sems can gyi don ma tshang ba med pa rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: 'bad pa yod na sems can gyi don ma tshang ba med pa rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas ;
translated: If there is effort, the complete, perfect welfare of sentient beings will not be accomplished.

original: de'i 'og tu lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di la 'ong ba ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di la 'ong ba ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: After that, in order to teach spontaneous renunciation, he says, “Here, no coming is seen,” and so on.

original: 'ong ba ni 'das pa nas so //
analyzed: 'ong ba ni 'das pa nas so //
translated: Coming is from the past.

original: 'gro ba ni ma 'ongs par ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni ma 'ongs par ro //
translated: Going is to the future.

original: gnas pa ni da ltar byung ba ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni da ltar byung ba ste /
translated: Abiding is in the present.

original: 'ong ba la sogs pa med pas lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'ong ba la sogs pa med pas lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since there is no coming and so on, it is spontaneous renunciation.

original: rtag pa dang chad ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa med par 'bad pa med par nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa med par 'bad pa med par nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Since one does not realize the state free from permanence and annihilation, one does not attain spontaneous renunciation.

original: de'i 'og tu mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the renunciation that transcends the extremes,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: he says, “Bhagavān, it is thus,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar @64b zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //🔽sngon gyi mtha' ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar @64b zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so // sngon gyi mtha' ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Thus means in the manner that will be explained.🔽The prior limit is permanence.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni chad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni chad pa'o //
translated: The posterior limit is annihilation.

original: de las 'das pa yang med do zhes brjod ba ni dbus kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das pa yang med do zhes brjod ba ni dbus kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: “The middle is not apprehended.”

original: 'di ltar zhes gang smras pa de bstan bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gang smras pa de bstan bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what was just said,

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the Bhagavān declares, “That vehicle, Subhūti, is empty of the three times.”

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis theg pa de ni dus gsum stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir theg pa chen po la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag🔽gi don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis theg pa de ni dus gsum stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir theg pa chen po la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning is that because all phenomena are completely extinguished by nature, that vehicle is the emptiness of the three times. Therefore, the Great Vehicle does not have a beginning point, and so on.

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i don brjod pas legs so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i don brjod pas legs so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that the meaning of the absence of contradiction with reality is well stated, the Bhagavān declares, “Excellent, Subhūti!”

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning with “Therefore, Subhūti.”

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba yang theg pa gsum so so'i khyad bar can gyi gnas skabs thob pa med par rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba yang theg pa gsum so so'i khyad bar can gyi gnas skabs thob pa med par rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: The renunciation that is beyond the extremes is not perfected without attaining the special states of each of the three vehicles. Therefore, the renunciation that is attained subsequently is taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di la bslabs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di la bslabs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, The bodhisattva mahāsattva, having trained in this...

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la'o //
translated: Here means in the Mahāyāna.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid theg pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir rjes su thob par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid theg pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir rjes su thob par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to understand that omniscience, which has the nature of the three vehicles, is the cause of the realization of all ārya persons, it is said, ...attained... and so on.

original: sgra gzhan du gyur pas 'phags pa gang po 'khrul nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: sgra gzhan du gyur pas 'phags pa gang po 'khrul nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: Due to the transformation of the sound, the ārya Pūrṇa mistakenly said, Blessed One... and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du ste ched du khyod spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa dang po rtsom pa na byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du ste ched du khyod spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa dang po rtsom pa na byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, and for the sake of you, and so on, and commence is the blessing at the beginning.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa med par ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa mi 'byung bas gzhan du yang gyur tam snyam nas /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa med par ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa mi 'byung bas gzhan du yang gyur tam snyam nas /
translated: Since the vision of wisdom does not occur without constant equipoise, thinking it may be otherwise,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: the noble Subhūti said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, and so on.

original: 'gal ba ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The contradiction is past.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni log par ston pa mi 'thad pas rab 'byor de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni log par ston pa mi 'thad pas rab 'byor de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The blessing of the Tathāgata is not tenable as a false teaching, so it is said, Subhūti, it is not so, and so on.

original: rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa te /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa te /
translated: In accordance with means in accordance with the system.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin yin @65a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin yin @65a * //
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is the nature of the Great Vehicle,

original: no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: it is thought.

original: chos zab mo rnam pa thams cad du ston pa'i nus pa bdag nyid la yod par mthong bas /
analyzed: chos zab mo rnam pa thams cad du ston pa'i nus pa bdag nyid la yod par mthong bas /
translated: And he saw that he himself had the ability to teach the profound Dharma in all its aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mthus lags so zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mthus lags so zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: Since he saw that he himself had the ability to teach the profound Dharma in every way, he said, Bhagavan, it is so, through the power of the Buddha.

original: thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba de yang thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dang de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba bkag pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba de yang thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa dang de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba bkag pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: That renunciation of attainment also has the characteristic of refuting the connection between that which is to be attained and that which attains it.

original: des na thob par bya ba bkag ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: des na thob par bya ba bkag ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of refuting that which is to be attained, he said,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: Moreover, Bhagavan, if the perfection of wisdom were not, the four noble truths would not be known.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni go rims kyi don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni go rims kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the word moreover is the meaning of sequence.

original: mthar yang zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mthar yang zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: Also means seventh.🔽Not realized means not attained.

original: nye bar ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' cung zad kyang zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
analyzed: nye bar ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' cung zad kyang zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, the nature of form, etc., that is to be attained, does not exist in the least. The rest is easy to understand.

original: thob par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: because the bodhisattva who is to attain it does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs bar snang ba ma yin na ma ji ltar yod pa ma yin snyam du dogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la sogs bar snang ba ma yin na ma ji ltar yod pa ma yin snyam du dogs pa /
translated: If the bodhisattva does not appear as form, etc., how can he exist?

original: nye bar ma rtogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: nye bar ma rtogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: He asks, “Why is he not apprehended?”

original: gzugs su ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: gzugs su ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: and replies, “Because he is formless, etc.”🔽Because there is no dharma

original: chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs pa //🔽gang phyir chos yod ma yin pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs pa // gang phyir chos yod ma yin pa //
translated: apart from the dharma-dhātu.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings bzhin du de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mu med pas byang chub sems dpa' mu med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nye bar ma gtogs pa yin no zhes bsams
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings bzhin du de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mu med pas byang chub sems dpa' mu med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nye bar ma gtogs pa yin no zhes bsams
translated: In the manner stated, “Because there is no dharma apart from the dharma-dhātu,” the bodhisattva is limitless because form, etc., which are its nature, are limitless like the dharma-dhātu. Therefore, he is not apprehended.

original: pa'o // thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni gzugs byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
