analyzed: pa'o // thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni gzugs byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The attainment of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs ba ni rigs pas yod pa ma yin pas de'i bdag nyid can thob pa po'i byang chub sems dpa' nye bar mi dmigs so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba ni rigs pas yod pa ma yin pas de'i bdag nyid can thob pa po'i byang chub sems dpa' nye bar mi dmigs so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The attainment of form, etc. is not perceived, because form, etc. do not exist by logical reasoning.

original: gal te de ltar mi dmigs na de kho na nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi dmigs na de kho na nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not perceived in that way, it is reality.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: This is also said to be non-perception.

original: nye bar ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang med de /
analyzed: nye bar ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang med de /
translated: This non-perception also does not exist,

original: yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no application of negation without an object.

original: dngos po med pa de'i phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de'i phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: That non-existence is the reason for non-perception.

original: de ltar spyir bstan nas bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar spyir bstan nas bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Having taught in that way in general, with regard to the self,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: the Blessed One, it is said, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob pa po bkag pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob pa po bkag pas so //
translated: In that way means by the negation of the object of attainment and the attainer.

original: thams cad @65b 'di ni gnyis te dngos po thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad do zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: thams cad @65b 'di ni gnyis te dngos po thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad do zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
translated: All is twofold, in terms of all entities and all aspects.

original: 'dir thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Here, “all” refers to the aggregates, etc., in terms of their nature as entities.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin na //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin na //
translated: “ All” refers to entities that are internal and external by nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: “ In all aspects” refers to the differentiation of aspects, such as the emptiness of internal phenomena, etc.

original: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni spyi dang so so'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni spyi dang so so'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, “all” refers to the general and the individual aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The Dharma called “bodhisattva” is the Dharma that is characterized by the attainment of the state of a bodhisattva and the nature of form, etc.

original: de dag ni mi dmigs par gyur pas de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni mi dmigs par gyur pas de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: Since they are not perceived, he does not see them.

original: de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba dgag pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba dgag pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of the relation between those two is expressed by the statement, “Subhūti, I do not see that perfection of wisdom by which a bodhisattva could attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.”

original: rnam pa dang thabs dang rnam pa med pa'i shes pa dag gis sam /
analyzed: rnam pa dang thabs dang rnam pa med pa'i shes pa dag gis sam /
translated: By the cognition of the aspects, the means, and the absence of aspects,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag bdag gis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing ma dmigs na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag bdag gis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing ma dmigs na'o //
translated: or by direct perception and inference, one does not see or observe the perfection of wisdom in accordance with the enumeration, i.e., as having the nature of form, etc.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “I do not see that all-knowledge by which a bodhisattva could attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.”

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: In order to summarize, he says, “Blessed One, I would not take hold of that all-knowledge, etc.”

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni thob pa po byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni thob pa po byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the one who attains, i.e., the bodhisattva.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'i thabs kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'i thabs kyi sgo nas so //
translated: “By which” refers to the means by which one attains.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: “That” refers to the relation, i.e., the defining characteristic of all-knowledge.

original: gang gi sgra ni spong ba ston par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni spong ba ston par byed pa yin pas /
translated: The word “not” shows the negation.

original: gang gang gis gang la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gang gis gang la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is not anything at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because this “Buddha” is the Bhagavān, etc.

original: 'dir thob par bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sgras brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir thob par bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sgras brjod de /
translated: Here, the attainment is expressed by the word “Buddha.”

original: thob pa po dang 'brel pa'i tshig lhag ma gnyis kyis ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thob pa po dang 'brel pa'i tshig lhag ma gnyis kyis ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: The other two terms that are related to the attainer are taught.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig skabs su bab ba de nyid nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig skabs su bab ba de nyid nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Because of that, the one who is appropriate is included.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin sgra sbyor ba'i phyir na ming tsam du yod pa las don bden par 'gyur ro snyam na ming de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin sgra sbyor ba'i phyir na ming tsam du yod pa las don bden par 'gyur ro snyam na ming de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: If you think that the true meaning exists as a mere name because the word is applied to an entity just as it is, then it is said that “that name also is not.”

original: de sngon mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de sngon mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it was not seen before.

original: sgra don khyad par brjod bya dang // rjod byed du ni 'dod min gyi //
analyzed: sgra don khyad par brjod bya dang // rjod byed du ni 'dod min gyi //
translated: The particular meaning of a word is not accepted as the object to be expressed and the means of expression.

original: spyi ni nye bar ston pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dngos po @66a * //
analyzed: spyi ni nye bar ston pa yin // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dngos po @66a * //
translated: The general is taught by the particular.

original: ji lta bar ming de mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bar ming de mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa'o //
translated: In this way, the name is not established as the thing is, and so it is unborn.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: He says, “Just as the self,” and so on.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni bdag shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni bdag shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: He explains that, saying, “The self is utterly nonexistent,” and so on.

original: don gyi bya ba'i nus pa med pas bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis na bdag ni shin tu med mod kyi /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba'i nus pa med pas bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis na bdag ni shin tu med mod kyi /
translated: Since it has no capacity for the activity of an object, it is like the horn of a donkey. Since it is not established even in the correct convention, the self is utterly nonexistent.

original: de lta na yang bdag ces tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag ces tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: Nevertheless, the convention “self” is designated.

original: gal te de ltar chos thams cad rigs pas ngo bo nyid med pa yin na gzugs de gang yin zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos thams cad rigs pas ngo bo nyid med pa yin na gzugs de gang yin zhes rtog pa la /
translated: If all phenomena are established as essenceless by reasoning in that way, then what is this form that is imagined?

original: gang gzung du ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gzung du ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That which is ungraspable,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mngon par ma grub pa de'i phyir de kho nar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par ma grub pa de'i phyir de kho nar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Because of non-establishment, therefore, it is free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject in reality.

original: des na gzugs la sogs ba ni kun rdzob tu ma brtags gcig pu na yid dga' bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs ba ni kun rdzob tu ma brtags gcig pu na yid dga' bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, form, etc. are the superficial, which delights the mind when not analyzed.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ma grub na 'on chos don dam pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ma grub na 'on chos don dam pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If, in that way, it is not established as the entity of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, then is the ultimate reality?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “In that way, etc.”

original: rigs pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon par ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon par ma grub pa yin la /
translated: That non-establishment of all things by reasoning is itself non-establishment.

original: mngon par ma grub ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang bral bas de ni chos ma lags so //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang bral bas de ni chos ma lags so //
translated: And that which is non-established is not a thing because it is free from the apprehension of its own characteristic.

original: rab tu bsgrub pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab tu bsgrub pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to conclude the meaning of the proof, he says, “Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom, etc.”

original: des na zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word what is a negation, meaning not.

original: de lta na ni chos rnams mngon par grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos rnams mngon par grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then phenomena are established, one might say.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: To this, the Lord says, Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being were to think, 'I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,' or 'I will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,' or 'I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,' or 'I will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,' then that bodhisattva great being would not have full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi mngon par grub pa rab tu dgag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi mngon par grub pa rab tu dgag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the complete negation of the establishment of all things,

original: mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan pa mngon par grub pa'i chos ni nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan pa mngon par grub pa'i chos ni nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: apart from nonestablishment, an established phenomenon is not observed.

original: chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: All phenomena are the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the path.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thob par bya ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thob par bya ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The qualities of a buddha are characterized by being attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni thob pa po byang chub sems dpar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan @66b gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni thob pa po byang chub sems dpar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan @66b gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of a bodhisattva are the causes for the designation of a bodhisattva who attains form and so on.

original: gang byang chub tu spyod pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang byang chub tu spyod pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One does not observe the practice of awakening.

original: byang chub pa'i don du spyod pa'i spyi'i chos gzhan gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de yang nye bar mi dmigs so zhes /
analyzed: byang chub pa'i don du spyod pa'i spyi'i chos gzhan gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de yang nye bar mi dmigs so zhes /
translated: And any other general practice for the sake of enlightenment is also not apprehended.

original: rnam par dbye ba bsgyur la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bsgyur la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “transmutation” is supplied.

original: de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mngon par brtson bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mngon par brtson bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Thus, who would strive in the perfection of wisdom?

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //🔽spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no // spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
translated: If it is thus, etc.🔽Practice is by the knowledge of meditative equipoise.

original: sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
translated: Cultivation is by the knowledge of meditative equipoise.

original: nye bar rtog ba ni rig pas rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rtog ba ni rig pas rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: Realization is the establishment by means of understanding.

original: nges par sems pa ni dran pa'i shes pa la nges par 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par sems pa ni dran pa'i shes pa la nges par 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Firm thought is the establishment in the knowledge of memory.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar rtog ces pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar rtog ces pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gang gi phyir dus gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ste /
translated: The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de'i rgyu mtshan du ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnam par yongs su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe gzugs nye bar mi rtogs te mi rig go //🔽de nyid kyi phyir nye bar mi 'dzin te bdag gir mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan du ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnam par yongs su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe gzugs nye bar mi rtogs te mi rig go // de nyid kyi phyir nye bar mi 'dzin te bdag gir mi byed de /
translated: The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'am 'gag par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'am 'gag par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o ;
translated: The Lord has said, “Subhūti, when you do not apprehend form, etc.🔽you investigate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: ; bdag nyid gcig yin na skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dmigs pa kho na gzugs dmigs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ; bdag nyid gcig yin na skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dmigs pa kho na gzugs dmigs pa yin nam /
translated: If they were the same, then the non-arisen and non-ceased would be the very object of perception.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs nye bar ma gtogs pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs nye bar ma gtogs pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Therefore, how could form be the object of perception?

original: de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, he asks, “Why is that?”

original: gang gi phyir skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzugs ma yin te /
translated: He replies, “It is because the non-arisen and non-ceased are not form.”

original: kun rdzob tu gzugs lta bur snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gzugs lta bur snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear like form on the conventional level.

original: de la dngos po kho na skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'o //🔽de bkag @67a * //
analyzed: de la dngos po kho na skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'o // de bkag @67a * //
translated: Here, an impermanent thing that endures for a moment is destroyed.

original: pas 'jig pa ma mchis ba yin te /
analyzed: pas 'jig pa ma mchis ba yin te /
translated: The negation of that is non-destruction.

original: gang gi phyir kun rdzob tu sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa des na de'i phyir skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa dang gzugs ni don dam par skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir gnyis su med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun rdzob tu sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa des na de'i phyir skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa dang gzugs ni don dam par skye ba med pa dang 'jig pa med pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir gnyis su med de /
translated: Because of the variety of the conventional, therefore, because of the non-arising and non-ceasing of form, etc., they are non-dual.

original: 'di ni skye ba med pa la sogs ba dang rang bzhin gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba med pa la sogs ba dang rang bzhin gcig nyid yin no //
translated: This is because of the non-arising, etc. of form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis su byar med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis su byar med pa ste /
translated: Because of the non-duality,

original: gnyis kyi dngos por byed pa'i tshad ma dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos por byed pa'i tshad ma dang bral bas so //
translated: because of the absence of a valid cognition that makes a duality.

original: gal te de ltar yin na gzugs su ji ltar btags zhe na gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na gzugs su ji ltar btags zhe na gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that is so, how is form designated?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gzugs rigs pas mi 'thad pa la sogs pa gnyis su ma mchis pa la brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu ming du bgyis ba lags te brdar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gzugs rigs pas mi 'thad pa la sogs pa gnyis su ma mchis pa la brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu ming du bgyis ba lags te brdar btags pa yin no //
translated: The term “form” is a conventional designation, a verbal expression, for the non-duality of form, etc. which is not logically tenable.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa med par thob pa'i nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges bar 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa med par thob pa'i nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges bar 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since omniscience is not attained without realization, after that, in order to teach the definite emergence in omniscience,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said, “Subhūti, it is thus, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Thus” is to be connected with “in every way.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In the perfection of wisdom”

original: rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ste /
analyzed: rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ste /
translated: means in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “For the sake of definite emergence” is the remainder.

original: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “All phenomena” are forms, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: “In every way” means in the aspects of non-entity, etc.

original: 'di ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
translated: This is the particular action,

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su rtog pa na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su rtog pa na'o //
translated: when one thoroughly investigates all phenomena such as form, etc.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of clear realization.

original: gzugs la nye bar mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: He does not form mental images of form, etc.

original: skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas yang bzlas pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas yang bzlas pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Since this is a different context, there is no fault of repetition.

original: / de lta na ni sems can gyi don du dka' ba spyod ba la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: / de lta na ni sems can gyi don du dka' ba spyod ba la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: But if that is so, then it is not tenable that he practices austerities for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dag dang gnyis su med pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu de'i @67b phyir gzugs la nye bar mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smras pa'i don kho bos shes pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dag dang gnyis su med pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu de'i @67b phyir gzugs la nye bar mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smras pa'i don kho bos shes pa
translated: Since form, etc. is non-arising and non-ceasing, and is non-dual, for that reason I understand the meaning of what you have said, namely, that he does not form mental images of form, etc.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is also non-arising,

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the nature of form, etc.

original: de ltar yin du chug mod ces khas blangs na nyes pa bstan ba'i don du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug mod ces khas blangs na nyes pa bstan ba'i don du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If one were to accept that this is so, in order to show the fault, he says If, etc.

original: ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba ste /
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba ste /
translated: The word what is a negation.

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One does not engage in it means that one does not engage in it because there is no arising and no cessation.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyis zhes bya ba bgos bas sdug bsngal ba yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'i don du spro ba yang ci zhig yod cing ci'i don du yin no zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyis zhes bya ba bgos bas sdug bsngal ba yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'i don du spro ba yang ci zhig yod cing ci'i don du yin no zhes pa'i don te /
translated: For the sake of the welfare of sentient beings means that one is enthusiastic for the sake of experiencing the suffering of those who are afflicted by suffering. What has the meaning of why.

original: sems can la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Because there are no sentient beings, etc. is what is thought.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan smras pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan smras pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, I... etc. is the reply.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: One thinks like this:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin na don dam par dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes thal ba bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe de kho na nyid du na spyod pa mi 'thad pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin na don dam par dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes thal ba bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe de kho na nyid du na spyod pa mi 'thad pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin
translated: If you argue that if the bodhisattva is also unarisen, then it follows that he does not perform ultimate austerities, then you are proving what is already established for us, since we do not maintain that there are austerities in reality.

original: no // 'on te kun rdzob tu yin na 'o na ni de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: no // 'on te kun rdzob tu yin na 'o na ni de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you argue that he does not perform conventional austerities, then at that time the bodhisattva is not unarisen,

original: skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because his arising is evident.

original: des na spyod pa ji ltar 'gal zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na spyod pa ji ltar 'gal zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: So how can you maintain that there is a contradiction in his performance of austerities?🔽You should not even think that the performance of austerities is conventional, because it is said:

original: kun rdzob tu yang dka' ba spyod pa ji ltar spyod pa yin zhes kyang bsam par mi bya'o zhes brjod pa ni gang zhig dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang dka' ba spyod pa ji ltar spyod pa yin zhes kyang bsam par mi bya'o zhes brjod pa ni gang zhig dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “One should not think that the performance of austerities is difficult,

original: dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa zhes bya ba 'dir spyad dka' ba la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa zhes bya ba 'dir spyad dka' ba la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: because the performance of austerities is difficult is a remainder.

original: mgo gtong ba la sogs pa'i spyad dka' ba rnams byang chub sems dpa' kho nas byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mgo gtong ba la sogs pa'i spyad dka' ba rnams byang chub sems dpa' kho nas byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the difficult practices such as giving one's head, etc. done only by the bodhisattvas?

original: ji ltar na dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How is it that they have no notion of difficulty?🔽 To answer that doubt, he says, Why is it, Venerable Śāriputra?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dka' ba'i 'du shes bskyed na sems can rnams kyi don bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dka' ba'i 'du shes bskyed na sems can rnams kyi don bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Because if one generates the notion of difficulty, one is not able to act for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: yang dag pa'i spyod pa mi rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na gang dka' ba'i 'du @68a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spyod pa mi rdzogs pa'i phyir ro // de bas na gang dka' ba'i 'du @68a * //
translated: because the correct practice is not completed.

original: shes kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par byed na de sems can gyi don mi byed pas byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shes kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par byed na de sems can gyi don mi byed pas byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one practices generosity, etc. with the notion of difficulty, one does not act for the welfare of sentient beings, and so one would not be a bodhisattva.

original: 'o na ji ltar nus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar nus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it possible?

original: 'on kyang bde ba'i 'du shes pa nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba'i 'du shes pa nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, having made it just a notion of happiness, and so on, he says,🔽

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa la ser sna la sogs pa med pas bya sla ba'i 'du shes ni bde ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa la ser sna la sogs pa med pas bya sla ba'i 'du shes ni bde ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of ease is the idea that generosity, etc. are easy to practice because they are free of stinginess, etc.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la spyir ma la sogs par 'du shes bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la spyir ma la sogs par 'du shes bskyed pa'am /
translated: Similarly, one should generate the idea of all sentient beings in general as one’s mother, etc.

original: khyad par du skyes ba dang bud med dag la na tshod che chung gi tshad kyis ci rigs par ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes su byas shing gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod na de'i tshe don bya bar nus so zhes bya bar bsams
analyzed: khyad par du skyes ba dang bud med dag la na tshod che chung gi tshad kyis ci rigs par ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes su byas shing gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod na de'i tshe don bya bar nus so zhes bya bar bsams
translated: Or, in particular, one should generate the idea of men and women as one’s mother, etc. according to their age, thinking, “When I practice the conduct of the bodhisattva, then I will be able to help them.”

original: pa'o // de nyid nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize that very [conduct], he says “Therefore,” etc.

original: bar du yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams la na tshod mnyam pa'i tshad kyis ming po dang sring mo'i 'du shes su nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bar du yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams la na tshod mnyam pa'i tshad kyis ming po dang sring mo'i 'du shes su nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Here, “also” indicates that one should summarize men and women according to their age as one’s brother and sister.

original: ji ltar na bdag nyid kyi 'du shes bskyed par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag nyid kyi 'du shes bskyed par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one generate the idea of oneself?

original: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As for the verse beginning “Just as I generate self-pride,”

original: bdag tu nga rgyal skyed pa nyid kyis rang gi rgyud nyid bdag yin no /
analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal skyed pa nyid kyis rang gi rgyud nyid bdag yin no /
translated: it is one’s own continuum that is the self, by virtue of generating self-pride.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “I will free myself from all suffering and dispel it”

original: 'du byed la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o //
translated: means that one will free oneself from the sufferings of conditioning and so forth and dispel them.

original: rnam pa gzhan dag kyang bdag gis sems can thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dag kyang bdag gis sems can thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The other aspects are stated in the verse beginning “I will also be a protector for all sentient beings.”

original: yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen bo'i bsam pa dang sbyor bas so //
analyzed: yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen bo'i bsam pa dang sbyor bas so //
translated: “I will not abandon them” means that one will not abandon them with the attitude and application of great compassion.

original: thar par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i bya ba rdzogs bar bya bas so //
analyzed: thar par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i bya ba rdzogs bar bya bas so //
translated: “I will free them” means that one will complete such activities.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /🔽bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na / bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: When will this be?🔽The verse beginning “Even if my body is cut into a hundred pieces” states that

original: bdag gi lus brgyar gtubs kyang zhes bya ba ni de rnams nyid kyis bya bar shugs kyis sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus brgyar gtubs kyang zhes bya ba ni de rnams nyid kyis bya bar shugs kyis sbyar te /
translated: even if one’s body is cut into a hundred pieces, one will not abandon sentient beings. This is connected by implication with the activities of the previous verse.

original: gzhan du na phul du byung ba ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na phul du byung ba ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, what would be so special about it?

original: chung ngu na zhes bya ba tha ma na'o //
analyzed: chung ngu na zhes bya ba tha ma na'o //
translated: “ At the very least” means at the very last.

original: gnod sems kyang mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyang mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: “ One should not give rise to malice” means one should not be hostile.

original: de nyid mjug bsdu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba la @68b sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid mjug bsdu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba la @68b sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The summary of that is stated in “Thus…” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems de ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems de ltar ro //
translated: “ Thus” means like the mind that was just explained.

original: spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Conduct” is generosity and so on.

original: gnas na zhes bya ba ni spyod lam rnam bzhi la'o //
analyzed: gnas na zhes bya ba ni spyod lam rnam bzhi la'o //
translated: “ Abiding” is the four types of daily activity.

original: de ltar kun rdzob la brten pa'i spyod pas dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa bstan nas don dam pa'i bden pa brten pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob la brten pa'i spyod pas dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa bstan nas don dam pa'i bden pa brten pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the absence of the idea of difficulty through conduct based on the conventional, in order to explain the ultimate truth,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽thams cad nas bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / thams cad nas bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas so //
translated: [the Buddha] says, “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra…” and so on.🔽“ Everything” is direct perception and so on, the valid means of knowledge.

original: thams cad ni khyab ba dang cig shos kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: thams cad ni khyab ba dang cig shos kyi tshul lo //
translated: “ Everything” is the mode of pervasion and the reverse pervasion.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni sems can dang srog la sogs par grags pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni sems can dang srog la sogs par grags pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: In all aspects means in the aspects of sentient beings, life, and so on.

original: yang thams cad du zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: yang thams cad du zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i tshul te /
translated: Again, in all ways means in the manner of being the agent and so on.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas ji ltar bdag med cing yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas ji ltar bdag med cing yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is devoid of the nature of being one or many, it is selfless and nonexistent.

original: de nyid kyis na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mi dmigs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is not observed.

original: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: All phenomena are also like that.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is indicated by thus in all ways and so on.

original: chos la ltos nas ni thams cad ces bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: chos la ltos nas ni thams cad ces bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In dependence on phenomena, all means in the manner of their intrinsic identity and so on.

original: thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: All refers to their general identity and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: In all aspects means in the aspects of affliction and so on.

original: thams cad du ni rnam pa thams cad du ste /
analyzed: thams cad du ni rnam pa thams cad du ste /
translated: In all ways means in all aspects.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu kho na ltar kun du spyod par bya zhing de la yang dka' ba spyod pa'i 'jigs pa ji ltar yod ces bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu kho na ltar kun du spyod par bya zhing de la yang dka' ba spyod pa'i 'jigs pa ji ltar yod ces bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no other aspect, one should conduct oneself like the illusory person. And how can there be fear of the hardships of the bodhisattva conduct?

original: de ltar skye ba med pa la thal ba spangs nas khas len pa ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus gang yang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs bas brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med pa la thal ba spangs nas khas len pa ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus gang yang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs bas brjod do //
translated: Thus, having refuted the absurd consequence of non-production, the venerable Śāriputra expresses his acceptance with In that case... and so on.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: It is just so means it is just so ultimately, he thinks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med do zhes brjod pas phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med do zhes brjod pas phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: If one says 'the bodhisattva is not produced,' that is emptiness of one part.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, what is that? and so on is stated.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni byang chub sems dpar byed pa'i chos lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni byang chub sems dpar byed pa'i chos lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattva's dharma is the nature of the path, such as the knowledge of all aspects, that makes one a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang skye ba med de rigs pas mtshungs @69a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang skye ba med de rigs pas mtshungs @69a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gang dris pa de kho na lan gdab par bya'i /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang dris pa de kho na lan gdab par bya'i /
translated: The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.

original: gzhan du na nyan pa po 'byung ba med pa'i ngag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyan pa po 'byung ba med pa'i ngag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.

original: de bas na phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir /🔽'on te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong nas gong du dris pa dang / lan smras pas stong pa nyid ni thams cad kyi yul yin par brjod pa yin no //🔽de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir / 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong nas gong du dris pa dang / lan smras pas stong pa nyid ni thams cad kyi yul yin par brjod pa yin no // de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.

original: sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos so //
translated: The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason.🔽The Dharma of the Bodhisattva is also non-arisen, because it is similar to the reason

original: 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i byis pa ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i byis pa ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The childish who have not generated the ārya path are ordinary beings.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni de dang 'brel ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni de dang 'brel ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of ordinary beings are the related things such as attachment.

original: de ltar rim gyis chos thams cad skye ba med par khas len du bcug nas nyes pa 'gal ba'i phyir brjod pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rim gyis chos thams cad skye ba med par khas len du bcug nas nyes pa 'gal ba'i phyir brjod pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having gradually caused them to accept that all phenomena are unarisen, in order to state the fault of contradiction, it says, “Venerable Subhūti, if…” and so on.

original: 'on zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa ste /
analyzed: 'on zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa ste /
translated: “But” means “I cannot accept that.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “Would they attain omniscience?” is the remainder.

original: glegs bam la la las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bad pa med pas thob bam zer ba ni gsal ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: glegs bam la la las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bad pa med pas thob bam zer ba ni gsal ba kho nar zad do //
translated: Some texts say, “Would omniscience be attained without effort?” This is just a clarification.

original: 'di skad du gus par byas pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang yun ring por bsgoms pas skye ba med pa rtogs pa na sangs rgyas nyid rjes su thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gus par byas pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang yun ring por bsgoms pas skye ba med pa rtogs pa na sangs rgyas nyid rjes su thob pa yin no //
translated: It is saying, “When nonarising is realized through meditation that is respectful, uninterrupted, and long-lasting, buddhahood is attained.”

original: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa kho na yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid 'bad pa med par rjes su thob pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa kho na yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid 'bad pa med par rjes su thob pa kho na yin la /
translated: If all phenomena were only unarisen, then at that time omniscience would be attained without effort.

original: de lta na ni lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In that case, all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te ma skyes pa la thob bar bya ba dang thob pa bo chos yod na ni de'i tshe 'bad pa med par thob ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa la thob bar bya ba dang thob pa bo chos yod na ni de'i tshe 'bad pa med par thob ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa zhig na /
translated: If there were phenomena to be attained and an attainer in the unarisen, then at that time it would be tenable to say “attainment without effort.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas brjod pa ni /
translated: But since that is not the case, it is thought and said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos la thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos la thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, I do not assert attainment in an unarisen phenomenon.

original: rigs pas ma skyes pa'i chos dad pas thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su thob par te 'dzin par mi 'dod la dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs @69b su mngon par rtogs shing khong du chud par yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rigs pas ma skyes pa'i chos dad pas thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su thob par te 'dzin par mi 'dod la dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs @69b su mngon par rtogs shing khong du chud par yang mi 'dod do //
translated: One should not assert that the non-arisen dharma is obtained by faith, nor that the one who obtains it obtains it at the time of preparation, nor that one realizes and comprehends it at the time of the actual basis.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated by “the non-arisen dharma,” etc.

original: thob pa po'i chos ma skyes pas thob par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thob pa po'i chos ma skyes pas thob par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The non-arisen obtainment that is characterized by the obtainment of the non-arisen dharma of the one who obtains it does not occur.

original: gnyi ga dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are non-entities.

original: 'o na gang rung zhig ma skyes pas na thob pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang rung zhig ma skyes pas na thob pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Well then, if one of them is non-arisen, obtainment occurs.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci ma skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci ma skyes pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, “Does the non-arisen dharma obtain the non-arisen dharma?”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed ba'o //
translated: The word “or” indicates a different position.

original: slar dris pa'i tshul gyis lan gyi don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: slar dris pa'i tshul gyis lan gyi don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the reply is stated in the manner of a counter-question:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, is it said that an unarisen dharma arises?”

original: skye ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci ma skyes pa'i chos skyes so zhes brjod dam /
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci ma skyes pa'i chos skyes so zhes brjod dam /
translated: Because arising does not exist, is it said that an unarisen dharma arises?

original: de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say “so it is,”

original: brjod la rag ste ming gzhan du bya bas dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod la rag ste ming gzhan du bya bas dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is said, but it is not the case that a different thing becomes another thing by having a different name.

original: de bas na skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could an unarisen attainment of an arisen dharma come to be?

original: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kho na ma skyes pa yin no zhes khyod kyis brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kho na ma skyes pa yin no zhes khyod kyis brjod pa yin na /
translated: But if you say that only an unarisen dharma is unarisen,

original: de lta na yang nyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang nyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: even so, there is only a fault.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: Whatever is an unarisen dharma is just unarisen,

original: med pa kho na yin pa des na ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa skyes pa 'thob par ci ltar 'gyur 'di skad du /
analyzed: med pa kho na yin pa des na ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa skyes pa 'thob par ci ltar 'gyur 'di skad du /
translated: it is just nonexistent. Therefore, how could an unarisen attainment of an arisen dharma come to be?

original: de kho na nyid du na thob par bya ba dang thob pa po dag med pa'i phyir 'bad pa med par 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na thob par bya ba dang thob pa po dag med pa'i phyir 'bad pa med par 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: In reality, there is no attainment and no one who attains, so attainment would occur without effort.

original: kun rdzob tu yang 'bad pa chen pos dus ring por rgyun mi 'chad par bsgoms pas sa brgyad pa la sogs par ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa 'thob pa'i phyir gang gis lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ba 'bad pa med par 'thob par ji
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang 'bad pa chen pos dus ring por rgyun mi 'chad par bsgoms pas sa brgyad pa la sogs par ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa 'thob pa'i phyir gang gis lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ba 'bad pa med par 'thob par ji
translated: But even conventionally, because the spontaneous engagement of wisdom is attained on the eighth and so on through meditation for a long time with great effort without interruption, how could it be that attainment without effort would occur for all embodied beings?

original: ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas skye ba dang skye ba med pa rnam par gnas pa yin na khyod la yang brgal zhing brtag pa 'di nyid do snyam pa'i bsam pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas skye ba dang skye ba med pa rnam par gnas pa yin na khyod la yang brgal zhing brtag pa 'di nyid do snyam pa'i bsam pas brjod pa ni /
translated: If the distinction between production and nonproduction is based on conventional and ultimate reality, then this very objection and response would apply to you.

original: skye ba'i chos nyid mi skye ba yin nam 'on te mi skye ba'i chos mi skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos nyid mi skye ba yin nam 'on te mi skye ba'i chos mi skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With this thought in mind, he says: Is the reality of production unproduced, or is the unproduced reality of nonproduction?

original: de kho na nyid ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yang ngag tu brjod pa dang bral ba yin no snyam du bsams nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yang ngag tu brjod pa dang bral ba yin no snyam du bsams nas brjod pa ni /
translated: The reality is free from verbal expression even in the conventional of expression.

original: @70a * // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba'i chos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @70a * // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba'i chos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus thinking, he says, Venerable Śāriputra, is there a dharma called 'production' or not?

original: de gnyi ga brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du smra bar mi spobs so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du smra bar mi spobs so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Since both are false, he thinks, I am not eloquent in speaking of reality.

original: ma skyes pa ni don dam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bsam bas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni don dam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bsam bas brjod pa ni /
translated: Thinking, Non-production is ultimate reality, he says,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod kyis skye ba med pa'i chos la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod kyis skye ba med pa'i chos la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Venerable Subhūti, is there a dharma called 'non-production' or not?

original: don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa 'di la don dam pa zhes brjod do zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa 'di la don dam pa zhes brjod do zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Since it accords with the ultimate, this non-production is called the ultimate.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: He says, Venerable Śāriputra, it is non-production that is expressed,

original: / skye ba med pa nyid yin na yang brjod par bya bas na brjod pa ni spros pa ste rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / skye ba med pa nyid yin na yang brjod par bya bas na brjod pa ni spros pa ste rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “conceptualization” is the same as that of “conceptual elaboration.”

original: de lta na mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ci zhig tu snang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ci zhig tu snang zhe na /
translated: In that case, what appears at the time of realization?

original: nyid brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyid brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is itself the expression.”

original: skye ba med pa yin na yang brjod par bya bas na brjod pa ni spros pa ste ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa yin na yang brjod par bya bas na brjod pa ni spros pa ste ;
translated: And even though it is non-arisen, it is expressible, and so expression is conceptual elaboration.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “conceptualization” is the same as that of “conceptual elaboration.”

original: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ci zhig tu snang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid so sor snang ba yin pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ci zhig tu snang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid so sor snang ba yin pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In that case, what appears at the time of realization? “The appearance of non-arisenness itself.”

original: rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol zhing gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba med pa nyid gzung bar snang zhing 'dzin pa ma yin pa nyid 'dzin par snang ngo //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol zhing gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba med pa nyid gzung bar snang zhing 'dzin pa ma yin pa nyid 'dzin par snang ngo //
translated: It is free from all conceptualization, and the non-apprehensible non-arisenness appears as apprehended, and the non-apprehending appears as apprehender.

original: yang ji ltar na de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin du zin kyang de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du so sor snang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin du zin kyang de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du so sor snang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that, even though they do not have such an intrinsic reality, they appear as if they did?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de kho na bzhin du shin tu so sor snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de kho na bzhin du shin tu so sor snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, they appear just as they are, as if they were real.

original: de kho na bzhin du ste ji ltar mthong ba bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ji lta bu yin yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ste ji ltar mthong ba bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ji lta bu yin yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as they are, they appear as if they were real, because what is seen cannot be denied.

original: yang na de kho na bzhin du ste /🔽rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rang bzhin du brdzun pa kho na so sor snang ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na de kho na bzhin du ste / rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rang bzhin du brdzun pa kho na so sor snang ba yin no //
