analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid yang dag par bshad pas bstod pa'i phyir brjod pa ni /
translated: They appear just as they are means that they appear as if they were real, as if they were false, as

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni chos ston pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni chos ston pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The venerable Subhūti is a teacher of the Dharma, etc.

original: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba bya ba'o //
translated: “should be set forth” means should be apprehended.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang chos kyi sprin gyi rtogs @70b pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang chos kyi sprin gyi rtogs @70b pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the śrāvakas also not without the realization of the Cloud of Dharma?

original: ji ltar 'di ltar ston snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ltar ston snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How is it that he teaches in this way?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: He says, “It is thus,” etc.

original: gang dang gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la'o //
translated: “In regard to whatever” means in regard to aspiration.

original: de dang de la zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dang de la zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: “In regard to that” is similar.

original: gang dang gang la yongs su dris pa de dang de la lan btab pas nges par 'byung bas rang gi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nyid las kyang mi g-yo ste gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang la yongs su dris pa de dang de la lan btab pas nges par 'byung bas rang gi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nyid las kyang mi g-yo ste gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In regard to whatever is asked, in regard to that he gives an answer, and so he does not waver from the reality whose characteristic is his own realization, because he remains in it.

original: lung gi rang bzhin gyi chos nyid de rtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal bar mi byed do zhes bya ba rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lung gi rang bzhin gyi chos nyid de rtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal bar mi byed do zhes bya ba rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: One does not contradict the Dharma which is the realization of that reality which is the nature of the scriptures means that even though one does not have a consciousness which is always in meditative equipoise, the rest is as before.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is the blessing of the Tathagata,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: the Lord said to the venerable Shariputra: Shariputra, the disciples of the Tathagata, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos mi gnas pa'i chos can rnams kyi zhes bya ba mngon par zhen pa med pa'i chos can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos mi gnas pa'i chos can rnams kyi zhes bya ba mngon par zhen pa med pa'i chos can rnams kyi'o //
translated: The disciples of the Tathagata who are not attached to anything means those who are not attached to anything.

original: chos nyid ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i nges pa nyid do //
translated: This is the reality means the certainty of dependent origination.

original: chos nyid de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that reality?

original: de dag gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is that which is called dependent origination, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i dmigs pa yod du zin kyang ji ltar na nyan thos mi gnas pa'i chos can yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni 'di ltar gang zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i dmigs pa yod du zin kyang ji ltar na nyan thos mi gnas pa'i chos can yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni 'di ltar gang zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: The reply to this doubt is:

original: pa'o // gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa'o // gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all dharmas are non-abiding, due to being devoid of the nature of one or many.

original: gnas par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not fit to abide.

original: mi gnas pa'i chos can gyi nyan thos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i don du byin gyis brlabs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i chos can gyi nyan thos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i don du byin gyis brlabs pa kho na ste /
translated: The Sravaka who is one whose Dharma is non-abiding is only empowered to explain the perfection of wisdom.

original: de lta ma yin na ston pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ston pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the teaching would be untenable.

original: gang zag bdag med par rtogs pa tsam gyis ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos la mos pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang zag bdag med par rtogs pa tsam gyis ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos la mos pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “empowered by the Tathagata” is a remainder, because there is no faith in this kind of Dharma through the mere realization of the selflessness of persons.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i @71a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i @71a * //
translated: The definite emergence of the knowledge of all aspects

original: nges par 'byung ba de yang khyad par gyi lam la sogs pa med bar mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba de yang khyad par gyi lam la sogs pa med bar mi 'byung bas /
translated: is not without the special path, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu lam gyi nges bar 'byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam gyi nges bar 'byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, after that, in order to teach the definite emergence of the path, it is stated:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, excellent, excellent!”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Excellent, excellent” is

original: don legs bar smras ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don legs bar smras ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because the meaning is well-spoken.

original: 'on kyang gang gis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ba chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ba chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang yin /
translated: Nevertheless, what is this perfection of not abiding in any phenomena by which enlightenment is realized?

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its essence,

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “Śāriputra” and so forth.

original: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis lam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni chos thams cad la mi brten pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis lam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni chos thams cad la mi brten pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the path, is the essence of all the levels, perfections, and factors for enlightenment.🔽

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of all the stages, perfections, and factors of enlightenment, and which is characterized by the path, is called the perfection that does not stand in any dharma, because it does not stand in any dharma.

original: theg pa thams cad ni theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad ni theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: All vehicles are included in the three vehicles.

original: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can la su zhig nges par 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can la su zhig nges par 'byung zhe na /
translated: Who is liberated in that perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the path, in that way?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: He says, “Thus, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas so //
translated: “Thus” means in the manner just explained.

original: sems zhum pa ni sems 'khums pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhum pa ni sems 'khums pa'o //
translated: “Low spirits” means a contracted mind.

original: de nyid ni nem nur zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni nem nur zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: That itself is stated by “doubts, etc.”

original: nem nur du gyur pa ni the tshom du gyur pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: nem nur du gyur pa ni the tshom du gyur pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: “Doubtful” is a cognition that is doubtful.

original: ci 'di yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di yin nam /
translated: What is this?

original: gzhan yin zhes lam gzhan 'dod bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin zhes lam gzhan 'dod bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, Is it something else?

original: rmongs pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: Delusion is ignorance.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Its nature is not understanding.

original: sems gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The mind becomes something else, which is wrong knowledge.

original: log par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is wrong understanding.

original: 'di thams cad ni ma rig pa yin bas na /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni ma rig pa yin bas na /
translated: All of this is ignorance,

original: bsgoms pas sbang bar bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: bsgoms pas sbang bar bya bar bstan to //
translated: so it is taught that it is to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: gnas pa 'di lta bus gnas shing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di lta bus gnas shing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Dwelling in this kind of dwelling means

original: lam gyi rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas sems las su rung ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas sems las su rung ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: dwelling in the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the path. This is because one perfects mental flexibility by means of the four modes of activity.

original: yid la byed pa 'di dang ma @71b bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di dang ma @71b bral ba yin no //
translated: One is not separated from this mental attention

original: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: means that one is in the state of correct meditative equipoise, which has the nature of the path.🔽

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'bad ba dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can ma yin nam /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'bad ba dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can ma yin nam /
translated: Attention is the mental effort whose function is to hold the mind to the object.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: The one who abides in the perfection of wisdom

original: de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can yin na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can yin na /
translated: has a nature that is the opposite of that.

original: 'di gnyis lhan cig gnas par ga la rung /
analyzed: 'di gnyis lhan cig gnas par ga la rung /
translated: How can these two exist together?

original: zhes bya ba'i bsam pas smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bsam pas smras pa ni /
translated: With this thought in mind, he says,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhuti, etc.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas gnas pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas gnas pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can one who abides in the perfection of wisdom be inseparable from attention?

original: phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar mi rung ngo //
translated: Because they are mutually contradictory, it is not possible.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: “Venerable Subhuti, if, etc.”

original: gal te yid la byed pa dang ma bral na de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te yid la byed pa dang ma bral na de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: If one is not separated from mental activity, then at that time one is separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas ba dang ma bral na /
analyzed: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas ba dang ma bral na /
translated: But if one is not separated from the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de'i tshe yid la byed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid la byed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: then at that time one is separated from mental activity.

original: 'on te 'gal ba dag kyang gcig la lhan cig gnas par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gal ba dag kyang gcig la lhan cig gnas par 'dod na /
translated: But if one maintains that even mutually exclusive things can coexist in one place,

original: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is an absurd consequence.

original: zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes smras pa ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, if…” and so on.

original: gal te lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su yid la byed ba dang ma bral ba yin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su yid la byed ba dang ma bral ba yin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar 'dod na /
translated: If one maintains that even in the stage of definite emergence on the path one is not separated from mental activity, but is not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ltar gyur na ni sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case all sentient beings would not be separated from the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de rnams la yid la byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la yid la byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have mental activity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa 'bad ba du mas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa 'bad ba du mas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the perfection of wisdom to be accomplished by many efforts?

original: des na ji ltar na sems can thams cad de dang mi 'bral ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar na sems can thams cad de dang mi 'bral ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: So how is it that all sentient beings are not separated from it?

original: zhes bya bas bsu nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsu nas smras pa ni /
translated: In response to this doubt, he says,

original: sems can thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All sentient beings are also not separated from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: yid la byed pa @72a * //
analyzed: yid la byed pa @72a * //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the mental activity.

original: dang zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gal bas so //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gal bas so //
translated: There is no contradiction here.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: de dang 'gal pa'i phyin ci log tu 'jug pa'i yid la byed ba yod pas /
analyzed: de dang 'gal pa'i phyin ci log tu 'jug pa'i yid la byed ba yod pas /
translated: they have mental activities that are the opposite of that, which are in contradiction with it.

original: sems can thams cad la rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all sentient beings are established in it.

original: yang gang gi tshe khyod lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su gnyi ga lhan cig gnas pas 'gal bar khas mi len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe khyod lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su gnyi ga lhan cig gnas pas 'gal bar khas mi len pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when you do not accept that there is a contradiction between the two because they coexist in the state of the path of definite emergence,

original: res 'ga' ba'i 'gal ba mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i 'gal ba mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since a contradiction that is sometimes the case is not tenable,

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad mi 'gal ba'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad mi 'gal ba'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore, since all sentient beings are not without the mental activity of noncontradiction,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'bral ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'bral ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that they are not without the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: yid la byed pa sgra ji bzhin pa nyid yin na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /🔽sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa sgra ji bzhin pa nyid yin na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni / sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
translated: The objection that if mental activity is just as it is expressed, this fault would ensue,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is stated in the passage beginning “Excellent, Śāriputra, excellent!”

original: 'on kyang yid la mi byed pa nyid yid la byed pa yin par mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang yid la mi byed pa nyid yid la byed pa yin par mngon par 'dod do //
translated: However, it is asserted that nonmental activity itself is mental activity.

original: de la yang gal te sgra'i 'jug pa tsam gyis klan ka tshol bar byed na /
analyzed: de la yang gal te sgra'i 'jug pa tsam gyis klan ka tshol bar byed na /
translated: If you object that this is just the way words are used,

original: de'i tshe khyod la yang klan ka yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyod la yang klan ka yod do //
translated: then you also have a problem.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: This is stated in the passage beginning “If you think that . . . ”

original: gang gi phyir tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don kho na yang dag par tshig tu brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don kho na yang dag par tshig tu brjod pa ste /
translated: Because the Venerable Śāriputra has expressed the meaning of the characteristic of mental attention just as it is in words,

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don brjod pa kho nar yongs su bzung ba de'i phyir 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi ngag phyi ma rnams su khyod la yang slar dri bar bya'o //🔽'dis ni sgra'i don sgra ji bzhin par bzung na nyes pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don brjod pa kho nar yongs su bzung ba de'i phyir 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi ngag phyi ma rnams su khyod la yang slar dri bar bya'o // 'dis ni sgra'i don sgra ji bzhin par bzung na nyes pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and has taken it to be just the meaning of the words, therefore, in the following passages of this type, you should be questioned again.

original: zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that if one takes the meaning of the words literally, the fault is the same.

original: yang ji ltar na yid la byed pa med pa nyid yid la byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na yid la byed pa med pa nyid yid la byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, how is it that the absence of mental attention itself is mental attention,

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and not just the meaning of the words?

original: zhes bya bas bsu nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsu nas smras pa ni /
translated: With this doubt in mind, he says,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, sentient beings... and so on.

original: sems can zhes bya ba srog chags rnams ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba srog chags rnams ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
translated: Sentient beings, that is, living beings, are devoid of intrinsic reality because they are like illusions.

original: rgyu des na de dang tha mi dad pa'i @72b phyir /
analyzed: rgyu des na de dang tha mi dad pa'i @72b phyir /
translated: For that reason,🔽mental activity is devoid of intrinsic reality.🔽The nonexistence of sentient beings in reality

original: yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: is the unreality of sentient beings.🔽The emptiness of sentient beings in reality with respect to nonarising, etc.🔽is the emptiness of sentient beings.🔽The inconceivability of sentient beings

analyzed: sems can de kho na nyid du med pa ni /
translated: is the inconceivability of sentient beings.🔽The nonconceptualization of sentient beings

original: sems can dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: is the nonconceptualization of sentient beings.🔽The nonimagination of sentient beings🔽is the nonimagination of sentient beings.🔽The nonperception of sentient beings🔽is the nonperception of sentient beings.🔽The nonapprehension of sentient beings🔽is the nonapprehension of sentient beings.🔽The nonproduction of sentient beings🔽is the nonproduction of sentient beings.🔽The nonstopping of sentient beings

analyzed: sems can de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa la sogs pas dben pa nyid ni sems can dben pa nyid do //

original: sems can bsam las 'das pa nyid ni sems can bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can bsam las 'das pa nyid ni sems can bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
translated: is the nondefilement of sentient beings.🔽The nonpurification of sentient beings🔽is the nonpurification of sentient beings.🔽The nonrestraint of sentient beings🔽is the nonrestraint of sentient beings.🔽The nontransgression of sentient beings🔽is the nontransgression of sentient beings.🔽The nondefilement of sentient beings🔽is the nondefilement of sentient beings.🔽The nonpurification of sentient beings

analyzed: sems can gyi rtog pa med pa nyid ni sems can mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid do //
translated: is the nonpurification of sentient beings.🔽The nonrestraint of sentient beings🔽is the nonrestraint of sentient beings.🔽The nontransgression of sentient beings

original: sems can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don brdzun pa'o zhes mngon bar byang chub pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sems can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don brdzun pa'o zhes mngon bar byang chub pa nyid ni /
translated: is the nontransgression of sentient beings.🔽The nondefilement of sentient beings🔽is the nondefilement of sentient beings.🔽The nonpurification of sentient beings

original: sems can yang dag pa ma yin bar mngon par byang chub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can yang dag pa ma yin bar mngon par byang chub pa nyid do //
translated: is the nonpurification of sentient beings.🔽The nonrestraint of sentient beings🔽is the nonrestraint of sentient beings.🔽The nontransgression of sentient beings🔽is the nontransgression of sentient beings.🔽The nondefilement of sentient beings🔽is the

original: tshig drug po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig drug po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: These six phrases should be understood in order in the four phases of penetration, and in the situation of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de ltar na rig pas yid la byed pa med pa nyid yid la byed pa yin no zhes brjod nas mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rig pas yid la byed pa med pa nyid yid la byed pa yin no zhes brjod nas mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having stated that the absence of attention through insight is itself attention, he says this in order to conclude:

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva who is endowed with such a nature,🔽who is endowed with such an explained nature of attention, and who is endowed with the path characterized by the emergence of the perfection of wisdom,

original: bshad ma thag ba'i rang bzhin can gyi yid la byed pa 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa 'dis gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: bshad ma thag ba'i rang bzhin can gyi yid la byed pa 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa 'dis gnas par 'dod de /
translated: wishes to stand in this perfection of wisdom.

original: phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he engages without error.

original: des na de ltar nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i gzhi 'di rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pas chos thams cad dmigs su med pas nges bar 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bu'i brgyad po 'di dag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nges par
analyzed: des na de ltar nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i gzhi 'di rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pas chos thams cad dmigs su med pas nges bar 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bu'i brgyad po 'di dag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nges par
translated: Therefore, since there is no other Dharma superior to these bases of definite emergence, and since all dharmas are not observed, definite emergence is by these eight alone.

original: 'byung ba'i sgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that definite emergence is the practice of definite emergence.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:🔽The practice of definite emergence is said to have eight aspects:

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das par nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang ; ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste //🔽rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das par nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang ; ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste // rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: The object of definite emergence is the object of the path.🔽This definite emergence

original: nges 'byung sgrub pa yin zhes bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges 'byung sgrub pa yin zhes bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Has the nature of eight aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The chapter on the practice of omniscience is finished.

original: rnam pa ma lus @73a * //
analyzed: rnam pa ma lus @73a * //
translated: Because of knowing all things in every way, the perfection of wisdom is the only practice that is to be accomplished in connection with the Tathagata.

original: bas dngos po mtha' dag yongs su shes pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'brel bar rjes su bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi spyod par gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu'i
analyzed: bas dngos po mtha' dag yongs su shes pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'brel bar rjes su bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi spyod par gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu'i
translated: All the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects, which has the nature of the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc.,

original: bdag nyid kyi sgo nas 'dir yang dang yang du bzlas pa'i phyir na gzhung 'di le'u yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sgo nas 'dir yang dang yang du bzlas pa'i phyir na gzhung 'di le'u yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las /
translated: are repeated again and again here in terms of cause and effect. Therefore this text is a chapter.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste dang po'o /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, the chapter on the knowledge of paths, from the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle, a commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa med na ma yin pas lam shes pa ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa med na ma yin pas lam shes pa ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The realization of the knowledge of all aspects is not possible without the knowledge of paths. Therefore the knowledge of paths is mentioned in the line “at that time” and so forth.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid ston pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid ston pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At that time refers to the time of teaching the knowledge of the path.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni slar yang brgya byin 'khod par gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni slar yang brgya byin 'khod par gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Again refers to the time when Śatakratu was seated.

original: ji lta bu zhe na lha rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba smos te bdag po'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na lha rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba smos te bdag po'o //
translated: What was he like? The text says he was the lord of the gods, the master.

original: ji skad du nye bar bshad pa'i 'khor de nyid du nye bar 'dus pa ni lus la sogs pa ma g-yengs par byas pas sam /
analyzed: ji skad du nye bar bshad pa'i 'khor de nyid du nye bar 'dus pa ni lus la sogs pa ma g-yengs par byas pas sam /
translated: He was seated in that very assembly as it has been described, having made his body and so on unmoving.

original: legs par phyag 'tshal ba byas nas 'khod par gyur pa ni rang gi stan la legs par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: legs par phyag 'tshal ba byas nas 'khod par gyur pa ni rang gi stan la legs par 'dug pa'o //
translated: Having properly paid homage, he was seated, having sat down well on his own seat.

original: 'jig rten skyong ba ni rnam thos sras dang / yul 'khor skyong dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba ni rnam thos sras dang / yul 'khor skyong dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang ngo //
translated: The guardians of the world are Vaiśravaṇa, Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Virūḍhaka, and Virūpākṣa.

original: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi kun nas bdag por gyur pa ni mi mjed kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi kun nas bdag por gyur pa ni mi mjed kyi bdag po ste /
translated: The lord of the Sahā world is the master of the Sahā world system.

original: gtso bor gyur ba'i lha'i bu'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur ba'i lha'i bu'o //
translated: He is the chief of the gods.

original: tshangs pa yang kha cig na re bsam gtan bzhi par byung ba yin te /🔽'jig pa'ang me dang chu dang ni //
analyzed: tshangs pa yang kha cig na re bsam gtan bzhi par byung ba yin te / 'jig pa'ang me dang chu dang ni //
translated: Some say: Brahma is born in the fourth absorption.🔽The destruction of the world is threefold:

original: rlung gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: by fire, water and wind.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis go rims bzhin du dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan gsum ni 'jig pas de nyid ni yun ring por gnas pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis go rims bzhin du dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan gsum ni 'jig pas de nyid ni yun ring por gnas pa'i phyir bdag nyid du mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the first three absorptions are destroyed in order, because they are not long lasting.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad do //
translated: Others explain this differently.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i nges las sems can 'ga' zhig shi 'phos te tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par gcig pu zhig skyes pa dang / kye ma'o sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes na ci ma rung snyam du smon pa'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i nges las sems can 'ga' zhig shi 'phos te tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par gcig pu zhig skyes pa dang / kye ma'o sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes na ci ma rung snyam du smon pa'i rjes thogs la /
translated: When a sentient being dies and transmigrates from the heaven of clear light, if it is born alone in the empty palace of Brahma, it thinks, Alas, if other sentient beings were born here, how happy they would be.

original: bsod nams la sogs ba zad ba gzhan zhig bya rog @73b dang ta la'i tshul du der skyes pa dang / nga ni 'di'i dbang phyug yin no zhes mngon par rlom pas bsam gtan dang po'i sa gsum pa la mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs ba zad ba gzhan zhig bya rog @73b dang ta la'i tshul du der skyes pa dang / nga ni 'di'i dbang phyug yin no zhes mngon par rlom pas bsam gtan dang po'i sa gsum pa la mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: and they are born there like crows and palm trees, and they think, “I am the lord of this place,” and they are born there as Brahma, lord of the third level of the first absorption.

original: der de lta bu'i 'khor du 'dus pa rnams lam shes pa nyid skye bar rung ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der de lta bu'i 'khor du 'dus pa rnams lam shes pa nyid skye bar rung ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the assembly gathered there as suitable for the arising of the knowledge of the path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od rnams kyis lha la sogs pa'i rang gi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od dri ma can lta bur mog mog por mdzad pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la rtogs pa skye'o zhes shes par bya ba'i
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od rnams kyis lha la sogs pa'i rang gi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od dri ma can lta bur mog mog por mdzad pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la rtogs pa skye'o zhes shes par bya ba'i
translated: the light rays of the nature of the tathagatas obscure the impure light rays arisen from the individual karmic ripening of the gods and so on, and in order to make them understand that realization arises only in the mindstream of one who has destroyed pride,

original: phyir mdzad do //
analyzed: phyir mdzad do //
translated: the light rays are emanated.

original: de'i phyir tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the basis is indirectly expressed by the words🔽.

original: lha'i bu rnams kyi 'od gang yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyi 'od gang yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The light of the devas, etc.

original: rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags las nges par byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags las nges par byung ba'o //
translated: Arises from the evolution of their own karma means that it arises from the imprints of their own virtuous karma.

original: 'od ni 'od zer gyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'od ni 'od zer gyi snang ba'o //
translated: Light is the radiance of light rays.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Also means also the body, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The power of the Buddha, etc.

original: kha cig na re mthu ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: kha cig na re mthu ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: Some say: Power is a special ability.

original: gzi brjid ni 'od kyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gzi brjid ni 'od kyi tshul gyis so //
translated: Radiance is the mode of light.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyi zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyi zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas so zhes 'chad do //
translated: Transformation is intention.

original: gzhan dag ni mthu la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po 'di dag sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mdzad pa'i 'od zer gyi dbye ba las gyur pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mthu la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po 'di dag sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mdzad pa'i 'od zer gyi dbye ba las gyur pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that these three terms power, etc. are distinguished by the light rays of the activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: zil gyis mnan te zhes bya ba ni mog mog por dri ma can du mdzad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te zhes bya ba ni mog mog por dri ma can du mdzad par gyur pa'o //
translated: Overpowering means making them dim and impure.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then and so on.

original: de nas bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag ba ste /
analyzed: de nas bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag ba ste /
translated: The word then refers to the immediately preceding.

original: de ltar mog mog bor mdzad pas 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal bsal ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de ltar mog mog bor mdzad pas 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal bsal ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Having made them dim in that way, immediately after dispelling the pride of the world guardians and so on, he said, These...

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i tshul lo //🔽rab 'byor las zhes bya ba ni thad nas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i tshul lo // rab 'byor las zhes bya ba ni thad nas so //
translated: These refers to the manifest ones.🔽From the perfection of wisdom means from the path of seeing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom refers to the path of seeing.

original: gang dang 'bral ba zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang 'bral ba zhe na /
translated: From what is it separated?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: From the great vehicle of the bodhisattva.🔽 The great vehicle is the path of cultivation.

original: nye bar bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mnyan pa'i skabs su gzhung 'dzin pa'i phyir slob pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mnyan pa'i skabs su gzhung 'dzin pa'i phyir slob pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Teaching and so on. Teaching is learning the scriptures in order to uphold them.

original: bsam pa'i skabs su nges par gzung ba'i don mi brjed pa'i phyir gdams pa'o //🔽sgom @74a * //
analyzed: bsam pa'i skabs su nges par gzung ba'i don mi brjed pa'i phyir gdams pa'o // sgom @74a * //
translated: In the chapter on reflection, it is instruction for the purpose of not forgetting the meaning that is ascertained.

original: pa'i skabs su sngon med pa skyed pa'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i skabs su sngon med pa skyed pa'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: In the chapter on meditation, it is teaching for the purpose of generating what has not been generated.

original: nyan par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes pas nges par bya 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes pas nges par bya 'dod pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to listen, means if one wishes to ascertain by the knowledge that comes from hearing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di dag ji ltar nyan par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di dag ji ltar nyan par 'dod ce na /
translated: How do the bodhisattvas wish to listen?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “The bodhisattva-mahāsattva should listen like this…” and so on.

original: gnas par bgyi ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du mnyan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par bgyi ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du mnyan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “should be established” should be understood in the context of listening and so on, respectively.

original: de ltar gsol ba btab ba dang / 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni lam shes pa nyid rtogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i yul nges pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de ltar gsol ba btab ba dang / 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni lam shes pa nyid rtogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i yul nges pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Thus, having made this request, the noble Subhūti, in order to teach the certainty of the object, namely, that one who is free from pride and has generated the thought of enlightenment is fit to understand the knowledge of paths,

original: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: he said, “Kauśika,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar nyan par 'dod pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bstan par bya zhing bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar nyan par 'dod pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bstan par bya zhing bshad par bya'o //
translated: Because of the reason for wanting to listen in that way, therefore it should be taught and explained.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The “thought” is the thought that has the essence of emptiness and compassion.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug pa kho na yin no //
translated: The arrangement of the three vehicles is intentional, not literal, and thus all beings are ultimately only in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang cig shos kyi rnal 'byor bas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang cig shos kyi rnal 'byor bas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the yogi who is free from passion and the other should cultivate the knowledge of the path in order to attain Buddhahood.

original: zhes khyad par bstan pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs par zhugs pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi snod du ma gyur ba nyid kyis rigs ma nges pa rnams thog ma nyid du byang chub chen por drang bar
analyzed: zhes khyad par bstan pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs par zhugs pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi snod du ma gyur ba nyid kyis rigs ma nges pa rnams thog ma nyid du byang chub chen por drang bar
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinction, he says, those who have entered the vehicle of the sravaka, etc., are not vessels for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and so, being of unfixed potential, they are first led to great enlightenment.

original: bya ba'i don dang / rab tu zhugs pa gzhan rnams kyang yang dag par gzung ba'i don yin no snyam pas dgongs pa can gyi tshig brjod pa ni gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i don dang / rab tu zhugs pa gzhan rnams kyang yang dag par gzung ba'i don yin no snyam pas dgongs pa can gyi tshig brjod pa ni gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And, thinking that others who have entered the path are to be properly sustained, he states the suggestive words, those who, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges bar bzung ba ste gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs shing rang gi nyan thos kyi mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam la zhugs pa de dag ni 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas grub par shog / ces bla
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges bar bzung ba ste gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs shing rang gi nyan thos kyi mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam la zhugs pa de dag ni 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas grub par shog / ces bla
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion. Those who have entered into the certainty of the perfect truth, who have entered the path of seeing and so on of their own śrāvaka vehicle, may they attain buddhahood for the benefit of beings.🔽

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i skal ba med cing snod du ma gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i skal ba med cing snod du ma gyur pa yin no //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion. Those who have entered into certainty in reality and have entered the path of seeing and so forth of their own śrāvakas are not fortunate and are not vessels for generating the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, saying, “May I become a buddha for the benefit of the world.”

original: gang du byis pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis kyang nus na 'phags @74b pa'i lam rtogs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis ji ltar mi nus snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gang du byis pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis kyang nus na 'phags @74b pa'i lam rtogs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis ji ltar mi nus snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: If it is thought, “If all childish beings are able, then how could the śrāvakas who have realized the ārya path be unable?” that doubt is addressed by “Why is that?”

original: de dag gis ni 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Because they have cut the continuity of saṃsāra,” and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir khams gsum par skye bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rang gi lam gyis ma lus par bsregs pas nyan thos chen po de dag ni 'khor ba'i rgyun las te /🔽skye ba rjes su 'brel pa las mtshams bcad pa zhes bya ba mi skye ba'i nges pa byas pa de bas na de dag yang dang yang du ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khams gsum par skye bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rang gi lam gyis ma lus par bsregs pas nyan thos chen po de dag ni 'khor ba'i rgyun las te / skye ba rjes su 'brel pa las mtshams bcad pa zhes bya ba mi skye ba'i nges pa byas pa de bas na de dag yang dang yang du ste /
translated: Because those great śrāvakas have completely burned away the afflictive obstructions that cause birth in the three realms with their own path, they have cut off the continuum of cyclic existence.

original: bskyar zhing 'khor bar skye ba len pa yod ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyar zhing 'khor bar skye ba len pa yod ba ma yin no //
translated: They have made a vow not to be born again. Therefore, they do not take birth again and again in cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i skal ba med do //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i skal ba med do // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, they do not have the good fortune to generate the unsurpassed, correct, and complete thought of awakening.

original: 'di skad ston te /🔽ji srid 'khor ba'i gnas su ni //
analyzed: 'di skad ston te / ji srid 'khor ba'i gnas su ni //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: mkhas mchog 'dug par gyur pa'i tshe //🔽de srid mtshungs med sems can don //
analyzed: mkhas mchog 'dug par gyur pa'i tshe // de srid mtshungs med sems can don //
translated: As long as the supreme scholars remain in the abode of cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan mi 'da' byed bar nus //
analyzed: mya ngan mi 'da' byed bar nus //
translated: for that long they are able to benefit sentient beings without compare🔽and to prevent the nirvana of sentient beings.

original: zhes gsungs pas yang skye ba blangs par gyur na ni sbyin pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don bya ba la bslabs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas yang skye ba blangs par gyur na ni sbyin pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don bya ba la bslabs pas /
translated: If one takes rebirth again, then one trains in benefiting sentient beings through generosity and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob par byed ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob par byed ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The pure thought of enlightenment, which is the cause of the state of a Tathāgata, is generated.

original: de bas na nyan thos chen po rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa bcad pa nyid kyis yang skye ba zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i rgyu ldog pa'i phyir de lta bu'i sems kyi rin po che 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can skyed bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos chen po rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa bcad pa nyid kyis yang skye ba zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i rgyu ldog pa'i phyir de lta bu'i sems kyi rin po che 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can skyed bar mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, the great śrāvakas, by merely eliminating the afflictions, are unable to generate such a precious thought of enlightenment, which is the cause of the state of a Tathāgata, because the root cause of rebirth, as it is called, has been eliminated.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would follow that there would be no cause.

original: yang byis pa'i skye bo ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pas nus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang byis pa'i skye bo ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pas nus pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, childish beings, because they are not lacking the complete causes as they have been explained, are able to generate the precious thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: tshig 'di ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas ji ltar na dgongs pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'di ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas ji ltar na dgongs pa can yin zhe na /
translated: Since these words are the nature of knowledge itself, how can they be of provisional meaning?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: But and so on is said.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni gnas skabs kyis de nas kyi sgra'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni gnas skabs kyis de nas kyi sgra'i don la 'jug go //
translated: The word but is used in the sense of then by the situation.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos chen po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos chen po rnams kyis so //
translated: By them is meant the great disciples.

original: rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: One should rejoice, means one should rejoice with the mental attention of rejoicing as will be explained below.

original: khyed ci zhig la rjes su yi rang zhe na /
analyzed: khyed ci zhig la rjes su yi rang zhe na /
translated: What is it that you should rejoice in?

original: gal te bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you generate the thought of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, and so on is said.

original: gal te nyan thos chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur na @75a * //
analyzed: gal te nyan thos chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur na @75a * //
translated: If the great disciples generate the thought of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment,

original: de la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: one should rejoice in that, is the connection.

original: khyed spangs nas ji ltar rjes su yi rang zhe na /
analyzed: khyed spangs nas ji ltar rjes su yi rang zhe na /
translated: Having abandoned you, how should one rejoice?

original: de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says in their virtuous side and so on.

original: gal te kho bos gdul bya'i khyad par la ltos te sngar dgongs pa can gyi tshig smras par gyur pa de lta na yang nyan thos rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi sems las byung ba'i 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba nyid la bar chod de mi
analyzed: gal te kho bos gdul bya'i khyad par la ltos te sngar dgongs pa can gyi tshig smras par gyur pa de lta na yang nyan thos rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi sems las byung ba'i 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba nyid la bar chod de mi
translated: Even if I spoke with an implied meaning, in consideration of the particularity of the disciples, still, the roots of virtue of the śrāvakas, which come from the thought of awakening, would not be an obstacle to their buddhahood.

original: srid pa de nyid du byas pas gegs su gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: srid pa de nyid du byas pas gegs su gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: He says I do not make that impossible.

original: ji ltar mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi byed ce na /
translated: How does he not make it impossible?

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says in particular, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par du 'phags ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams las shin tu ches khyad par du 'phags pa kho na'i byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i chos rnams lhag par dmigs par bya zhing re bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par du 'phags ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams las shin tu ches khyad par du 'phags pa kho na'i byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i chos rnams lhag par dmigs par bya zhing re bar bya'o //
translated: Because in particular, one should observe and expect the teachings of the thought of awakening, and so on, which are far more exalted than the virtuous friends and so on.

original: yang srid ba'i nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyang 'gro ba de dang der skye bar ji ltar mi 'gal zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /🔽gang gi phyir gang zhig skye bo gzhan gyis dkri bar bya ba ma yin pa mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang nas dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa de ni bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba 'dor ba dang thob par 'dod
analyzed: yang srid ba'i nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyang 'gro ba de dang der skye bar ji ltar mi 'gal zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste / gang gi phyir gang zhig skye bo gzhan gyis dkri bar bya ba ma yin pa mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang nas dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa de ni bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba 'dor ba dang thob par 'dod
translated: Also, it should not be said that it is contradictory for śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who have burned the afflictions of birth, to be born in this and that world.

original: pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Because those who, without being led by others, take up inferior states after first manifesting delight in them are possessed of attachment to self and are motivated by the desire to abandon suffering and obtain happiness.

original: dper na bud med kyi ro yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bud med kyi ro yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa can bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a lustful man who takes up the corpse of a woman.

original: de bzhin du mngal gyi gnas 'dzin pa 'di yang skye ba'i dbang phyug la sogs pas byin gyis ma brlabs par mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro bas dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngal gyi gnas 'dzin pa 'di yang skye ba'i dbang phyug la sogs pas byin gyis ma brlabs par mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro bas dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, those who take up the womb are motivated by delight in taking up an inferior state without being empowered by the lord of birth and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis khams gsum pa bskyed par bya ba la nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nus pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis khams gsum pa bskyed par bya ba la nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nus pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: By this natural logical argument, the afflictions are established as having the power to generate the three realms.🔽Having attained the two enlightenments, that of the great śrāvakas and that of the nominal śrāvakas, they are devoid of great compassion and wisdom.

original: nyan thos chen po phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po med ba'i ming can gyi byang chub gnyis thob nas snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang bral bas srid pa las skrag pa'i yid can mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe zad ba na mar me shi ba lta
analyzed: nyan thos chen po phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po med ba'i ming can gyi byang chub gnyis thob nas snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang bral bas srid pa las skrag pa'i yid can mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe zad ba na mar me shi ba lta
translated: They are terrified of existence, and when their lives are exhausted by the force of their previous karma, they are like a blown-out lamp.

original: bur mya ngan las 'das pa zhes ming du byas pa /
analyzed: bur mya ngan las 'das pa zhes ming du byas pa /
translated: They are said to attain nirvāṇa.

original: khams gsum pa'i skye ba las 'das pa rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mnyam par bzhag bzhin pa kho @75b nar yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su padma'i sbubs su skye'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i skye ba las 'das pa rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mnyam par bzhag bzhin pa kho @75b nar yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su padma'i sbubs su skye'o //
translated: Those who have transcended birth in the three realms, immediately after the mind of death, are born in the womb of a lotus in the completely pure world systems while remaining in equipoise in the uncontaminated realm.

original: de nas de dag 'od dpag med la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i don du sad par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de nas de dag 'od dpag med la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i don du sad par mdzad pas /
translated: Then, the light rays of the sun of perfect complete buddhahood, such as Amitābha, awaken them in order to dispel the nonafflictive darkness.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas thar pa'i gnas skabs su dmyal ba la sogs par rgyu ba bzhin du 'gro bar 'gro ba'i rim gyis byang chub kyi tshogs bsags nas 'jig rten gyi bla mar 'gyur ro zhes lung las nges pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas thar pa'i gnas skabs su dmyal ba la sogs par rgyu ba bzhin du 'gro bar 'gro ba'i rim gyis byang chub kyi tshogs bsags nas 'jig rten gyi bla mar 'gyur ro zhes lung las nges pa yin no //
translated: They generate the enlightenment mind and, like those who wander in the hells and so on during the phase of liberation, they gradually accumulate the accumulations for enlightenment and become the gurus of the world.

original: des na rgyu yang las dang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa log pas 'bras bu khams gsum pa'i skye ba ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na rgyu yang las dang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa log pas 'bras bu khams gsum pa'i skye ba ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the cause is the cessation of karma and the afflictions of existence, and the result is the cessation of birth in the three realms.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings su skye ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'gal /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings su skye ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'gal /
translated: But it is not the case that birth in the uncontaminated realm is stopped.

original: de bas na theg pa thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad du theg pa chen por gzhol bar bshad pa nyid rigs pa yin par shes so //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad du theg pa chen por gzhol bar bshad pa nyid rigs pa yin par shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is logical to explain that all vehicles are subsumed in every way within the Mahāyāna.

original: de lta na yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po dang bden pa po'i le'u la sogs pa las gsungs ba legs par drangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po dang bden pa po'i le'u la sogs pa las gsungs ba legs par drangs par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be well to cite the statements in the Saddharmapundarika, the Satyakaparivarta, and so on.

original: sh'a ri'i bu khyed ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du theg pa ni gcig ste gnyis pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyed ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du theg pa ni gcig ste gnyis pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “ Sariputra, in the future you will become a perfect Buddha” and so on, and “The vehicle is one, there is no second” and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig gi skrag pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir chos bcu pa dang dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa las theg pa gcig tu bstan pa'i don ni drang ba'i don yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi skrag pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir chos bcu pa dang dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa las theg pa gcig tu bstan pa'i don ni drang ba'i don yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: In order to eliminate the fear of some, the Lord himself clarified the meaning of the teaching of one vehicle in the Dasadharmakasutra, the Ratnamegha, and so on, which are interpretable in meaning.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang blo gros chen po nyan thos kyi theg pas grol ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang blo gros chen po nyan thos kyi theg pas grol ba ma yin gyi /
translated: And in the Lanka vatara sutra it says, “Mahamati, they are not liberated by the sravaka vehicle,

original: 'on kyang de dag gi theg pa chen po'i mthar thug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi theg pa chen po'i mthar thug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: but their vehicle is the ultimate of the Mahayana.”

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas dang / de'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba theg pa gcig gi tshul du smra ba rnams kyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas dang / de'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba theg pa gcig gi tshul du smra ba rnams kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the noble Nāgārjuna and those who follow his system and speak of the way of the one vehicle say:

original: byang chub rnam pa gnyis thob nas //
analyzed: byang chub rnam pa gnyis thob nas //
translated: Having attained the two kinds of enlightenment,

original: srid pas skrag yid de dag ni //
analyzed: srid pas skrag yid de dag ni //
translated: those whose minds are afraid of existence

original: tshe zad la dga' mya ngan las //
analyzed: tshe zad la dga' mya ngan las //
translated: are pleased with the exhaustion of life and

original: 'das thob 'du shes can du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das thob 'du shes can du 'gyur //
translated: have the idea of attaining nirvāṇa.

original: de la mya ngan 'das yod min //🔽'on kyang srid gsum khams su ni //
analyzed: de la mya ngan 'das yod min // 'on kyang srid gsum khams su ni //
translated: But there is no nirvāṇa there,

original: skye ba de la yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba de la yod ma yin //
translated: and they do not exist in the three realms of existence.

original: zag med dbyings gnas de dag kyang //
analyzed: zag med dbyings gnas de dag kyang //
translated: They abide in the uncontaminated realm,

original: mi shes nyon @76a * //
analyzed: mi shes nyon @76a * //
translated: but because they do not know

original: mongs mi spang phyir //
analyzed: mongs mi spang phyir //
translated: how to abandon the afflictions,

original: phyis ni sangs rgyas kyis bskul nas //
analyzed: phyis ni sangs rgyas kyis bskul nas //
translated: later, urged by the buddhas,

original: byang chub kyi ni tshogs bsags te //
analyzed: byang chub kyi ni tshogs bsags te //
translated: they accumulate the requisites for enlightenment

original: de yang 'jig rten 'dren par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'dren par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: and become guides of the world.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du yid du 'ong ba'i de kho na nyid 'di bstan pas 'phags pa rab 'byor la gus pa skyes pa rnams kyi rab tu dang ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du yid du 'ong ba'i de kho na nyid 'di bstan pas 'phags pa rab 'byor la gus pa skyes pa rnams kyi rab tu dang ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to increase the faith of those who have generated respect for the noble Subhuti through teaching this suchness which is delightful in every way,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said Excellent! and so forth.

original: spyod yul yin na yang don 'di lta bu mngon sum bzhin du rnam par gsal ba'i tshig gis bshad do zhes ngo mtshar du gyur pas legs so legs so zhes lan gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul yin na yang don 'di lta bu mngon sum bzhin du rnam par gsal ba'i tshig gis bshad do zhes ngo mtshar du gyur pas legs so legs so zhes lan gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Excellent, excellent! he said twice, because he was amazed that, although it is the domain of Subhuti, he explained this meaning with words as clear as if it were directly perceptible.

original: brjod par 'dod ba gsal ba kho nar ston pas rab tu dgyes te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod ba gsal ba kho nar ston pas rab tu dgyes te /
translated: He was extremely pleased because he clearly revealed what he wanted to say.

original: yang legs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang legs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Excellent! he said again.

original: brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni mdzes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni mdzes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This expression is indeed beautiful!

original: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad de gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad de gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word whoever is a verbal particle that has the meaning of for what reason.

original: glegs bam la la las ni gang gi phyir zhes zer te /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni gang gi phyir zhes zer te /
translated: Some editions read “because” instead of “for what reason.”

original: gang gi phyir khyed theg pa gcig tu ston pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rang gi phyogs bstan par byed pas spro bar byed pa yang legs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed theg pa gcig tu ston pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rang gi phyogs bstan par byed pas spro bar byed pa yang legs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because” means that it is good that you, by teaching a single vehicle, encourage bodhisattvas by showing them your own position.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas dang de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba theg pa sna tshogs su smra ba rnams ni gzhan du 'chad de gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni nges pa'i🔽don yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas dang de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba theg pa sna tshogs su smra ba rnams ni gzhan du 'chad de gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni nges pa'i don yin la /
translated: Arya Asanga and his followers, who teach a variety of vehicles, explain this passage differently. The words “those who have entered into reality” and so on have a definitive meaning.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni drang ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni drang ba'i don yin te /
translated: The words “but” and so on have an interpretable meaning.

original: de bas na khyab pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyab pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the passage is that the Buddha’s lineage is the basis.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽Some are led to enter,🔽And some are led to stay,🔽And some are led to maturity,

original: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni //
translated: And some are led to liberation.

original: ma nges rnams la theg gcig bstan //
analyzed: ma nges rnams la theg gcig bstan //
translated: For those of indefinite lineage, he taught the single vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde gzhan dang 'gal ba yongs su bsal ba yin no zhes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde gzhan dang 'gal ba yongs su bsal ba yin no zhes so //
translated: Thus, he says, the contradiction with other sūtras is resolved.

original: sngar gyi theg pa gcig tu ston pa'i phyogs la ni gang dag nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa sngon du 'gro bas byang chub chen po rtogs par 'gyur ba de dag ni dus de tsam la brten nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su bstan🔽pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi theg pa gcig tu ston pa'i phyogs la ni gang dag nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa sngon du 'gro bas byang chub chen po rtogs par 'gyur ba de dag ni dus de tsam la brten nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su bstan pa yin la /
translated: In the context of the teaching of the single vehicle, those who attain great enlightenment after first attaining the enlightenment of śrāvakas and so on are taught to be of the śrāvaka lineage and so forth in dependence on that time.🔽Those who attain the stage of the utterly joyful and so on in stages and then attain unsurpassed enlightenment are of the Mahāyāna lineage.

original: dang po kho nar rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa @76b rtogs pa'i rim gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub la brten pa rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir rigs kyi dbye ba dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dang po kho nar rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa @76b rtogs pa'i rim gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub la brten pa rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir rigs kyi dbye ba dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus there is no contradiction with the division of lineages.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: This digression is sufficient.

original: da ni lam shes pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lam shes pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature and function of the knowledge of the path, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The Bhagavat, etc.

original: phan btags zin pa dran pa mkhas pa ni bka' drin gzo ba'o //
analyzed: phan btags zin pa dran pa mkhas pa ni bka' drin gzo ba'o //
translated: The wise one who remembers the benefit already received is grateful.

original: khyad par gyi lam la sogs bas dgos pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir phan pa mdzad bzhin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam la sogs bas dgos pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir phan pa mdzad bzhin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the Bhagavat is still engaged in benefiting them, since the purpose of the path of distinction, etc., has not yet been completed?

original: ci'i phyir de ltar smras snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar smras snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why do you say that?

original: brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is Bhagavat, previously, etc.

original: bdag cag rnams kyi don du zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyi don du zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: For our sake means for our purpose,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod do //🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba ni bdag cag rnams kyi don du zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
