analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod do // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni bdag cag rnams kyi don du zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because the wheel of the Dharma was turned previously with the Śrāvaka Vehicle.🔽How? means for our sake.

original: yang na ji ltar gdams pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gdams pa'o //
translated: Or, how is it that we were instructed?

original: byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur ro //
translated: For the sake of enlightenment means for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

original: tshangs par spyad pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa ste /
translated: Pure conduct is the avoidance of impure conduct.

original: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
analyzed: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
translated: One who abides in morality, who is endowed with learning and reflection,

original: sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: is well engaged in meditation.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the method.

original: 'dis ni ci rigs par bslab pa'i gzhi lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ci rigs par bslab pa'i gzhi lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that one is endowed with the five basic precepts and so forth, as appropriate.

original: spyod pa na zhes bya ba 'khor ba ji srid par sems can rnams kyi don bya ba la 'jug pa nyid kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni lam shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spong bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: spyod pa na zhes bya ba 'khor ba ji srid par sems can rnams kyi don bya ba la 'jug pa nyid kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni lam shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spong bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba
translated: While engaged in conduct means that one who is engaged in benefiting sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence endures, by generating the mind of enlightenment, does not completely abandon the afflictions through the knowledge of the path.

original: ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams dbang du byas nas dus yun ring por sgrub par byed pa na zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams dbang du byas nas dus yun ring por sgrub par byed pa na zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang bzhin ston pa yin te /
translated: This is its nature. When one brings the afflictions under control and practices for a long time, this shows its nature.

original: gzhan du na byang chub kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Otherwise, the practice of enlightenment would not be complete.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gdams shing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gdams shing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having instructed in the perfections,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gdams pa ji lta bas gdams pa byas nas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gdams pa ji lta bas gdams pa byas nas te /
translated: having given instruction in the perfections of generosity and so on,

original: gdams shing gdams pa byas nas gdams pa byas pas zhes bye brag tu bshad pas so //
analyzed: gdams shing gdams pa byas nas gdams pa byas pas zhes bye brag tu bshad pas so //
translated: because it is explained in the Abhidharmakośa that “having instructed, having given instruction, having given instruction,”

original: @77a * // mdo la la nas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: @77a * // mdo la la nas 'di skad ston te /
translated: some sūtras teach this:

original: gdams pa phog cing zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gdams pa phog cing zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: “Having given instruction” is easy to understand.

original: rjes su bstan te zhes bya ba ni rjes su bslabs nas so //
analyzed: rjes su bstan te zhes bya ba ni rjes su bslabs nas so //
translated: “Having taught” means having trained.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos de rnams la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos de rnams la ste /
translated: “In that” means in those śrāvakas,

original: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu'o //
translated: in some circumstances.

original: spyad pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas spyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / yang dag bar 'dzin du ma bcug pa dang /
analyzed: spyad pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas spyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / yang dag bar 'dzin du ma bcug pa dang /
translated: Practicing refers to not actualizing the perfect limit that has the nature explained above and to being sustained by generosity and so on through skill in wisdom and method and to not being induced to take up the perfect limit.

original: yongs su ma grol ba'i sems can rnams go rims bzhin du yongs su bzung ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / yongs su grol ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad cing tshogs bsags pa zhes byed pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma grol ba'i sems can rnams go rims bzhin du yongs su bzung ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / yongs su grol ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad cing tshogs bsags pa zhes byed pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: “By practicing” indicates the activity of gathering the accumulations, which is the opposite of actualizing the perfect limit of the nature as it has been explained, and it is the activity of gathering, properly holding, and completely liberating sentient beings who have not been gathered, who have not been properly held, and who have not been completely liberated, respectively, by means of generosity and so on through skill in wisdom and method.

original: de lta ma yin na rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if it were otherwise, realization would be untenable.

original: kha cig las ni gdams pa phog cing zhes 'don pa ni go sla'o//
analyzed: kha cig las ni gdams pa phog cing zhes 'don pa ni go sla'o//
translated: Some editions read “some were given instructions,” which is easy to understand.

original: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bskyed cing thugs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bskyed cing thugs su chud pa yin no //
translated: It is the generation and realization of the unsurpassed wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: de ltar dpe bstan nas dpe can gyi don smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dpe bstan nas dpe can gyi don smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, Blessed One, we also, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bdag cag nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa dag nyid kyis rjes su gzung ba dang yongs su gtad pa'i tshul gyis rjes su gzung bar bgyi zhing
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bdag cag nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa dag nyid kyis rjes su gzung ba dang yongs su gtad pa'i tshul gyis rjes su gzung bar bgyi zhing
translated: Thus means in that way, i.e., in the same way.🔽The word also means not only the Blessed One, but also we great disciples, by means of instruction and demonstration, should take up the task of guiding and entrusting.

original: rjes su bskor bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su bskor bar bgyi'o //
translated: We should take up the task of guiding and entrusting by means of instruction and demonstration.

original: de bzhin du gong nas gong du yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du yang dag par yongs su gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gong nas gong du yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du yang dag par yongs su gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: In the same way, for the sake of further maturation, we should take up the task of perfect guidance.

original: yang dag par yongs su bskor ba yang bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su bskor ba yang bgyi'o //
translated: We should take up the task of perfect guidance.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word also has the sense of restriction.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su bzung ba ltar nyan thos khyed rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag de bzhin du rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel pa ci zhig
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su bzung ba ltar nyan thos khyed rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag de bzhin du rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel pa ci zhig
translated: What is the connection between the statement, “Just as the Lord in the past when he was a bodhisattva was taken care of by the śrāvakas, so you śrāvakas should take care of other bodhisattvas in the same way,” and the statement, “The śrāvakas should not be taken care of by the bodhisattvas”?🔽

original: yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: What is the connection between the statement “Just as the Lord previously cared for the śrāvakas when he was a bodhisattva, so you śrāvakas should care for other bodhisattvas in the same way” and the question “Why is it so?”

original: zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis kyang 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis kyang 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response to this question is “The Lord has said, ‘We also should care for them in the same way,’ and so on.

original: bsam pa ni 'di @77b yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di @77b yin te /
translated: The thought is this.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyis rang gi sangs rgyas rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod do zhes sngar mdzad pa'i phan btags pa khong du chud pas de rnams la slar bka' drin du gzo ba'i
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyis rang gi sangs rgyas rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod do zhes sngar mdzad pa'i phan btags pa khong du chud pas de rnams la slar bka' drin du gzo ba'i
translated: Just as the śrāvakas understood that the buddhas in their bodhisattva stage previously benefited them by practicing pure conduct for the sake of themselves and others, they now repay that kindness to the buddhas.

original: bsam pas de rnams kyi drung du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa na mchog tu byams pa'i sh'akya thub pas rjes su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam pas de rnams kyi drung du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa na mchog tu byams pa'i sh'akya thub pas rjes su bzung ba yin no //
translated: In our thoughts, we will be in the presence of the Blessed One, and when he was a bodhisattva, for our sake, he practiced pure conduct, and was taken care of by the most loving Śākyamuni.

original: de bzhin du bdag cag nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag cag nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, we great śrāvakas🔽will also be in the presence of the king of the Śākyas, when he was a bodhisattva, and for our sake, he will practice pure conduct.”

original: sh'akya'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod par gyur to zhes bgyi ba sngon gyi phan pa mdzad pa khong du chud pas bcom ldan 'das la bka' drin gzo ba'i bsam pas khyed kyi drung du
analyzed: sh'akya'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bdag cag rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod par gyur to zhes bgyi ba sngon gyi phan pa mdzad pa khong du chud pas bcom ldan 'das la bka' drin gzo ba'i bsam pas khyed kyi drung du
translated: With the thought of repaying the kindness of the Blessed One, who understands the benefit he has previously bestowed,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu byams pa rnams rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu byams pa rnams rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: for the sake of sentient beings in the future, we will take care of the most loving bodhisattvas who practice pure conduct in your presence.

original: de ltar na bdag cag rnams bcom ldan 'das bka' drin gzo ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag cag rnams bcom ldan 'das bka' drin gzo ba yin no //
translated: Thus, we are repaying the kindness of the Blessed One.

original: de ltar rjes su bzung bas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su bzung bas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens through being thus cared for?

original: myur du bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: They quickly become fully enlightened, etc.

original: mngon par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become fully enlightened means they realize.

original: la la las mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: la la las mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: They become fully enlightened.

original: de la kha cig de ni rjes su bzung bas de nyid kyi tshe kho na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin pas dpyad par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig de ni rjes su bzung bas de nyid kyi tshe kho na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin pas dpyad par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: This should be analyzed, since through being thus cared for, they are not fully enlightened at that very time.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tshogs pas 'bras bu 'byung ba brjod par 'dod pa nad ltar ba brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tshogs pas 'bras bu 'byung ba brjod par 'dod pa nad ltar ba brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The statement is intended to show that the effect occurs when the complete assemblage of causes is present, like the appearance of a disease.

original: mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa ni ji skad du brjod pa de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa ni ji skad du brjod pa de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The obscuration of the knowable, etc. should be understood just as it is stated.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the gods suitable,🔽he obscures with light,🔽determining the object, pervading,

original: 'od kyis mog mog par mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog par mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
translated: the nature, and its activity.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar rten la sogs pa brjod nas nyan thos kyi lam gyi don ni //
analyzed: de ltar rten la sogs pa brjod nas nyan thos kyi lam gyi don ni //
translated: Having thus described the basis and so forth, the meaning of the śrāvaka path

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is stated from “Then the venerable Subhūti” and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rang gi lam @78a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rang gi lam @78a * //
translated: “For that reason” means that because in the context of the knowledge of the path, having reached the culmination of one’s own path,

original: gyi mthar thug par phyin par byas nas theg ba gzhan gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du mngon du ma byas par yang rgyu dang bcas pa'i lam ston pa dang / 'dris par byas pa la mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gyi mthar thug par phyin par byas nas theg ba gzhan gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du mngon du ma byas par yang rgyu dang bcas pa'i lam ston pa dang / 'dris par byas pa la mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: one teaches the path together with its cause without manifesting it for the sake of sentient beings to be trained by other vehicles, and because one is skilled in making it familiar,

original: byang chub sems dpas lam thams cad rdzogs par bya dgos pa de'i phyir kho bos khyed la nyan thos kyi lam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lam thams cad rdzogs par bya dgos pa de'i phyir kho bos khyed la nyan thos kyi lam bshad par bya ste /
translated: Because the bodhisattva must perfect all paths, therefore I will explain to you the śrāvaka path.

original: koo shi ka nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Kauśika, listen!

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis legs par nyon la zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis legs par nyon la zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Master Vasubandhu says, listen well.

original: ji ltar lha rnams kyis char phab kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar lha rnams kyis char phab kyang /
translated: Just as when the gods send rain,

original: snod kha sbub pa la cung zad kyang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: snod kha sbub pa la cung zad kyang mi 'jug go //
translated: not a drop enters a vessel turned upside down.

original: de bzhin du khyod kha thur du lta zhing khong du ma chud pas ma nyan cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod kha thur du lta zhing khong du ma chud pas ma nyan cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, you should not listen with a downward-facing mind, without understanding.

original: rab tu zhes gsungs pas ni ji ltar snod mi gtsang ba zed pa la chu gang zhig chud pa de thams cad mi gtsang bar 'gyur zhing dgos pa mi byed do //
analyzed: rab tu zhes gsungs pas ni ji ltar snod mi gtsang ba zed pa la chu gang zhig chud pa de thams cad mi gtsang bar 'gyur zhing dgos pa mi byed do //
translated: By saying well, it means that just as water poured into an unclean vessel becomes unclean and serves no purpose,

original: de bzhin du khyed log par rtogs pas nyan cing mi gtsang bar byed pas ma nyan cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyed log par rtogs pas nyan cing mi gtsang bar byed pas ma nyan cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: similarly, you should not listen with a wrong understanding, making it unclean.

original: yid la zung shig ces gsungs pa ni ji ltar snod gtsang ma bu ga can zed par chu zhugs kyang gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: yid la zung shig ces gsungs pa ni ji ltar snod gtsang ma bu ga can zed par chu zhugs kyang gnas par mi byed do //
translated: The statement keep it in mind means that just as water enters an open vessel with a hole, but does not remain there,

original: de bzhin du khyed rtogs pa mi brtan pas ma nyan par ci nas kyang shin tu gsal bar khong du chud pa'i sgo nas sems brtan par gyur pa de ltar nyon ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyed rtogs pa mi brtan pas ma nyan par ci nas kyang shin tu gsal bar khong du chud pa'i sgo nas sems brtan par gyur pa de ltar nyon ces bya ba yin te /
translated: so you should listen with an unstable mind, but you should listen in such a way that you will understand it very clearly and your mind will become stable.

original: de ltar na thos pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na thos pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus listening has a result.

original: 'phags pa lhas ni gzu bor gnas pa dang don du gnyer bar gyur pas nyon cig ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du legs pa dang rab tu zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'phags pa lhas ni gzu bor gnas pa dang don du gnyer bar gyur pas nyon cig ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du legs pa dang rab tu zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: Aryadeva states: Listen with an impartial mind and a mind that seeks. Listen well and listen with a mind that is fully focused.🔽Thus, he states that you should listen with a good mind and a fully focused mind.

original: / de bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa por gyur pas nges par rtogs shig ces bya ba ni yid la zung shig ces gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa por gyur pas nges par rtogs shig ces bya ba ni yid la zung shig ces gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He states understand in the sense of keep it in mind by one who has become an investigator.

original: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: He explains that this teaches the characteristics of a listener.

original: kho bos khyed la bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyed la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bstan bar bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho bos khyed la bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyed la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bstan bar bya'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I will teach it to you means I will explain it for the purpose of benefiting you.

original: khyed ji ltar 'chad ce na /
analyzed: khyed ji ltar 'chad ce na /
translated: How do you explain?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says just as, etc.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi rang bzhin la gnas par bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi rang bzhin la gnas par bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Just as, by what manner, should one stand in the perfection of wisdom, i.e., in the nature of the Sravaka path, should one practice it.

original: de ltar khas blangs nas da ni koo shi ka zhes bya ba @78b la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs nas da ni koo shi ka zhes bya ba @78b la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Having thus promised, now he says, Kausika, etc.

original: stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang 'brel ba'i rnam pa rnams mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang 'brel ba'i rnam pa rnams mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: In emptiness means in the nonapprehension of the aspects connected with the four holy truths of suffering, etc.

original: spyir bshad pa yin du zin kyang khyad par du khong du chud pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi man ngag la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyir bshad pa yin du zin kyang khyad par du khong du chud pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi man ngag la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: Although this is a general explanation, it is understood in particular by following the instructions of the former masters.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning of this is as follows:

original: de la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis na mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis na mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, impermanence is due to the reality of arising and destruction.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams ni rjes su mi mthun pa nyid kyis na sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams ni rjes su mi mthun pa nyid kyis na sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: Suffering is due to the disharmony of all contaminated things.

original: de ltar byas na 'phags pa'i lam yang mi rtag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'phags pa'i lam yang mi rtag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: If this is so, then the noble path is indeed impermanent.

original: zag pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la mi mthun pa ma yin pas 'di sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la mi mthun pa ma yin pas 'di sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not suffering, because it is not disharmonious for the noble ones, since it is uncontaminated.

original: bdag gzhan gyi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gzhan gyi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: Selflessness is due to the emptiness of self and other.

original: rang nyid bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is peace because it is not the self. This is the aspect of the truth of suffering.

original: 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad nyid do //
translated: It is the root because it is the seed of the fruit.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras nyid do //
translated: It is the fruit because it is the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir zug rdu nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir zug rdu nyid do //
translated: It is the thorn because it is the condition of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal brgyud mar rab tu 'byung ba nyid kyis na shin tu 'joms pa'i phyir sdig pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyud mar rab tu 'byung ba nyid kyis na shin tu 'joms pa'i phyir sdig pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is evil because it is the source of suffering, and because it is the cause of the destruction of the good. This is the aspect of the truth of origin.

original: phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir pha rol nyid do //
translated: It is the other shore because it is the adversary.

original: phyir rgol ba'i dngos pos rab tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba de dag nyid la so sor yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i dngos pos rab tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba de dag nyid la so sor yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is subject to destruction because it is subject to destruction by the things that oppose it. This is the aspect of disgust with regard to suffering and origination.

original: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir g-yo ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir g-yo ba nyid do //
translated: It is unstable because it does not remain in its own nature.

original: rgyu la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rab tu 'jig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la so sor 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o//
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rab tu 'jig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la so sor 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o//
translated: It is subject to perishing because it is subject to destruction by nature, without depending on a cause. This is the aspect of detachment with regard to those two.

original: 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is subject to cessation because it is the basis of harm in this life and the next.

original: srin po la sogs pa'i 'tshe bas glags thob pa yin pa'i phyir 'go ba'i nad nyid do //
analyzed: srin po la sogs pa'i 'tshe bas glags thob pa yin pa'i phyir 'go ba'i nad nyid do //
translated: It is subject to being seized by calamity because it is subject to calamity from ogres, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnas su gyur par nyid yin pa'i phyir nye @79a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnas su gyur par nyid yin pa'i phyir nye @79a * //
translated: It is subject to being seized by violent death because it is the basis of harm from the disturbance of the great elements, lightning, thunderbolts, etc.

original: bar 'tshe ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la so sor 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'tshe ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la so sor 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The obstacle is the same as the obstruction.

original: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i lung gi don bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i lung gi don bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the scriptural passage is explained: “The noble disciples enter into the realization of disenchantment, detachment, and cessation.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of self is due to the absence of afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid do //
translated: Peace is due to the complete cessation of suffering.

original: bde ba dang gtsang ba'i dngos po nyid kyis na dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang gtsang ba'i dngos po nyid kyis na dben pa nyid do //
translated: Isolation is due to the nature of happiness and purity.

original: rtag pa dang phan ba'i dngos po nyid kyis na stong ba nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang phan ba'i dngos po nyid kyis na stong ba nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the absence of mental formations are due to the nature of permanence and benefit.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the aspect of the truth of cessation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa nyid kyis na lam nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa nyid kyis na lam nyid do //
translated: It is the path itself because it causes one to attain the city of nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus ba'i gnyen po'i tshogs su gyur bas na rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus ba'i gnyen po'i tshogs su gyur bas na rig pa nyid do //
translated: It is the knowledge itself because it is the collection of antidotes to all the afflictions.

original: sems kyi phyin ci ma log pa nyid du sgrub pa'i don gyis na sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi phyin ci ma log pa nyid du sgrub pa'i don gyis na sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: It is the practice itself because it is the meaning of the establishment of the non-error of mind.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pas rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pas rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is the definite release itself because it goes to the abode of permanence without attachment. These are the aspects of the truth of the path.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis na theg pa chen por rnam pa la la ni rnam grangs kyis /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis na theg pa chen por rnam pa la la ni rnam grangs kyis /
translated: Thus, by this process, some aspects are taught in the Mahayana as synonyms,

original: la la ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and some are taught as their own nature. Therefore, it does not follow that it is not the śrāvaka path.

original: de bas na lam shes pa'i skabs su byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i bden pa dang 'brel ba 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs par bsgoms pas nyan thos kyi lam shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lam shes pa'i skabs su byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i bden pa dang 'brel ba 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs par bsgoms pas nyan thos kyi lam shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the context of knowledge of the path, the bodhisattva, by cultivating the non-apprehension of the intrinsic reality of these [four noble truths] connected with the noble truths, should know the śrāvaka path.

original: mdor bsdus pa 'di'i don ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsal ba kho nar 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir log par khong du chung par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa 'di'i don ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsal ba kho nar 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir log par khong du chung par mi bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this brief summary should not be misunderstood, since it is clearly stated in the Twenty-Five Thousand [Lines].

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
translated: In the method of knowledge of the path,🔽By the non-apprehension of the aspects

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //
translated: Of the four noble truths,

original: nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The śrāvaka should know this path.

original: de ltar nyan thos kyi lam brjod nas dro pa'i don ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos kyi lam brjod nas dro pa'i don ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, having described the śrāvaka path, [the sūtra] teaches the meaning of the heat [stage].

original: koo shi ka de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Kauśika, therefore, and so on is stated.

original: gang gi phyir bden par bzhi yongs su shes pa ni nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir byang @79b chub sems dpas dro ba rtogs par bya ba'i don du gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang
analyzed: gang gi phyir bden par bzhi yongs su shes pa ni nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir byang @79b chub sems dpas dro ba rtogs par bya ba'i don du gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang
translated: Because the thorough knowledge of the four noble truths is preceded by the realization of the factors conducive to penetrative insight, the bodhisattva should meditate on the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of form in order to realize the heat stage.

original: / tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: / tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: And so on for feeling and so forth.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The intrinsic reality of form and the emptiness of feeling and so on are nondual and not divided into two.

original: don 'di yang go cha chen po bgos par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di yang go cha chen po bgos par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This meaning is also indicated by the passage beginning “They are fully armored.”

original: de yang rgyal ba'i yum bar ma las /
analyzed: de yang rgyal ba'i yum bar ma las /
translated: And this is also stated in the middle wheel of the Victor:

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' go cha chen po bgos pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' go cha chen po bgos pa lags /
translated: To what extent is a bodhisattva fully armored?

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dbyer med pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dbyer med pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: “Subhūti, this is called the bodhisattva’s realization of the emptiness of all phenomena as being inseparable.”

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //🔽gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni // gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid phyir //
translated: The noble disciple on the path🔽Because the aggregates such as form are empty,

original: stong pa nyid rnams dbye rmed pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams dbye rmed pas //
translated: By dividing emptinesses,

original: dro ba / zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dro ba / zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The heat stage is taught.

original: rtse mo bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rtse mo bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to teach the peak stage, it says “do not abide in form,” and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: This is intended in terms of the mode of apprehension.

original: mig la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: mig la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: “Do not abide in the eyes,” and so on, “do not abide in the applications of mindfulness,” and so on, “do not abide in the fruit of stream-entry,” and so on.

original: go rims bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / gnyi ga dang / zag pa med pa nyid kyi phung po lnga po 'di rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dres kyi don yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / gnyi ga dang / zag pa med pa nyid kyi phung po lnga po 'di rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dres kyi don yin no //
translated: The five aggregates are respectively taught as the classification of the contaminated, both, and uncontaminated aggregates.

original: khams la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ma bris so //
analyzed: khams la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ma bris so //
translated: The characteristics of the nature of the constituents and so on are well known, so they are not written.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du zhes bya ba 'dir bar dang zhes smos pas ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la bsgre ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du zhes bya ba 'dir bar dang zhes smos pas ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la bsgre ba yin no //
translated: Up to the mental consciousness: the word “up to” refers to the ear consciousness and so on.

original: tha na sangs rgyas nyid la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas nyid la'o //
analyzed: tha na sangs rgyas nyid la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas nyid la'o //
translated: One should not even abide in buddhahood: in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: gal te rten gyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la gnas par mi bya na /
analyzed: gal te rten gyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la gnas par mi bya na /
translated: If one should not abide in form and so on, which are the nature of the basis,

original: de lta na ni 'o na tshig thams cad ni ldog pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' @80a * //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na tshig thams cad ni ldog pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'o // de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' @80a * //
translated: If that is so, then since all words have the effect of excluding, form and so on would be the effect of the word “exclusion.”

original: zhig rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhig rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the idea that form and so on are established by the word “exclusion,”

original: de ltar na gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the root text says, “In that case, do not meditate on form.”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “in that case” means “therefore.”

original: na'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word “but” is as before.

original: ngag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir rigs pas dmigs su med par bsgom pa na gzugs la sogs par yod pa ma yin pas na rten du bsgom pa mi 'thad pa'i rgyu de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs pas dmigs su med par bsgom pa na gzugs la sogs par yod pa ma yin pas na rten du bsgom pa mi 'thad pa'i rgyu de'i phyir /
translated: Since form and so on do not exist when they are meditated on as not being observed by reasoning, it is not tenable to meditate on them as supports. Therefore,

original: rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba la de'i bdag nyid dang gzhan bar khas blang ba'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba la de'i bdag nyid dang gzhan bar khas blang ba'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: it is not tenable to assert that something that lacks its own nature has the nature of being the same or different.

original: gdul bya'i skye ba nyi ba rnams kyi phyin ci log bsal bar 'dod pas ci zhig lta rten gyi ngo bor bstan pas na ldog pa'i 'bras bu can du yang khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye ba nyi ba rnams kyi phyin ci log bsal bar 'dod pas ci zhig lta rten gyi ngo bor bstan pas na ldog pa'i 'bras bu can du yang khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is taught as the nature of the basis for the purpose of dispelling the errors of disciples who are beginners, it should not be accepted as having a result of removal.

original: de bas na rtse mo gtogs par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtse mo gtogs par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to attain the peak, one should cultivate the non-apprehension of form, etc., in every way.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: de dag mi dmigs pas //🔽rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pas // rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: By the non-apprehension of those,

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they are considered to be the peak.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tsho rab zhes bya ba 'dir bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tsho rab zhes bya ba 'dir bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “arisen from the union of mental faculty, dharmas, and manas” includes eye-consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bya ba 'dir bar du zhes bya ba smos pas ni chu'i khams la sogs ba yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bya ba 'dir bar du zhes bya ba smos pas ni chu'i khams la sogs ba yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “the element of consciousness” includes the water element, etc.

original: bzod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach patience, it is said:

original: gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One should not abide in the notion that form is permanent or impermanent, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni bshad zin to //
translated: The words impermanent, etc., have been explained.

original: de las bzlog pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: The words permanent, etc., should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbye bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa nye bar bzung bar byas pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa thams cad las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbye bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa nye bar bzung bar byas pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa thams cad las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspects of the truth of suffering are foremost because they are the basis for the differentiation of the categories of unfavorable and favorable. They are for the purpose of turning away from all attachments.

original: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form is agreeable or disagreeable.

original: sdug pa ni bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa ni bsngags pa'o //
translated: Agreeable means praise.

original: mi sdug pa ni mi bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni mi bsngags pa'o //
translated: Disagreeable means blame.

original: 'di dag kyang bden pa lhag ma rnams kyi rnam pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang bden pa lhag ma rnams kyi rnam pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa yin no //
translated: These are the principal aspects of the remaining truths.

original: gal te de ltar rnam pa thams cad dang bral na de lta na ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa sal bar bya ba'i phyir gzugs stong pa'o zhes dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs @80b pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam pa thams cad dang bral na de lta na ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa sal bar bya ba'i phyir gzugs stong pa'o zhes dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs @80b pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it is said, “By the observation, ‘form is empty,’ etc.”

original: stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bkag pas stong pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bkag pas stong pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: By negating a non-empty entity, it is called “empty.”

original: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in the manner explained, because it is not an entity,

original: yul med pa la dgag pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yul med pa la dgag pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: it is not reasonable to negate the non-existent object.🔽This is the intended meaning.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is saying,

original: bzod pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas skabs thams cad du gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas skabs thams cad du gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: “In order to realize forbearance, one should not abide in any situation by the mode of observation, such as ‘form is permanent’ or ‘form is impermanent,’ and so on. One should cultivate in that way.”

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said,

original: de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
analyzed: de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
translated: In this regard,

original: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
translated: the acceptances are the refutation of the mode of abiding as permanent, etc.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: chos kyi mchog bstan pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog bstan pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the supreme phenomena, he says, “the result of stream-enterer,” and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result is distinguished by the unconditioned.

original: de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir lam ni 'dus ma byas las rab tu skyes pa 'bras bu nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir lam ni 'dus ma byas las rab tu skyes pa 'bras bu nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The path is the result, since it arises from the unconditioned, because it has the nature of non-arising in reality.

original: de ltar spyir mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i don bstan nas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar spyir mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i don bstan nas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught in general the meaning of the refutation of attachment, in order to teach the distinctions, he says,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa spyin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa spyin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The abode of generosity for the stream-enterer,” and so on.

original: bsod nams kyi zhing khyad par can yin pa nyid kyis na gtsor sbyin par 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing khyad par can yin pa nyid kyis na gtsor sbyin par 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i gnas so //
translated: Because of being a special field of merit, it is the foremost object of generosity, and thus it is the abode of generosity.

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya ba'i lhag ma lus pas re ltar te mchog tu thogs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas su lan bdun gyi bar du gzhol ba yin no //
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya ba'i lhag ma lus pas re ltar te mchog tu thogs kyang 'khor ba'i gnas su lan bdun gyi bar du gzhol ba yin no //
translated: At most, seven times: at most, he is reborn seven times among gods and humans.

original: yongs su mthar ma phyin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yongs su mthar ma phyin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because the action is not completed, etc.

original: bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mi'i 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs te phyin par gyur nas sdug bsngal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mi'i 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs te phyin par gyur nas sdug bsngal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: Because the action is not completed, he comes once to the human world, and having come, he puts an end to suffering, i.e., he destroys passion, etc.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma'i gnas skas su'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma'i gnas skas su'o //
translated: In that very place, i.e., in the intermediate existence.

original: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa skye ba gang du skyes pa de nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa skye ba gang du skyes pa de nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In this very place, i.e., in the very place where the Arhat is born.

original: phung bo lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung bo lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the realm of Nirvana without remainder, i.e., in the realm of Nirvana without a remaining substratum.

original: phung po ni lus so //
analyzed: phung po ni lus so //
translated: The aggregates are the body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir lhag ma nyid du gyur pa'i lhag ma de mya ngan las 'das pa gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽gang du rnam @81a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir lhag ma nyid du gyur pa'i lhag ma de mya ngan las 'das pa gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o // gang du rnam @81a * //
translated: It is nirvana in which there is no remainder, because it is the remainder of the abandonment of all desire, etc.

original: par rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: par rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Where all conceptualization has ceased, that is nirvana, that is thusness.

original: de nyid ni dbyings te /
analyzed: de nyid ni dbyings te /
translated: That itself is the element,

original: de la dmigs pa'i dngos pos 'phags pa rnams skyed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i dngos pos 'phags pa rnams skyed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: because it is the cause of the generation of the noble ones by means of the objective support of that.

original: de bas na dbyings der zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na dbyings der zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is connected with “in that element.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi smos pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi smos pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The four kinds of abiders in the result are mentioned beginning with “stream-enterer,” and so the four states of entry are also included, because they are invariably concomitant.

original: des na nyan thos kyis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nyan thos kyis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are eight kinds of śrāvakas.

original: gang zag gang gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa ji tsam spangs pas zhugs pa nyid la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir slar nye bar bkod pa ma byas so //🔽rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdor bstan pa'i tshig 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa ji tsam spangs pas zhugs pa nyid la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir slar nye bar bkod pa ma byas so // rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdor bstan pa'i tshig 'chad pa ni /
translated: Since it has already been explained that the classification of the enterer and so on is based on the degree to which any person abandons aspects of affliction, it is not repeated here.

original: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the words of the brief presentation is stated in the words “self-realized buddha” and so on.

original: bdag nyid gcig pu'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rang gi byang chub rtogs pa rang nyid yin pas na rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pu'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rang gi byang chub rtogs pa rang nyid yin pas na rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Because it is the cause of its own enlightenment, it is a self-realized buddha.

original: nyan thos kyang de ltar thal bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyang de ltar thal bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not the case that this is also the case for śrāvakas,

original: de ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they rely on the teachings of others.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yang thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yang thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that this is the case for perfect buddhas,🔽because they are not born from the class of beings.

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyi don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ched du mdzad pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyi don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ched du mdzad pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is superior because it is the cause of the knowledge of all modes for the sake of all beings.

original: 'dis ni sa dgu pa rang sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa dgu pa rang sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the ninth stage, the pratyekabuddha stage.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas de la brgal nas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas de la brgal nas so //
translated: Having gone beyond the śrāvaka stage means having gone beyond that stage by abandoning the discrimination of the object as substance.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ma thob pa ni 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ma rtogs par ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ma thob pa ni 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ma rtogs par ro //
translated: Not having attained the buddha stage means not having realized the supreme enlightenment by not abandoning the discrimination of the object as subject.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas sbyin pa'i gnas so zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas sbyin pa'i gnas so zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, one should not stand in the notion that “the Buddha is the supreme field of merit.”🔽In order to analyze the statement, he says:

original: sangs rgyas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha is not to be seen by means of the body.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the common man is the stage of action out of faith.

original: gzhal du med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhal du med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Inconceivable, etc.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it cannot be conceived by direct perception, etc.

original: gcig nyid la sogs pa grangs dang bral ba'i phyir grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs pa grangs dang bral ba'i phyir grangs med pa'o //
translated: It is innumerable because it is free from the enumeration of one, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'dul ba la sogs @81b pa gang la dag tu rab tu bzang gi mthar thug pa so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad par la lar gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dul ba la sogs @81b pa gang la dag tu rab tu bzang gi mthar thug pa so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad par la lar gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the statements in the various scriptures, such as the Vinaya, about the performance of the welfare of specific beings in various places and at various times, are intentional.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir don gyi bya ba mdzad pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir don gyi bya ba mdzad pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, it is explained from the point of view of the performance of benefits in this world realm.

original: gzhan du na sprul pa'i sprin rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir grangs med pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang mi 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na sprul pa'i sprin rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir grangs med pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang mi 'gal ba yin no //
translated: But in other places, the clouds of emanations perform the welfare of beings in all world realms, so the words innumerable, etc. are not contradicted.

original: yang na khyad par du 'phags pa theg pa chen po'i ming can gyi theg pa'i khyad par zab mo nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na khyad par du 'phags pa theg pa chen po'i ming can gyi theg pa'i khyad par zab mo nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, this is a different kind of vehicle, which is called the Great Vehicle, and which is endowed with the profound distinction of being superior.

original: des na 'dir mi mthun pa kho nar bstan pa yin pa'i phyir theg pa gzhan dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir mi mthun pa kho nar bstan pa yin pa'i phyir theg pa gzhan dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is taught here as being just the opposite, it should not be said that it is contradictory to the other vehicle.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi don gzhan dag tu yang 'di nyid lan du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi don gzhan dag tu yang 'di nyid lan du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, this very answer should be understood for other similar points.

original: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de //🔽zhes bya ba ni kha cig la sbyin pa la sogs pas mngon par mtho ba'i chos rdzogs par mdzad nas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de // zhes bya ba ni kha cig la sbyin pa la sogs pas mngon par mtho ba'i chos rdzogs par mdzad nas so //
translated: Having accomplished the aims of sentient beings🔽means that, for some, he accomplished the Dharma of high status through generosity and so on.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni kha cig nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'da' pa la sogs pa des nges par legs pa'i chos la bkod nas so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni kha cig nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'da' pa la sogs pa des nges par legs pa'i chos la bkod nas so //
translated: Having passed into parinirvāṇa means that, for some, he established them in the Dharma of definite goodness through the śrāvaka parinirvāṇa and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su nges par mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su nges par mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He definitely established them as sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gang zhig rtogs pas gdon mi za bar mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de la gzhan 'jog pa'i phyir na nges par te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gang zhig rtogs pas gdon mi za bar mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de la gzhan 'jog pa'i phyir na nges par te /
translated: He definitely established them in the lineage, because he caused others to enter the cause for attaining the Dharma of the high states and definite excellence without doubt, through realization of any virtue such as the factors conducive to penetrations.

original: rigs nges pa la gnas par mdzad cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs nges pa la gnas par mdzad cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of definitely established in the lineage is the meaning of definitely established.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun tu 'od ces pa sa bcu pa ni sangs rgyas kyis yin par bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun tu 'od ces pa sa bcu pa ni sangs rgyas kyis yin par bshad do //
translated: This buddha stage is the tenth stage, the stage of universal light, which is explained as the buddha stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: The buddha activity is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas so //
translated: By the parinirvana of the Buddha means by the parinirvana that is not shared in common with sravakas and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni sprul pa'i sku yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni sprul pa'i sku yin par 'dod do //
translated: This nirvana is held to be the emanation body.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lung dang rigs pa las so //🔽'di ltar gnas pa'i rgyu ma tang ba med pa can gang yin pa de ni rtag tu @82a * //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa las so // 'di ltar gnas pa'i rgyu ma tang ba med pa can gang yin pa de ni rtag tu @82a * //
translated: From scripture and reasoning.

original: gnas pa rgyun chad pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa rgyun chad pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which has an unimpaired cause of abiding is always abiding and not by nature interrupted.

original: dper na me dang shing la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu nus pa can yongs su rdzogs par yod pa can gyi du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me dang shing la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu nus pa can yongs su rdzogs par yod pa can gyi du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, smoke and so on have a complete and fully functional cause of abiding, such as fire and fuel.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin no //
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha also has an unimpaired cause of abiding.

original: gnas pa rgyun chad pa'i khyab par byed pa gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa dang 'gal ba gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba nyid 'dir bsgrub pa'i phyir na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa rgyun chad pa'i khyab par byed pa gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa dang 'gal ba gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba nyid 'dir bsgrub pa'i phyir na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is established by the contradictory pervasion of the non-completeness of the cause of endurance, which is the cause of the interruption of endurance.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i rgyun chad pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i rgyun chad pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The dissimilar instance is like the interruption of the continuum of smoke and so on.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The non-completeness of the cause is contradictory to existence.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is this reason established?

original: brjod pa / gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i nus pa yongs su zad pas sam /
analyzed: brjod pa / gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i nus pa yongs su zad pas sam /
translated: It is said: The non-completeness of the cause of endurance is due to the exhaustion of the ability to accomplish the welfare of sentient beings,

original: thugs rje chen po dang bral bas sam /🔽tshe'i 'du byed gnas pa la mnga' brnyes pa las nyams pas sam /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang bral bas sam / tshe'i 'du byed gnas pa la mnga' brnyes pa las nyams pas sam /
translated: or due to being devoid of great compassion,🔽or due to the decline of mastery over the duration of life,

original: srog gi dbang po gnas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa mthar gtugs pas sam /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gnas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa mthar gtugs pas sam /
translated: or due to the final exhaustion of the ripening of the karma that sustains the life faculty,

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gdul bya rnams med pa las yin grang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gdul bya rnams med pa las yin grang /
translated: It is not that there are no disciples to be trained by the Buddha.

original: de la rtog pa dang po ni med de /
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang po ni med de /
translated: The first conception is not so.

original: ston pa'i mkhyen pa nus pa thogs pa med pa can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i mkhyen pa nus pa thogs pa med pa can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that the Teacher’s knowledge is unimpeded in power.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di bse ru la sogs pa rnams las khyad par ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di bse ru la sogs pa rnams las khyad par ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, what would be the difference between him and the rhinoceros-like?

original: dus yun ring por goms pas gtsang sbra can thod pa can la zhe mi btsogs pa ltar brtse ba chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur par mdzad pa'i phyir 'bad pa med par nyams pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par 'phel ba de'i ro myang ba lhur mdzad pa ni
analyzed: dus yun ring por goms pas gtsang sbra can thod pa can la zhe mi btsogs pa ltar brtse ba chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur par mdzad pa'i phyir 'bad pa med par nyams pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par 'phel ba de'i ro myang ba lhur mdzad pa ni
translated: Because he has become the embodiment of great compassion, he is not like the ascetic who, through long habituation, is not disgusted by the skull, for he does not decline without effort, and he delights in the taste of its increase.

original: de nyid phyogs su lhung bas na /
analyzed: de nyid phyogs su lhung bas na /
translated: Since he is not partial to any of them,

original: skyon ma mthong ba'i phyir 'bad pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yang med do //
analyzed: skyon ma mthong ba'i phyir 'bad pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yang med do //
translated: he does not have the second conception, because he does not see any fault in them and he does not make any effort.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yang rigs pa dang 'brel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yang rigs pa dang 'brel ba ma yin no //
translated: If one has perfected the cultivation of the bases of psychic power, even the third conception is not related to logic.

original: de skad du yang /🔽'di ltar kun dga' bo gang la la zhig rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa de ni 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'di ltar kun dga' bo gang la la zhig rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa de ni 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And thus:🔽“Ānanda, whoever cultivates and repeatedly practices the four bases of psychic power can, if he wishes, remain for an eon or until the end of the eon.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du mdzad pas de bzhed na bskal pa'am bskal @82b ba las lhag par bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du mdzad pas de bzhed na bskal pa'am bskal @82b ba las lhag par bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ānanda, the Tathāgata, who has cultivated and repeatedly practiced the four bases of psychic power, can, if he wishes, remain for an eon or until the end of the eon.”

original: srog gi 'bras bu can gyi zad pa yang srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / thabs dpag tu med pas goms par byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa skal ba mi nyung bar bsags pa'i bla ma la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog gi 'bras bu can gyi zad pa yang srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / thabs dpag tu med pas goms par byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa skal ba mi nyung bar bsags pa'i bla ma la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The result of life is the exhaustion of life, which is the abandonment of killing, and the perfection of generosity, which is cultivated by immeasurable means, is not possible for a guru who has accumulated little merit.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the nature of cause and effect.

original: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa las ni 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa 'byung la mchog ma yin pa las ni mchog yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa las ni 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa 'byung la mchog ma yin pa las ni mchog yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: From a supreme cause arises a supreme effect, and from an inferior cause arises an inferior effect.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu phul du byung ba dang phul du byung ba ma yin pa dag la 'bras bu la de mi 'byung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu phul du byung ba dang phul du byung ba ma yin pa dag la 'bras bu la de mi 'byung ba'i phyir na /
translated: If that were not so, then a supreme cause and an inferior cause would not produce that effect.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the entity of the benefited and the benefactor would not occur,

original: de la brten pa'i tha dad pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i tha dad pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not depend on the difference based on that.

original: ston pa la ni dpag tu med par 'tsho ba'i rgyu gzhan gsod pa spangs pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa dpag tu med pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ston pa la ni dpag tu med par 'tsho ba'i rgyu gzhan gsod pa spangs pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa dpag tu med pa yod pa yin te /
translated: But the Teacher has immeasurable causes for living, such as abandoning the killing of others and so on, and he has immeasurable nonvirtuous actions.

original: des na lo brgya yang ji ste mi bzhugs /
analyzed: des na lo brgya yang ji ste mi bzhugs /
translated: So why does he not live for a hundred years?

original: 'di dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: The result of all these is omniscience.

original: gtsor yun ring por 'tsho ba 'bras bu'i brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtsor yun ring por 'tsho ba 'bras bu'i brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is not so, because the result is primarily long life.

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi 'bras bus ni tshe ring bar rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi 'bras bus ni tshe ring bar rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The results of abandoning killing and the perfection of generosity are stated to be long life and the reverse.

original: / gang zhig gang gis gtso bo'i rgyu yin par brjod pa de ni yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i rten nye bar gnas pas de skyed pa nyid na gal te gzhan gyi yang rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / gang zhig gang gis gtso bo'i rgyu yin par brjod pa de ni yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i rten nye bar gnas pas de skyed pa nyid na gal te gzhan gyi yang rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the primary cause of something is stated, then when it is generated, it is not wrong to make it the reason for something else, since it is the basis that fully develops it.

original: lan cig ma yin par rnam par nges pa'i 'bras bu bor nas gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig ma yin par rnam par nges pa'i 'bras bu bor nas gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
