translated: It is not that it abandons the result of definite distinction and generates another result, not just once.

original: lan cig kyang de skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan cig kyang de skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that it would not generate that result even once.

original: gzhan yang chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid la goms par mdzad pa'i dbang nyid las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid la goms par mdzad pa'i dbang nyid las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, the state of omniscience arises from the power of cultivating the reality of phenomena.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni de'i rten khyad par du 'phags pa bskyed pas na rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni de'i rten khyad par du 'phags pa bskyed pas na rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The accumulation of merit is conducive to that, since it generates a special support for it.

original: de bas na bsod nams yongs su zad pas bcom ldan 'das 'chi bar brjod pa ni ba bcol yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsod nams yongs su zad pas bcom ldan 'das 'chi bar brjod pa ni ba bcol yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a mistake to say that the Bhagavān dies because his merit is exhausted.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes 'dod na de 'dir dpyad par bya ste /🔽ci sangs @83a * //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes 'dod na de 'dir dpyad par bya ste / ci sangs @83a * //
translated: If you maintain that the Tathāgata attains nirvana because there are no sentient beings to be trained, this should be analyzed.

original: rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i sems can nyid med dam /
analyzed: rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i sems can nyid med dam /
translated: Is it that there are no sentient beings to be trained by the body of the Buddha?

original: 'on te ci gzugs gzhan dag gis 'dul ba rnams kyang med /
analyzed: 'on te ci gzugs gzhan dag gis 'dul ba rnams kyang med /
translated: Or, are there no beings to be disciplined by other forms?

original: gal te phyogs snga ma ltar yin na de'i tshe brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs su bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams srid pas de'i gzugs ci ste mi bzhugs /
analyzed: gal te phyogs snga ma ltar yin na de'i tshe brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs su bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams srid pas de'i gzugs ci ste mi bzhugs /
translated: If it is the first case, then since there are beings to be disciplined by the form of Sakra and so on, why does he not remain in that form?

original: thugs brtse ba'i dbang du gyur pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de dag ni skye bo rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir cha lugs gzhan dag gis kyang gnas par mdzad de /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i dbang du gyur pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de dag ni skye bo rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir cha lugs gzhan dag gis kyang gnas par mdzad de /
translated: Those who have a mind full of compassion remain in other forms in order to accomplish the benefit of beings.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs su bzhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs su bzhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Lord himself remains in the form of a cakravartin.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba yang med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba yang med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that there are no beings to be disciplined by the form of Sakra and so on.

original: shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no proof.

original: brgya byin la sogs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that Sakra and so on would not benefit others.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gzhan rnams na de yod pa'i phyir 'di ji ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gzhan rnams na de yod pa'i phyir 'di ji ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
translated: Moreover, even if there are no beings to be disciplined by the Buddha’s form in one world, there are beings to be disciplined by the Buddha’s form in other worlds.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na yang de med do zhe na de la de ltar shes par byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na yang de med do zhe na de la de ltar shes par byed pa med do //
translated: If you say that there are no beings to be disciplined by the Buddha’s form in other worlds, how do you know that?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi skus gdul ba'i sems can rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang nas kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi skus gdul ba'i sems can rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang nas kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: It is not stated anywhere that there are no beings to be disciplined by the Buddha’s form in all worlds.

original: 'on te nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that it is not certain that there are beings to be disciplined by the Buddha’s form in other worlds,

original: yod na gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: yod na gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: and that if there were, it would be pointless for the Buddha to enter parinirvāṇa in order to benefit others,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod na 'di nyid kyang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod na 'di nyid kyang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: we reply that it is not established that the Buddha enters parinirvāṇa.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas sangs rgyas kyi sku bstan pas 'dul ba med pa na mya ngan las 'da' ba nye bar bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bstan kyang gzhan
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas sangs rgyas kyi sku bstan pas 'dul ba med pa na mya ngan las 'da' ba nye bar bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bstan kyang gzhan
translated: Because in one world system, there is no need to display a buddha body to tame those who are not tamed by that, and in order to guide those who are tamed by the teaching of nirvana, he teaches nirvana.🔽But in other world systems, he displays without incompleteness his birth, manifest enlightenment, and turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: dag tu bltams pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ma tshang ba med pa nye bar ston pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: dag tu bltams pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ma tshang ba med pa nye bar ston pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan yong mi 'da' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan yong mi 'da' //
translated: Buddhas do not pass into nirvana.

original: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur te //
translated: The Dharma does not set.

original: sems can rnams ni smin mdzad phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin mdzad phyir //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings,

original: mya ngan 'da' bar ston pa mdzad //🔽ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar ston pa mdzad //🔽ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o//
translated: they display nirvana.

original: @83b gzhan yang re zhig srid par rgyu ba'i dam pa gzhan dag snying brtse bas dbul bar gyur kyang ngo cha shes pa dang bden pa'i nor yongs su bskyang bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa thams cad zad kyang nges pa kho nar dam bcas pa'i don gyi sgrub
analyzed: @83b gzhan yang re zhig srid par rgyu ba'i dam pa gzhan dag snying brtse bas dbul bar gyur kyang ngo cha shes pa dang bden pa'i nor yongs su bskyang bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa thams cad zad kyang nges pa kho nar dam bcas pa'i don gyi sgrub
translated: Moreover, for the time being, other holy beings who move in cyclic existence, even though they become poor through their compassion, they definitely accomplish the meaning of their promise, even at the cost of exhausting all their abilities, in order to protect the wealth of truth and to know the faces of others.🔽

original: pa rdzogs par byed pa mthong na /
analyzed: pa rdzogs par byed pa mthong na /
translated: Moreover, when one sees that the best of beings, who move in the world, even when they are poor through the poverty of compassion, even when all their abilities are exhausted, definitely complete the meaning of their promise in order to protect the wealth of truth and shame,

original: skye bo dam pa mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bu /
analyzed: skye bo dam pa mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bu /
translated: what intelligent person would not have faith in the Tathāgatas, who are the crest jewels of all holy beings,

original: srid pa'i 'jig pa las yang dag par brgal ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'jig pa las yang dag par brgal ba /
translated: who have completely transcended the destruction of existence,

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang bden pa dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid du mdzad pa'i chos can ye shes kyi mthu thogs pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de rdzogs par mi mdzad do zhes bya ba la sems dang ldan pa su zhig dad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang bden pa dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid du mdzad pa'i chos can ye shes kyi mthu thogs pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de rdzogs par mi mdzad do zhes bya ba la sems dang ldan pa su zhig dad par 'gyur //
translated: who are endowed with the Dharma that is the nature of shame, truth, and compassion, and whose wisdom power is unobstructed, that they will not complete that?

original: de dag gis dam bcas pa yang sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las shin tu nges par 'grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis dam bcas pa yang sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las shin tu nges par 'grol ba yin te /
translated: And their promise is that they will completely liberate all sentient beings from suffering.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon smon lam btab pa /
translated: Thus, the Lord has made this former aspiration:

original: bsod nams 'di yis thams cad gzigs pa nyid //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis thams cad gzigs pa nyid //
translated: By this merit, having attained the state of an Omniscient One,

original: thob nas nyes pa'i dgra rnams pham byas te //🔽rga nad 'chi ba'i dpa' klong 'khrugs pa yi //
analyzed: thob nas nyes pa'i dgra rnams pham byas te // rga nad 'chi ba'i dpa' klong 'khrugs pa yi //
translated: I will defeat the enemy, the faults,🔽And rescue the world from the ocean of existence,

original: srid pa'i mtsho las 'gro ba 'don par shog //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i mtsho las 'gro ba 'don par shog // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Which is agitated by the waves of old age, sickness, and death.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgras sems can nyung zad gcig gzung bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgras sems can nyung zad gcig gzung bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not proper to take the word “world” to refer to a small number of sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be the great compassion that takes as its object all sentient beings.

original: de bas na ji srid du sems can gcig yod pa de srid du ni thugs rje'i dgongs pa can rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji srid du sems can gcig yod pa de srid du ni thugs rje'i dgongs pa can rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as long as there is even one sentient being, it is not proper for those who have the intention of compassion to enter nirvana.

original: mtha' yas pa yin pas na sems can thams cad 'khor ba las nges par 'don pa mi srid do //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa yin pas na sems can thams cad 'khor ba las nges par 'don pa mi srid do //
translated: And since they are infinite, it is impossible to rescue all sentient beings from cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyis na thugs rje'i rang bzhin can de'i dgongs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi gnas pa ni mtha' yas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na thugs rje'i rang bzhin can de'i dgongs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi gnas pa ni mtha' yas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the state of those who possess the intention of the one who has the nature of compassion is infinite.

original: gzhan du na dam bcas pa dang rjes su sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dam bcas pa dang rjes su sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no promise and no accomplishment.

original: thugs rje chen po dang rjes su mthun par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang rjes su mthun par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be in accord with great compassion.

original: 'di ltar thugs rje chen po ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thugs rje chen po ni 'di yin te /
translated: Great compassion is as follows.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob bar bzhed pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob bar bzhed pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: It is the aspect of the wish to protect all sentient beings from suffering.

original: des na legs par bsgoms pa de gnas ma yin par glo bur du rgyun chad par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: des na legs par bsgoms pa de gnas ma yin par glo bur du rgyun chad par gal 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible that the one who has well cultivated that would suddenly and without reason interrupt the continuity of that.

original: gal te rgyun chad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyun chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the continuity is not interrupted,

original: 'on kyang dus de'i tshe byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya rab bzang gi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btul zin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus de'i tshe byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya rab bzang gi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btul zin la /
translated: but rather all the disciples of the Buddha who arose at that time, the final good disciples, were already subdued,

original: @84a * // gzhan gang dag dus gzhan dag tu rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de'i don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kho na rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na de rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' gzhan 'ga'
analyzed: @84a * // gzhan gang dag dus gzhan dag tu rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de'i don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kho na rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na de rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' gzhan 'ga'
translated: For the sake of those others whose mindstreams will be ripened at other times, other tathagatas will appear in succession to benefit them.

original: zhig la dbang bskur nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
analyzed: zhig la dbang bskur nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, after conferring empowerment on some other bodhisattva for the sake of accomplishing their welfare, the buddhas will pass into parinirvana.

original: de lta ma yin na bar du gzhan gyi don du bzhugs pa'i phyir gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bar du gzhan gyi don du bzhugs pa'i phyir gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so, it would be pointless for them to remain for the sake of others' welfare.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'i sems can med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bya ba gzhan gyi gdul bya dag srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'i sems can med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bya ba gzhan gyi gdul bya dag srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is illogical because it is not established that there are no sentient beings to be guided by buddhas and because it is possible that there are other beings to be guided in all world systems.

original: sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained above.

original: bzhugs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not pointless for them to remain.

original: de'i don mdzad pa'i ched du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don mdzad pa'i ched du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he remains in order to perform that action.

original: ji ltar sh'akya'i rgyal po nyid rab bzang la sdod pas dus cung zad bzhugs par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sh'akya'i rgyal po nyid rab bzang la sdod pas dus cung zad bzhugs par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the king of the Śākyas, though he had attained his goal, remained for a while.

original: dus de ni shin tu thung ba yin no zhes bya ba yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus de ni shin tu thung ba yin no zhes bya ba yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not true that that time is very short,

original: gang gi phyir mngon par bzhed pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de dag dus yun ring pa'am yun thung ba brtsi bar mi mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par bzhed pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de dag dus yun ring pa'am yun thung ba brtsi bar mi mdzad do //
translated: because those who have the intention to accomplish the desired result do not consider whether the time is long or short.

original: dus gzhan du rgyud yongs su smin pa rnams la ni nus pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du rgyud yongs su smin pa rnams la ni nus pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a reply to say that for those whose stream has matured at another time, other powers arise.

original: gang gi phyir de lta na ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la yang 'bad pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta na ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la yang 'bad pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Because in that case, the generation of the thought of awakening would be pointless,

original: 'jig rten gdon pa'i bsam pa can mang po'i bya ba mthong bas de dag gis byas zin na 'dir bdag gis ci zhig bya snyam du sems par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gdon pa'i bsam pa can mang po'i bya ba mthong bas de dag gis byas zin na 'dir bdag gis ci zhig bya snyam du sems par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see the activities of many who have the intention to save the world, and they think, “If they have already done it, what should I do here?”

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas de ltar brtsi bar mi mdzad par 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas de ltar brtsi bar mi mdzad par 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that he does not consider in that way because he has great compassion,

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs su ci'i phyir de ltar brtsi ba mi rtsom /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs su ci'i phyir de ltar brtsi ba mi rtsom /
translated: why does he not consider in that way in the supreme state?

original: gnas skabs der brtsi bar mi mdzad pa ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs der brtsi bar mi mdzad pa ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that he does not consider in that state,

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po bdag nyid du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po bdag nyid du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has made great compassion the cause of his activity.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bskal pa grangs med mang por ni //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med mang por ni //
translated: for many countless eons,

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs byung ba'i //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs byung ba'i //
translated: he perfected his cultivation.

original: gang dag brtse ba chen po la //
analyzed: gang dag brtse ba chen po la //
translated: Those who have great compassion

original: gzhan gyi ngor ni bzhugs pa yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor ni bzhugs pa yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
translated: dwell for the sake of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi sku can yang shin tu rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid can du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi sku can yang shin tu rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid can du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the Bhagavān, who has a body with the nature of qualities, attains nirvana, which has the characteristic of being completely severed,

original: de ni da lta ba rnams kyi skyabs kyi don du yang mi @84b 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni da lta ba rnams kyi skyabs kyi don du yang mi @84b 'thad de /
translated: then it is not tenable that he is a refuge for those who are present now.

original: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin par brjod do //
analyzed: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin par brjod do //
translated: The meaning of refuge is said to be the meaning of protection.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su 'gro ba de ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa la skyabs su 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su 'gro ba de ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa la skyabs su 'gro ba yin na /
translated: If one goes for refuge to the Buddha Bhagavān, then one goes for refuge to the nonlearner dharmas that make one a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid can rgyal ba rnams mar me'i rgyun lta bur shin tu yang so sor nub par gyur na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid can rgyal ba rnams mar me'i rgyun lta bur shin tu yang so sor nub par gyur na /
translated: If the victors, whose nature is the nonlearner dharmas that make one a buddha, completely disappear like the flame of a butter lamp,

original: de rnams skyob pa'i nus pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de rnams skyob pa'i nus pa ga la yod /
translated: how could they have the ability to protect?

original: nus pa yod na ni mya ngan las mi 'da' bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa yod na ni mya ngan las mi 'da' bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they have the ability, it follows that they do not attain nirvana,

original: dngos po rnams ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things have the characteristic of having the ability.

original: 'das pa'i dus na bzhugs pa'i nus pa nyams pa ma yin no zhe na /🔽ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na bzhugs pa'i nus pa nyams pa ma yin no zhe na / ma yin te ;
translated: But the potency of the past does not deteriorate.

original: 'das pa de'i ngo bos yod pa yin na ni da ltar byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa de'i ngo bos yod pa yin na ni da ltar byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the past exists by virtue of its own nature, it becomes the present.

original: de lta na yang de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par grub pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par grub pa'am /
translated: In that case, it is established that nirvana is not nonabiding.

original: nus pa'i don 'gags na yang nus pa'i don gang zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: nus pa'i don 'gags na yang nus pa'i don gang zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: Or, if the object of potency is ceased, what is the object of potency?

original: 'on te des bstan pa'i gsung rab rin po che la skyob pa'i nus pa da dung yang yod pas de yang nus pa yin par brjod do zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te des bstan pa'i gsung rab rin po che la skyob pa'i nus pa da dung yang yod pas de yang nus pa yin par brjod do zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the precious scriptures taught by him still have the potency to protect, and that potency is also potency,

original: gal te de lta na ni 'o na skyabs de gtso bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni 'o na skyabs de gtso bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, that refuge would not be primary,

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i nus pa de'i yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i nus pa de'i yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is a different nature, and the potency of its result would not be that.

original: de'i nus pa dang lhan cig tu nyams par 'dod pa'i phyir de la gtso bo yin pa'i skyabs kyi don yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nus pa dang lhan cig tu nyams par 'dod pa'i phyir de la gtso bo yin pa'i skyabs kyi don yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is asserted that its potency deteriorates together with it, it does not have the meaning of a primary refuge.

original: rgyu mtshan med par dgrar gyur pa 'di dag rigs pa dang lung gzhan dang ldan pa yin yang lung gi don dgong pa can yin pa las 'das nas /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par dgrar gyur pa 'di dag rigs pa dang lung gzhan dang ldan pa yin yang lung gi don dgong pa can yin pa las 'das nas /
translated: These people who have become your enemies without reason, even though they possess reasoning and scripture, have gone beyond the meaning of the scriptures.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pa'i don du spro ba dang bcas par gnas pa lung 'dzin pa rnams kyis gnas pa yin pa la mngon par zhen pa 'dir yang ci zhig yin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pa'i don du spro ba dang bcas par gnas pa lung 'dzin pa rnams kyis gnas pa yin pa la mngon par zhen pa 'dir yang ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the point of their attachment to the assertion that the Bhagavān abides with enthusiasm for the purpose of establishing nirvana?

original: bcom ldan 'das la mya ngan las 'das pa mi mnga' na sku gdung ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mya ngan las 'das pa mi mnga' na sku gdung ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the Bhagavān does not have nirvana, how can there be relics?

original: sku gdung mi 'thad pa yan ma yin te /
analyzed: sku gdung mi 'thad pa yan ma yin te /
translated: Relics are not untenable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag po nyid las de'i skal ba can rnams kyi rab tu dang pa'i skye mched la sku gdung snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag po nyid las de'i skal ba can rnams kyi rab tu dang pa'i skye mched la sku gdung snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relics appear in the sense bases of faith of those who are fortunate, due to the Bhagavān’s power.

original: de kho nar ni sku gdung mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de kho nar ni sku gdung mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, relics are not asserted at all.

original: thub pa sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i blo can rnams kyi sku ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de skad du /
analyzed: thub pa sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i blo can rnams kyi sku ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro // de skad du /
translated: The bodies of the Buddhas, who are endowed with unobstructed cognition, are by nature illusory wisdom, and they remain as long as cyclic existence continues.

original: gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the Sutra of Golden Light:

original: mtho ris su ni 'dzeg pa'i phyir //🔽nam zhig ri bong rva rnams las //
analyzed: mtho ris su ni 'dzeg pa'i phyir // nam zhig ri bong rva rnams las //
translated: In order to ascend to the higher realms,

original: @85a * // skas ni legs par byas gyur na //
analyzed: @85a * // skas ni legs par byas gyur na //
translated: when staircases are well made🔽from the horns of rabbits,

original: de tshe ring bsrel yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe ring bsrel yod par 'gyur //
translated: then there will be relics.

original: sku la rus pa khrag med na //
analyzed: sku la rus pa khrag med na //
translated: If the body has no bones or blood,

original: ring bsrel yod par ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: how can there be relics?

original: de lta na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, since it exists in similar instances.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yod na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba mi 'thad pas gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pas ma nges par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yod na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba mi 'thad pas gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pas ma nges par yang ma yin no //
translated: Since there is a valid cognition that undermines the reversal of that, it is also not indeterminate.

original: gal te thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i thub pa chen po 'khor ba ji srid par gnas na /
analyzed: gal te thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i thub pa chen po 'khor ba ji srid par gnas na /
translated: If the Great Sage, who possesses unobstructed transcendent wisdom, abides for as long as cyclic existence endures,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang gzhan 'byung ba'i don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang gzhan 'byung ba'i don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yang med de /
translated: then the error that the purpose of the Tathāgata’s appearance in the world would be meaningless would ensue.

original: gang gi phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid yin yang rgyu mtshungs par spyad pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas mang pos gdul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams cig car yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid yin yang rgyu mtshungs par spyad pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas mang pos gdul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams cig car yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But that error does not exist because, although he possesses unobstructed transcendent wisdom, many buddhas simultaneously appear for the sake of sentient beings to be guided, since they engage in similar causes.

original: pha bong gis mnan pa'i sbal ba gdon pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i brtse ba can rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: pha bong gis mnan pa'i sbal ba gdon pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i brtse ba can rnams bzhin no //
translated: like the compassionate ones who live on the level of ordinary beings, in order to free the frog that is being pressed down by the stone.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan byung ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snga ma'i ye shes kyi nus pa nyams pa yin no zhes kyang brjod pa mi bya ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan byung ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snga ma'i ye shes kyi nus pa nyams pa yin no zhes kyang brjod pa mi bya ste ;
translated: And it should not be said that when another Tathagata appears, the power of the former Tathagata's knowledge is impaired.

original: gcig tu 'dus pas kyang rang bzhin des 'dul ba'i skye bo yod na sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dus pas kyang rang bzhin des 'dul ba'i skye bo yod na sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when they are assembled together, if there is a person to be trained by that nature, they act for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa can cig yod na rgyu mtshungs pa gzhan de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa can cig yod na rgyu mtshungs pa gzhan de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, if there is one with unobstructed power of knowledge, it is not reasonable to say that another with similar cause will not be like that.

original: cig mkhas par 'gyur zhes te de dang rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa gzhan mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig mkhas par 'gyur zhes te de dang rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa gzhan mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one will be wise and another with similar cause will not be.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi gdul bya ma yin na thams cad kyi gdul bya ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi gdul bya ma yin na thams cad kyi gdul bya ma yin no //
translated: If one Tathagata is not a disciple, then all are not disciples.

original: zhes 'dod na de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'dod na de ltar ma yin te /
translated: If that is accepted, it is not so.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs mtshungs pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das gcig gis gdul byar ma gyur pa nyid kyis /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams kyi yang so so'i gzugs re res gdul byar ma gyur pa yin yang sbrul pa ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas mang po'i gzugs kyi gdul bar gyur cig ces rnam pa de lta bu'i smon lam la sogs pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa las
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs mtshungs pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das gcig gis gdul byar ma gyur pa nyid kyis / de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams kyi yang so so'i gzugs re res gdul byar ma gyur pa yin yang sbrul pa ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas mang po'i gzugs kyi gdul bar gyur cig ces rnam pa de lta bu'i smon lam la sogs pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa las
translated: Because the assemblies are equal, one Bhagavat is not a trainee, and🔽many Tathagatas are not trainees, even though each of their forms is a trainee.🔽However, by the impetus of the cause, the vow, etc.,

original: cig car byung bas mang po rnams kyi gdul byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car byung bas mang po rnams kyi gdul byar 'gyur ro //
translated: many forms of Buddhas arise simultaneously and become trainees of many.

original: de @85b nyid kyi phyir nyan thos rnams dang mtshungs par brtag par bya ba yan ma yin te /
analyzed: de @85b nyid kyi phyir nyan thos rnams dang mtshungs par brtag par bya ba yan ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not to be considered the same as the Sravakas,

original: rang gis yongs su smin par byas pa'i gdul bya'i sems can med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis yongs su smin par byas pa'i gdul bya'i sems can med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have sentient beings to be trained who are fully matured by themselves.

original: de nyid kyis na ran bzhin de lta bu 'dus pas 'dul bar bya ba'i skye mo mi srid pa'i phyir na gcig tu mngon du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na ran bzhin de lta bu 'dus pas 'dul bar bya ba'i skye mo mi srid pa'i phyir na gcig tu mngon du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they do not remain in one place, because it is impossible for a trainee to be assembled in that way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu cig car de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu cig car de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, many tathāgatas do not appear simultaneously in one world system.

original: srid na ni ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba rnams 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: srid na ni ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba rnams 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: If they did, it would not be contradictory for them to be free of the stains of miserliness, jealousy, and so on.

original: de dag gis ni smon lam 'di ltar btab ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni smon lam 'di ltar btab ste /
translated: They make the following aspiration:

original: ji lta ji ltar gdul bya yi //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar gdul bya yi //
translated: Just as the aims of those to be trained

original: don rnams rdzogs par 'byung gyur pa //
analyzed: don rnams rdzogs par 'byung gyur pa //
translated: are accomplished,

original: de lta de ltar snang ba yang //
analyzed: de lta de ltar snang ba yang //
translated: just so may appearances

original: bdag la brten de 'byung gyur cig //
analyzed: bdag la brten de 'byung gyur cig //
translated: arise in dependence on me.

original: ces so // shin tu spos pas chog go //
analyzed: ces so // shin tu spos pas chog go //
translated: This is quite sufficient.

original: rigs pas 'thad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa sprul pa'i sku yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas na /
analyzed: rigs pas 'thad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa sprul pa'i sku yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas na /
translated: If the tathāgata’s emanation body that is tenable by reasoning does not remain in nirvāṇa,

original: rnam pa thams cad du gnas pa 'thad pa ma yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gnas pa 'thad pa ma yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
translated: then it is not tenable that it remains in any way at all.

original: gal te sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod pa ni des ji ltar gnas par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod pa ni des ji ltar gnas par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one were to say, “The so-called Buddha, etc.,” then one would have to say, “How should one stand in that?”

original: gal te de ltar gnas par mi bya na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' des ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis gnas par bya zhing rtogs par bya /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gnas par mi bya na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' des ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis gnas par bya zhing rtogs par bya /
translated: If one should not stand in that, then how, by what means, should the bodhisattva stand in it and realize it?

original: ji ltar bslab par bya ste bsgrubs pas yongs su rdzogs par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab par bya ste bsgrubs pas yongs su rdzogs par bya /
translated: How should one train in it, by practicing it, complete it?

original: ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spang ba rjod pa nyid byin pa'i phyir rna pa gang gis kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spang ba rjod pa nyid byin pa'i phyir rna pa gang gis kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “what” is used to indicate the very expression of abandonment, because it is given. It means “by no means whatsoever.”

original: de nyid kyi lan gdab pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi lan gdab pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to answer that very question, it is said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra?” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de la khyod ji snyam du sems shing rtogs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de la khyod ji snyam du sems shing rtogs //
translated: What do you think, how do you imagine, that very abiding of the Tathāgata?

original: gal te shes na smros shig ces brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: gal te shes na smros shig ces brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: If you know, then speak!

original: 'on kyang khyed nyid la klan ka btsal bar bya ste zhes le'u dang por brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsgrubs pa yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed nyid la klan ka btsal bar bya ste zhes le'u dang por brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsgrubs pa yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: But you yourself are to be refuted, and what was said in the first chapter is to be established by this.

original: gnas pa'i sgra ji lta ba bzhin yin na skyon du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pas lan smras pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i sgra ji lta ba bzhin yin na skyon du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pas lan smras pa ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thinking that there would be a fault if the word “abides” were taken literally, Subhūti replies, “The Tathāgata, Venerable Śāriputra, does not abide anywhere.”

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab la sogs par @86a * //🔽bzhugs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab la sogs par @86a * // bzhugs pa ma yin nam /
translated: The Blessed One does not abide in Rājagṛha, etc.🔽How is it that he does not abide anywhere?

original: ji ltar na gang du yang gnas pa ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar na gang du yang gnas pa ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The doubt that arises from this is resolved by “Why is that? ” and the answer is given in “The Tathāgata, Venerable Śāriputra, is not of this world, nor is he of another world.”

original: thugs ni mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos rnams de kho na nyid du ma gzigs pas 'di la gnas pa'i thugs sems nyid mi mnga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni mi gnas pa
analyzed: thugs ni mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos rnams de kho na nyid du ma gzigs pas 'di la gnas pa'i thugs sems nyid mi mnga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni mi gnas pa
translated: “The mind does not abide” means that because, having fully awakened to enlightenment, he did not see any phenomena as reality, the mind that abides in that does not exist.

original: yin pa de'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis cil yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin pa de'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis cil yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the mind of the Tathāgata does not abide in anything in the manner of an objective support.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “It is not in the compounded,” and so on.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs par ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs par ro //
translated: “The compounded” refers to the desire realm and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs par ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs par ro //
translated: “The uncompounded” refers to suchness and so on.

original: de la mi gnas pa ni da kho na nyid du dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa ni da kho na nyid du dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not abide in that because he does not observe things as reality.

original: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni der mi gnas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni der mi gnas pa yang yin te /
translated: “It does not arise from that” means that it does not abide in that.

original: yul med pa la dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa la dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no negation of the non-existent object.

original: kun rdzob tu ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'am mi bzhugs par btags pa yin no zhes 'dod do //🔽de ltar na kho bo cag gis kyang don dam par mngon par zhen pa bkag nas kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar khyod kyis brjod pa ltar de la gnas pa thams cad brjod par bya ba yin pa des na rnam pa thams cad du gnas par mi 'thad
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'am mi bzhugs par btags pa yin no zhes 'dod do // de ltar na kho bo cag gis kyang don dam par mngon par zhen pa bkag nas kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar khyod kyis brjod pa ltar de la gnas pa thams cad brjod par bya ba yin pa des na rnam pa thams cad du gnas par mi 'thad
translated: The Blessed One is designated as present or absent in the conventional sense.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, we also refute attachment to the ultimate, and in the conventional sense, as you have stated, all those who abide in it should be spoken of. Therefore, it is not entirely unreasonable to abide in it.

original: zhes lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes lan smras pa ni /
translated: Thus, the reply is stated:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra... and so forth.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus means in the just explained manner.

original: de nyid rnam pa dbye ba'i phyir ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa dbye ba'i phyir ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to analyze that very [abiding], how? and so forth is stated.

original: gnas pa ma yin pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-abiding is because of the non-existence of momentary impermanent things.

original: mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa ni yul med pa la dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa ni yul med pa la dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-abiding, because there is no negation of the non-existent object.

original: mi mthun par gnas pa ni rgyun gyi mi rtag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar gnas pa rjes su thob pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par gnas pa ni rgyun gyi mi rtag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar gnas pa rjes su thob pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not abiding in a manner contrary to that, because there is no attainment of abiding in a manner contrary to that, since there is no impermanent thing in a series.

original: mi mthun par mi gnas pa ma yin pa ni de bzhin du dgag bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun par mi gnas pa ma yin pa ni de bzhin du dgag bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-abiding in a manner contrary to that, because there is no negation of that negation.

original: 'dis de ltar bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'dis de ltar bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: One should train in this way means in the context of application.

original: de bzhin du gnas par bya'o de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @86b dngos gzhi'i skabs su ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas par bya'o de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @86b dngos gzhi'i skabs su ste /
translated: One should abide in that way, one should train in that way means in the context of the actual practice.

original: 'dis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'dis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: One should train in this way is connected to the previous.

original: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis legs par gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis khyad par can gyi rtogs pa thob par legs par gnas pa yin pa ste 'dis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes de
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis legs par gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis khyad par can gyi rtogs pa thob par legs par gnas pa yin pa ste 'dis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes de
translated: One should abide well in the manner of non-abiding means that one abides well in the attainment of the special realization in the manner of non-attachment, like an illusory person. This means that one should train in that way.

original: 'dir yang 'brel ba ni 'jug gi gnas skabs su yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'brel ba ni 'jug gi gnas skabs su yin no //
translated: Here too, the connection is in the context of engagement.

original: de ltar rtogs pa rgya cher bstan nas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa rgya cher bstan nas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having thus extensively explained the realization, the concluding statement is expressed by in this way... and so on.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: de ltar slob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said one who trains in that way... and so on.

original: de ltar bsgoms pas rtogs pa'i chos kyi mchog gi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pas rtogs pa'i chos kyi mchog gi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas gnas pa yin la /
translated: By meditating in that way, one abides in the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the supreme dharma of realization.

original: de nyid kyis na yid la byed pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na yid la byed pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: By that alone, one becomes inseparable from this mental attention.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa rdzogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa rdzogs pa'i don to //
translated: “So it is” is the meaning of the conclusion of the chapter.

original: ngag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de kho na nyid du na chos gang yang ma dmigs pa de'i phyir dngos po 'di dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kho na snang ba yin no zhes tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bus
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de kho na nyid du na chos gang yang ma dmigs pa de'i phyir dngos po 'di dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kho na snang ba yin no zhes tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bus
translated: Since the Tathagata, having fully awakened to enlightenment, did not apprehend any dharma in reality, therefore these things appear to be just the nature of illusion.

original: ma gzigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'thad pa'i mi dmigs pa bsgoms pas rgyas pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / zhugs pa la sogs pa bcu la mngon par zhe na pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma gzigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'thad pa'i mi dmigs pa bsgoms pas rgyas pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / zhugs pa la sogs pa bcu la mngon par zhe na pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason for the non-perception by the authoritative person is the non-perception of the established, which is cultivated by the expansion of meditation. One should not abide in the ten such as entry and so on with a mind of attachment. One should meditate in this way.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
translated: Starting from the ten stages,

original: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //
analyzed: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //
translated: By the teaching of the non-abiding expansion,

original: chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
translated: It is explained as becoming the supreme dharma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Why? Because the Buddha,

original: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //
analyzed: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //
translated: having understood, does not see any dharmas.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: nyan thos kyi lam gyi 'og tu rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par rigs pa yin na yang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam gyi 'og tu rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par rigs pa yin na yang /
translated: Although it is logical to discuss the Pratyekabuddha path after the Śrāvaka path,

original: gang gis de dag gi lam gzhan du 'gyur pa nyan thos rnams las de dag ci ltar khyad par du 'phags snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gang gis de dag gi lam gzhan du 'gyur pa nyan thos rnams las de dag ci ltar khyad par du 'phags snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: since it is possible that someone might wonder how the Pratyekabuddhas are superior to the Śrāvakas, since they have a different path,

original: re zhig khyad par du 'phags par sgrub pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig khyad par du 'phags par sgrub pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
translated: in order to establish that they are superior, it is said:

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, from within that assembly... and so on.

original: gang yin pa de dag ces bya ba ni tshig phrad bsdus pa nyid kyis na sngon thos pa gang yang rung @87a * //🔽ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang yin pa de dag ces bya ba ni tshig phrad bsdus pa nyid kyis na sngon thos pa gang yang rung @87a * // ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who are called those who have heard refers to those who have heard any of the teachings.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de rnams kyi rang gi brdar grangs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de rnams kyi rang gi brdar grangs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The term yakṣa is the sound that those yakṣas use for their own language.

original: tshig ni sga bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni sga bsdus pa'o //
translated: The term words refers to the condensed words.

original: gtam du byas pa ni ji tsam gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gtam du byas pa ni ji tsam gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The expression is the complete expression of the meaning that is intended to be expressed.

original: dag chen po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dag chen po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the great purity, that is the meaning.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni gtam gyi sgo de dang de nas dris pa dang lan gyi tshig tu smra pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni gtam gyi sgo de dang de nas dris pa dang lan gyi tshig tu smra pa'o //
translated: The full expression is the speech that is spoken as the words of questions and answers through that door of expression.

original: de dag smra ba ni shes par rung gi zhes bya ba ni brda'i dbang gis brjod pa na de dag don dang bcas par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag smra ba ni shes par rung gi zhes bya ba ni brda'i dbang gis brjod pa na de dag don dang bcas par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Those are suitable to be spoken, that is, when they are expressed through the power of convention, they are understood to have meaning.

original: gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang ci smra zhing brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang ci smra zhing brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Whatever the elder, the venerable Subhūti, speaks and expresses, etc.

original: lung las nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas rang gi byang chub rtogs pa de zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: lung las nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas rang gi byang chub rtogs pa de zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: In the scriptures, the śrāvakas are said to realize their own enlightenment in dependence on the teachings of others.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dus byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par rang gi byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dus byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par rang gi byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te ;
translated: The pratyekabuddhas, through previously having cultivated listening, etc., do not depend on the teachings of others and realize their own enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de dag la sangs rgyas la sogs pas bstan mi dogs so zhes bya ba ni khyad zhugs pa nyid cig yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la sangs rgyas la sogs pas bstan mi dogs so zhes bya ba ni khyad zhugs pa nyid cig yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible that the Buddha, etc. taught them. This is the distinction.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni don dang bcas par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni don dang bcas par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: Since this is the case, the meaning of the statement is that one should not understand as meaningful any explanation made with regard to the pratyekabuddha.

original: 'chad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'chad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “explains,” etc. has been stated.

original: yang na gsol ba btab nas ston pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gsol ba btab nas ston pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: Or, “explains” is to teach after being requested.

original: dris nas lan du smra ba ni rab tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dris nas lan du smra ba ni rab tu brjod pa'o //
translated: “Fully explains” is to speak in reply after being asked.

original: de gnyi ga gdul bya rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga gdul bya rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: Both of these are “taught” with regard to those disciples who are confused.

original: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas song ste ched du brjod pa ni nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas song ste ched du brjod pa ni nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: “Demonstrates” is to go to those who are heedless and to speak extemporaneously.

original: lha'i bu rnam ni rtog pa'i 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu las gyur ba yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnam ni rtog pa'i 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu las gyur ba yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The gods should understand that this is the power of the Tathagata.

original: gzhan du na rang sangs rgyas las brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan du na rang sangs rgyas las brtsams te /
translated: Otherwise, beginning with the pratyekabuddhas,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor ci yang me smra na de rnams rtog pa skye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor ci yang me smra na de rnams rtog pa skye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: “Noble Subhuti, if you do not speak at all, how can their thoughts arise?”

original: tshul bzhin du rtogs pa yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba'i don du lha'i bu dag shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rtogs pa yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba'i don du lha'i bu dag shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “Gods, it is not proper to understand that I have given permission for them to think properly.”

original: shes par mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa ni legs par smras so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes par mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa ni legs par smras so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “What you have said, ‘It is not proper to understand,’ is well said.”

original: lan gnyis smos pa ni /
analyzed: lan gnyis smos pa ni /
translated: The repetition of the answer🔽is for the sake of wonder, dispute,🔽anger, depression, certainty,

original: ngo mtshar dang ni rtsod pa dang // khro dang zhum dang nges gzung @87b dang / dad dang dga' ba dag la ni //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang ni rtsod pa dang // khro dang zhum dang nges gzung @87b dang / dad dang dga' ba dag la ni //
translated: faith, and joy.

original: tshig gcig lan gnyis brjod par bya //
analyzed: tshig gcig lan gnyis brjod par bya //
translated: One should repeat the word once🔽for each of these.

original: zhes brjod pas ci rigs par ngo mtshar dang nges par gzung ba la sogs pa yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas ci rigs par ngo mtshar dang nges par gzung ba la sogs pa yin par gzung ngo //
translated: The repetition of the answer is for the sake of wonder, certainty, and so on, as appropriate.

original: ji ltar na legs par smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na legs par smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it well spoken?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “In this way,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir nyan pa po 'byang ba med pa'i ngag smra na ji ltar smyon pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan pa po 'byang ba med pa'i ngag smra na ji ltar smyon pa ma yin /
translated: Since the listener speaks words that are not purified, how is he not insane?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ni /
translated: In this way,

original: rang rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don du brjod pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang 'dir thos pa med do //
analyzed: rang rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don du brjod pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang 'dir thos pa med do //
translated: there is not the slightest hearing here of the expression of the meaning of the Dharma that is realized by oneself.

original: de pas na de dag gi don du bshad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni don dang bcas par ma shes so zhes bya ba de legs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de pas na de dag gi don du bshad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni don dang bcas par ma shes so zhes bya ba de legs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever is explained for their sake is not understood to have meaning. That is well spoken.

analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni tshig tu smra ba dang bcas pa'i chos ston pas gzhan dag dge ba la 'jug par byed pa yin pas nyan pa po rnams kyis sgras brjod pa'i sgo nas 'chad pa po'i rtsal rtogs par byed pa yin na rang sangs rgyas rnams ni shes

translated: By abandoning the one-sided conceptualization that is a part of the obscuration of the knowable, through the power of the wisdom that is attained, etc., they teach the Dharma without using words and thus cause others to engage in the ten virtues, etc.
