original: rang sangs rgyas rang byung rnams ni bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis bstan pa don med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i lan btab pa'i sgo nas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'dis spong pa nyid do snyam du kho bo cag🔽sems pa yin na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rang byung rnams ni bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis bstan pa don med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i lan btab pa'i sgo nas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'dis spong pa nyid do snyam du kho bo cag sems pa yin na /
translated: We think that this noble Subhuti has refuted this kind of conceptualization.

original: 'di ltar de ma bsal bar gzhan ye shes zab pa nyid rjod par byed do snyam du lha'i bu rnams brjod pa ni kye ma 'phags pa rab 'byor 'dis gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ma bsal bar gzhan ye shes zab pa nyid rjod par byed do snyam du lha'i bu rnams brjod pa ni kye ma 'phags pa rab 'byor 'dis gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: But the gods think that he has not refuted it, and so they say, “Oh, this noble Subhuti is making it clear,” and so on.

original: ae ma'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba la'o //
analyzed: ae ma'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba la'o //
translated: The word “oh” is used to express certainty.

original: @88a * // gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa las byung ba nyid kyis na mu stegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi shes rab ni ring ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @88a * // gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa las byung ba nyid kyis na mu stegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi shes rab ni ring ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the sravakas is said to be “far away” because it does not arise from the realization of the selflessness of the person and is therefore not the domain of the tirthikas.

original: de las ches ring du zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po nyid yin pas na nyan thos rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de las ches ring du zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po nyid yin pas na nyan thos rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
translated: The phrase even more profound refers to the wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas, because it is not the domain of the śrāvakas, due to their dull faculties.

original: phra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgra ba spangs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis na nyan thos kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgra ba spangs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis na nyan thos kyi shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase even more subtle refers to the wisdom of the śrāvakas, because it is the result of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions.

original: de las kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni ches phra ba'o //
analyzed: de las kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni ches phra ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas is even more subtle, because it is the result of the abandonment of one part of the obstructions to the knowable, namely, the conception of apprehended objects.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam ba bcu drug gis rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na nyan thos kyi shes pa ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam ba bcu drug gis rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na nyan thos kyi shes pa ni zab pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the śrāvakas is profound, because it is distinguished by the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: de bas kyang ches zab pa ni rang gis rtogs pa'i rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba 'di pa rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bas kyang ches zab pa ni rang gis rtogs pa'i rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba 'di pa rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas is even more profound, because it is distinguished by the condition of the mere thisness of self-realization.

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyid rang gis mngon par rtogs pa dang ; rkyen nyid 'di pa zab mo khong du chud pas rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'grub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyid rang gis mngon par rtogs pa dang ; rkyen nyid 'di pa zab mo khong du chud pas rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'grub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In other sūtras, it is said that by means of these very paths of the ten virtuous actions, one accomplishes the wisdom of a pratyekabuddha through one’s own realization and through understanding the profound suchness of conditions.

original: phyogs de la gnas pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs de la gnas pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Because they abide in that direction, they engage.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni ston cing 'chad do snyam mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni ston cing 'chad do snyam mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is said: they teach and explain.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they realize the nature of self-arising,🔽They do not need to be taught by others.🔽The wisdom of the rhinoceros-like🔽Is declared to be profound.🔽And:🔽Because they have the wisdom of the rhinoceros-like,🔽They do not need to be taught by others.

original: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
translated: And:🔽The wisdom of the rhinoceros-like🔽Is declared to be profound.🔽And:

original: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
translated: Because they have the wisdom of the rhinoceros-like,🔽They do not need to be taught by others.🔽And:🔽The wisdom of the rhinoceros-like

original: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
analyzed: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
translated: Is declared to be profound.🔽And:🔽Because they have the wisdom of the rhinoceros-like,🔽They do not need to be taught by others.🔽And:🔽The wisdom of the rhinoceros-like🔽Is declared to be profound.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: And:🔽Because they have the wisdom of the rhinoceros-like,🔽They do not need to be taught by others.🔽And:🔽The wisdom of the rhinoceros-like🔽Is declared to be profound.🔽And:

original: 'bras bu'i rtags tshig med pas gang gis ye shes zab mo 'grub par 'gyur pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags tshig med pas gang gis ye shes zab mo 'grub par 'gyur pa /
translated: Because they have the wisdom of the rhinoceros-like,

original: chos ston par 'gyur pa yang yin la mi smra ba yang yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: chos ston par 'gyur pa yang yin la mi smra ba yang yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: They do not need to be taught by others.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par ma brtags rnams par ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra bas brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par ma brtags rnams par ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra bas brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng pa yin no //
translated: Because they do not speak words without examining and investigating, speech is distraction.

original: de pas na chos ston pa smra ba yang g-yeng ba sgrub bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de pas na chos ston pa smra ba yang g-yeng ba sgrub bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, even teaching the Dharma is established as distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng bas kyang rgyud shas cher 'khrug par byed do snyam du dgongs pas /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bas kyang rgyud shas cher 'khrug par byed do snyam du dgongs pas /
translated: And because of distraction, the mindstream is greatly disturbed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar tshig tu smra ba med par yang sems can gyi don byed par nus par gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa yin
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar tshig tu smra ba med par yang sems can gyi don byed par nus par gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa yin
translated: Thinking this, the Buddha Bhagavān, when he was a bodhisattva, made the aspiration prayer like this: “Having attained Buddhahood, may I be able to benefit sentient beings without speaking words, like a wish-fulfilling jewel.”

original: la / sangs rgyas dang @88b mtshungs par yang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de ltar btab pa yin no //
analyzed: la / sangs rgyas dang @88b mtshungs par yang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de ltar btab pa yin no //
translated: And the solitary realizers made the same aspiration prayer as the Buddha.

original: de sa na de rnams kyang rang gi byang chub rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa'i mthus don gang la rnam ba gang ltar gang gis nyan par 'dod pa de'i rnam par shes pa la rnam pa de nyid kyis sgra med par yang
analyzed: de sa na de rnams kyang rang gi byang chub rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa'i mthus don gang la rnam ba gang ltar gang gis nyan par 'dod pa de'i rnam par shes pa la rnam pa de nyid kyis sgra med par yang
translated: Therefore, when they realize their own enlightenment, by the power of their previous aspirations and so on, the meaning of the Dharma appears to the consciousness of those who wish to hear it in whatever way they wish to hear it, even without sound.

original: don de snang bar 'gyur pas sgra med par chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de snang bar 'gyur pas sgra med par chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “teaching the Dharma without sound.”

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang rang sangs rgyas rnams lus kyis chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du brgya byin la yang yid kyis tshigs su bcad pas lan btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang rang sangs rgyas rnams lus kyis chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du brgya byin la yang yid kyis tshigs su bcad pas lan btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: In other sūtras, it is said that pratyekabuddhas teach the Dharma with their bodies, and likewise, that Śakra replies with verses in his mind.

original: / de skad du yang /
analyzed: / de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gang don ni gang la //
analyzed: gang gang don ni gang la //
translated: Whatever meaning,🔽in whatever way,

original: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa //🔽de dang de la sgra med kyang //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa // de dang de la sgra med kyang //
translated: is desired to be heard,🔽that meaning appears in that way,

original: don de de lta de ltar snang //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don de de lta de ltar snang //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: even without sound.

original: de ltar khyad par bstan nas gzhan du na rgyu khyad par can ma yin na 'bras bu khyad par can mi 'thad pas na /🔽khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi lam ni khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin no zhes rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rnal ma nyid brjod pa la ni /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par bstan nas gzhan du na rgyu khyad par can ma yin na 'bras bu khyad par can mi 'thad pas na / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi lam ni khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin no zhes rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rnal ma nyid brjod pa la ni /
translated: Having thus taught the distinction, he says that if the cause is not distinguished, the effect is not tenable as distinguished.🔽Therefore, the path of those who are distinguished is only distinguished.

original: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to express the true path of the pratyekabuddhas, he says, “Therefore, O sons of gods, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir lha'i bu khyed nyid kyis ring ba las kyang ches ring du 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir gzhan pa 'di dag kyang shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha'i bu khyed nyid kyis ring ba las kyang ches ring du 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir gzhan pa 'di dag kyang shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: Because of the reason stated by you, O sons of gods, that “you engage in going even from what is far,” etc., you should understand this other point as well.

original: de ltar na kho bo shin tu ring bas kyang ring ba la sogs par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kho bo shin tu ring bas kyang ring ba la sogs par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, I assert that “one engages in going even from what is very far.”

original: thob par 'dod pa ni mngon sum du byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'dod pa ni mngon sum du byed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Desiring to attain” means desiring to manifest.

original: gnas par 'dod pa ni mi g-yeng par gyur par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pa ni mi g-yeng par gyur par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who wishes to abide is one who wishes to be without distraction.

original: des bzod pa 'di la ma brten par zhes bya ba ni gang zag des chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i yul can lam shes pa 'di lam brten par srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des bzod pa 'di la ma brten par zhes bya ba ni gang zag des chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i yul can lam shes pa 'di lam brten par srid pa ma yin te /
translated: That person does not rely on this acceptance, i.e., that person does not rely on this path-knowledge which has the object of acceptance of the ascertainment of the Dharma.

original: de lta ma yin na rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If it were otherwise, then ascertainment would not be tenable.

original: /'dis kyang lam shes pa nyid lam thams cad kyi yul can du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: /'dis kyang lam shes pa nyid lam thams cad kyi yul can du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses the fact that path-knowledge has the object of all paths.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi skabs yin pa las khyad par ston pa ni 'di skad ces rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid @89a * //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi skabs yin pa las khyad par ston pa ni 'di skad ces rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid @89a * //
translated: The teaching of the distinction from the context of the path of the Solitary Buddha is as follows: That which is the superior path of the Solitary Buddhas is the path-knowledge which has the nature of the abandonment of the very conception of the apprehended.

original: spangs pas de'i rang bzhin can lam shes pa yin par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yang yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: spangs pas de'i rang bzhin can lam shes pa yin par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yang yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Not only that, but it is also said that it has the nature of the path of the Sravakas, etc.

original: de bzhin du sbyar ro zhis bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar ro zhis bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on” means

original: des bzod pa 'di lam brten par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tshig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa las sogs pa'i tshig gsum la bsgre bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des bzod pa 'di lam brten par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tshig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa las sogs pa'i tshig gsum la bsgre bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that the phrase “this patience is not established as a basis for the path” should be applied to the three phrases “one who desires to obtain the fruit of a once-returner,” and so on.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na spangs pa zhes brjod pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtogs pa ma spangs par bstan pa yin la de yang /🔽gzung ba med na der 'dzin med //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na spangs pa zhes brjod pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtogs pa ma spangs par bstan pa yin la de yang / gzung ba med na der 'dzin med //
translated: Since it is said that “only the conception of the apprehended is abandoned,” it is shown that the conception of the apprehender is not abandoned.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis rigs pa ma yin no snyam du rtogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis rigs pa ma yin no snyam du rtogs pa la /
translated: And that is unreasonable, since it is said, “If the apprehended does not exist, the apprehender does not exist.”

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di la chos nyan pa ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di la chos nyan pa ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Thinking this, Subhūti says, “What kind of Dharma teaching is this?”

original: ji lta bu zhes pa'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes pa'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The word “what” is a conception.

original: ji lta bu'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa zhig rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i chos kyi snod du gyur pa'i chos nyan pa po yin te /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa zhig rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i chos kyi snod du gyur pa'i chos nyan pa po yin te /
translated: What kind of person who has the conception of grasping is a listener of the Dharma who is a vessel for the Dharma of the Solitary Realizers’ Vehicle?

original: rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig rang sangs rgyas su gzung bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig rang sangs rgyas su gzung bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What kind of nature should be grasped as a Solitary Realizer?

original: lan gdab pa'i phyir lha'i bu dag kho po la chos nyan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: lan gdab pa'i phyir lha'i bu dag kho po la chos nyan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to answer that, he said, “Divine sons, my listeners of the Dharma…” and so forth.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yod na de 'dzin par byed pa rnams par rtogs pa med pa'i shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid skye zhing de med par ma yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yod na de 'dzin par byed pa rnams par rtogs pa med pa'i shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid skye zhing de med par ma yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin na /
translated: If things that are natures of their own exist, then the consciousnesses that apprehend them arise with natures of their own without conceptions, and without them they do not. This is the reality of things.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'gags bzhin pas 'phangs pa'i rang gi rgyud kyi bag chags sad ba las skyes ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'gags bzhin pas 'phangs pa'i rang gi rgyud kyi bag chags sad ba las skyes ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the consciousness that apprehends form, etc., which has existed since beginningless time, is projected by the cessation of the conceptual consciousness, and arises from the activation of the habitual tendencies in one’s own continuum.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa kho na la skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin no //🔽de pas na sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang sbrul pa'i dngos po dang mtshungs pa nyid du gyur pa de dag ni phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa kho na la skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin no // de pas na sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang sbrul pa'i dngos po dang mtshungs pa nyid du gyur pa de dag ni phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: Therefore, there is no certainty that the conceptual consciousness that apprehends must arise only when the conceptual consciousness that is apprehended exists.🔽Therefore, they are similar to the nature of illusions and the nature of emanations.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: They are the nature of erroneous appearance, and because they are related to the conceptual consciousness that apprehends, they should be accepted as the apprehender of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pas bzung ba'i yul 'dzin pa yin bzhin du yang ji @89b ltar brdzun pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pas bzung ba'i yul 'dzin pa yin bzhin du yang ji @89b ltar brdzun pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But how can the object grasped by a conceptual construction be false?🔽This is the doubt that is being addressed.

original: zhes bya bas bsu nas /🔽'di ltar zhes bya ba las sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsu nas / 'di ltar zhes bya ba las sogs pa smras so //
translated: The response is “because of the non-existence of the object of the conceptual construction.”

original: rang sangs rgyas de dag ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su go rims bzhin du nyams par mi 'gyur mngon du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de dag ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su go rims bzhin du nyams par mi 'gyur mngon du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas do not have a loss of the object of the conceptual construction in the non-concentrated state, and they do not have a manifestation of the object of the conceptual construction in the concentrated state.

original: rna 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /🔽rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nye bar bslad pas slu pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rna 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste / rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nye bar bslad pas slu pa'i phyir //
translated: The phrase “by the mode of the conceptual construction that grasps sound” is the remainder.

original: zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the conceptual construction does not appear as a real entity, and it is deceptive because it is a superimposition.

original: tshul 'dis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs su zin kyang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam gyi ngo bo yin par bshad do //
analyzed: tshul 'dis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs su zin kyang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam gyi ngo bo yin par bshad do //
translated: By this method, although the conceptual construction of the apprehending subject is not abandoned, it is explained that it is the essence of the path of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: sgyu ma dang sprul ba lta bu zhes bya bas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba tsam du brjod pa'i phyir na sems can rnams sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa bsal ba yin no zhes zhar la byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i don smras pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang sprul ba lta bu zhes bya bas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba tsam du brjod pa'i phyir na sems can rnams sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa bsal ba yin no zhes zhar la byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i don smras pa ni /
translated: Since it is said that they are like an illusion or a magical creation, it is said that sentient beings are of the nature of an illusion, in order to dispel the notion that they are similar in some way.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the topic of the digression is stated:

original: ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi /
translated: Noble Subhūti, are sentient beings like an illusion?

original: de dag phyin ci log gi rang bzhin sgyu ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag phyin ci log gi rang bzhin sgyu ma ma yin nam /
translated: Are they not of the nature of error, an illusion?

original: de pas na sems can yang dag par yod par bshad pas legs par bstan pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: de pas na sems can yang dag par yod par bshad pas legs par bstan pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is not well-taught that sentient beings truly exist.

original: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan brjod do //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan brjod do //
translated: The reply is stated by the sons of the gods with Those sentient beings are like an illusion, and so on.

original: 'di snyam du sgyu ma ni glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs ji lta ba bzhin 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa las tha dad par ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sgyu ma ni glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs ji lta ba bzhin 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa las tha dad par ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not the same as the elephant, etc., because the form of the elephant, etc., is not observed to be different from the lump of clay, etc.

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not not the same,

original: sngags la sogs pas ma bslad pa'i mig can rnams kyis 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams de lta bur ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pas ma bslad pa'i mig can rnams kyis 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams de lta bur ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those whose eyes are not affected by spells, etc., do not observe the lump of clay, etc., in that way.

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par yod do zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par yod do zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, because it is not expressible as the same or different, it is beyond the nature of a thing, and it cannot be said that it exists in reality, like the person, etc.

original: / byis pa'i bar la mngon sum du grub pas nyams su myong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar kun rdzob tu med do zhes bya bar nges par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no //🔽de pas na gang dang gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa dang med @90a * //
analyzed: / byis pa'i bar la mngon sum du grub pas nyams su myong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar kun rdzob tu med do zhes bya bar nges par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no // de pas na gang dang gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa dang med @90a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to ascertain that they do not exist conventionally, like conceptualization and so on.

original: pa'i tha snyad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: pa'i tha snyad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever is dependently arisen is essentially beyond the conventions of existence and nonexistence in the ultimate.

original: dper na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like an illusion.🔽These things, such as sentient beings, are just like that.🔽This is a natural inference.

original: sems can la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang de lta bu nyid yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis rab tu grags pa'i don 'ga' zhig la brten nas /
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang de lta bu nyid yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis rab tu grags pa'i don 'ga' zhig la brten nas /
translated: Relying on some well-known fact,

original: ma grags pa'i don la bsgrub par bya ba yin pas sgyu ma'i dpe dang 'dra bar byas so //
analyzed: ma grags pa'i don la bsgrub par bya ba yin pas sgyu ma'i dpe dang 'dra bar byas so //
translated: an unknown fact is established, like the example of an illusion.

original: rigs pa ni sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin can kho na yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin can kho na yin te /
translated: The reasoning is that those sentient beings are just like illusions.

original: de bas na yang dag par na sems yod par bshad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par na sems yod par bshad pa ci yang med do //
translated: Therefore, in reality, there is no explanation of the existence of mind.

original: sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni sang ba dang ma sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul gyi dbye bas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni sang ba dang ma sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul gyi dbye bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The two phrases “like an illusion” and “like a dream” are stated in terms of the distinction of the object in the states of being awake and asleep.

original: gnyis su med de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: “ Non-dual” means having a single essence.

original: de nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: “It is not dual.”

original: gnyis su bya ba du ma nyid gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: gnyis su bya ba du ma nyid gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces brjod de /
translated: That is stated of that which does not have duality, i.e., multiplicity.

original: thams cad nye bar bsdus pas khyab ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar bsdus pas khyab ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it pervades all that is included.

original: zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes 'dod do //
translated: This is asserted.

original: de'i ngag gi don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngag gi don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this statement is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin pa des na sgyu ma dang sems can dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin pa des na sgyu ma dang sems can dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Since they have an unreal nature, those sentient beings are like an illusion. Therefore, illusions and sentient beings are non-dual, i.e., not dual.

original: de bzhin du gang gi phyir rmi lam lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi phyir rmi lam lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, because they are like a dream,

original: rmi lam dang sems can de dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byang med de //
analyzed: rmi lam dang sems can de dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byang med de //
translated: those sentient beings and the dream are not two, are not divided.

original: khyad par de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that distinction,

original: lha'i bu dag chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Divine sons, all phenomena are also like a dream.”

original: 'di ni bsdus pa'i gnag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa'i gnag yin no //
translated: This is the summary.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation for the analysis is “stream-enterers” and so forth.

original: de ltar khyab ba bstan pa na bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma lta bu yin na yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu ji ltar yin zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar khyab ba bstan pa na bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma lta bu yin na yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu ji ltar yin zhes smras pa ni /
translated: When the pervasion is taught, it is said, “Blessed One, if it is like an illusion, how is it the cause for the perfection of all the aspects of good qualities?”

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Noble Subhūti, the perfect Buddha” and so forth.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The perfect Buddha is the Tathāgata of the body.

original: lan smras ba ni /
analyzed: lan smras ba ni /
translated: The reply is

original: lha'i bu dag mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sons of the gods say, “Nirvana is also…” and so forth.

original: gang du mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos kyi sku gnyis su med pa'i @90b ye shes kyi rang bzhin yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu yin no zhes smra ba der chos gzhan pa gzugs kyi sku la sogs
analyzed: gang du mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos kyi sku gnyis su med pa'i @90b ye shes kyi rang bzhin yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu yin no zhes smra ba der chos gzhan pa gzugs kyi sku la sogs
translated: Where nirvana is also, i.e., the special Dharma Body, the nature of which is nondual knowledge, is like an illusion and a dream, is it not said that other phenomena, the Form Body, etc.,

original: pa mi smra 'am ci /
analyzed: pa mi smra 'am ci /
translated: are also like that?

original: 'on kyang smra ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: But it is said that they are, i.e., that they are like an illusion and a dream.🔽This is the meaning.

original: dgag ba gnyis kyis rnal ma'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag ba gnyis kyis rnal ma'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two negations show the meaning of reality.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das kho na mngon du phyogs par byas na yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das kho na mngon du phyogs par byas na yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Because, as has been explained, only the Bhagavat, who has that nature, is the cause of the perfection of all virtues when he is made manifest.

original: gzhan du na tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, he would be a perversion, because he would have a nature contradictory to valid knowledge.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa shin tu tshabs che ba'i phyir bden pa'i chos lam rtogs so zhes slar yang smras pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa shin tu tshabs che ba'i phyir bden pa'i chos lam rtogs so zhes slar yang smras pa ni /
translated: Since the attachment to things is very strong, he says again, “I understand the Dharma of reality, the path.”

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The noble Subhūti says, “Divine princes, nirvana is also empty of nirvana.”🔽Otherwise, since emptiness would exist as a one-sided emptiness, like that of the tīrthikas, it would be untenable to be liberated because of accepting things.

original: gzhan du na mu stegs can dang 'dra bar phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid yod pas dngos por khas blangs pa'i phyir grol ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas lan smras pa ni lha'i bu dag kho bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: gzhan du na mu stegs can dang 'dra bar phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid yod pas dngos por khas blangs pa'i phyir grol ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas lan smras pa ni lha'i bu dag kho bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: With the intention that it is not tenable to be liberated, he replies, “Divine princes, I do not say that nirvana is a thing or that nirvana is a nonthing.”

original: pa'o // gal te zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gal te zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //
translated: If means accepts.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad do //
translated: The word that is a verbal particle.

original: 'di skad du ston to /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston to /
translated: This is taught.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos mi srid mod kyi /
translated: “It is not possible for a phenomenon to exist that is superior to nirvana.

original: de lta na yang khas blangs te smra ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang khas blangs te smra ba ni /
translated: However, accepting that, I say that nirvana is a nonthing.”

original: gal ta mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod kyang de'i tshe chos de yang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gal ta mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod kyang de'i tshe chos de yang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes smra'o //
translated: If there were another phenomenon superior to nirvana, that phenomenon would also be like an illusion, etc.

original: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis //
translated: And that is also stated by the noble Nagarjuna:

original: dngos por khas len yod na ni //
analyzed: dngos por khas len yod na ni //
translated: If there were an assertion of entity,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
translated: there would be the arising of unbearable attachment and aversion,

original: lta ba ma rungs yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: lta ba ma rungs yongs su 'dzin //
translated: and the holding of a bad view,

original: de las byung ba'i rtsod par gyur //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rtsod par gyur //
translated: and the arising of disputes from that.

original: de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
translated: That is the cause of all views.

original: de med nyon mongs mi skye ste //
analyzed: de med nyon mongs mi skye ste //
translated: When that does not exist, afflictions do not arise.

original: de pas de ni yongs shes nas //
analyzed: de pas de ni yongs shes nas //
translated: Therefore, having fully understood that,

original: lta dang nyon mongs yongs su 'byang //
analyzed: lta dang nyon mongs yongs su 'byang //
translated: one is liberated from views and afflictions.

original: gang gis de shes 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gang gis de shes 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you ask, “By what is that understood?”

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung mthong ba ste //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung mthong ba ste //
translated: It is understood by seeing dependent arising.🔽The supreme knower of reality said,

original: rten nas skye ba ma skyes zhes //🔽yang dag mkhyen pa'i mchog gis gsungs //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rten nas skye ba ma skyes zhes //🔽yang dag mkhyen pa'i mchog gis gsungs //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: “That which arises dependently does not arise.”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu pa ni don go pas ma bris so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu pa ni don go pas ma bris so //
translated: Thus, etc., is the conclusion. Since the meaning is understood, it is not written.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa bstan nas /🔽da ni rten gyi sgo nas kyang rang @91a * //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa bstan nas / da ni rten gyi sgo nas kyang rang @91a * //
translated: Having taught the digression,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam khyad par du 'phags par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam khyad par du 'phags par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: now, in order to teach the superiority of the Pratyekabuddha path also from the point of view of the basis, the question is asked:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Venerable Subhuti, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag go rims bzhin du spangs pa dang ma spangs pa de lta bu'i tshul gyis rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar bstan pa 'di dag la rigs
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag go rims bzhin du spangs pa dang ma spangs pa de lta bu'i tshul gyis rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar bstan pa 'di dag la rigs
translated: The wisdom paramita, which has the nature of the Pratyekabuddha path, is taught in this way, with the abandonment and non-abandonment of the conceptual thoughts of subject and object, respectively.

original: ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i gang zag su dag yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis don rig pas na //
analyzed: ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i gang zag su dag yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis don rig pas na //
translated: What kind of person, endowed with what kind of qualities, will take it up? By the blessing of the Tathagata, knowing the meaning, [Subhuti] said, Kausika, those who take it up will be endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bo 'chad par byed pas smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bo 'chad par byed pas smras pa ni /
translated: The noble Ananda, the expounder, says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable Ones, etc.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha rtogs pas rang byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha rtogs pas rang byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Non-retrogression means that they do not retrogress from their Pratyekabuddhahood by the realization of the factors of definite discrimination.

original: de nyid ni rang gi byang chub mngon par 'dod pa yin pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rang gi byang chub mngon par 'dod pa yin pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: They are Bodhisattvas because they are intent on their own enlightenment.

original: lus kyis chos ston pas sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: lus kyis chos ston pas sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: They are great beings because they are intent on working for the welfare of beings in Buddha-fields where Buddhas do not appear, by teaching the Dharma with their bodies.

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi lta ba bar ma dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi lta ba bar ma dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Perfection of view means that they are endowed with the middle view of wisdom.

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pa nyid kyis na mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pa nyid kyis na mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: Arhats whose defilements are exhausted means that they are worthy of worship because they have abandoned the obscurations of their own path of seeing.

original: tshig 'di gsum gyis ni byang chub la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i rigs dang // de nyid la nges pa'i rigs kyi gang zag ces bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: tshig 'di gsum gyis ni byang chub la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i rigs dang // de nyid la nges pa'i rigs kyi gang zag ces bshad pa yin no ;
translated: These three phrases explain the person who is respectively endowed with the spiritual lineage that is properly cultivated in enlightenment, the spiritual lineage that is obtained by the intrinsic nature, and the spiritual lineage that is ascertained in that very enlightenment.

original: / sam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du rnam par rtog pa phan tshun du ltos pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: / sam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du rnam par rtog pa phan tshun du ltos pa yin par blta'o //
translated: The word “also” should be understood as a reciprocal reference in all cases.

original: yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis rnam pa gzhan dag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis rnam pa gzhan dag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate this in another way, Subhūti says, “Venerable Ones,” and so on.🔽Even though the realization of the enlightenment of the Solitary Buddha is preceded by the teaching of one’s own path, there is no one who grasps it. How is that?

original: rang sangs rgyas so sor byang chub rtogs pa ni rang gi lam nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na yang 'dzin pa su yang mi 'byung ba ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas so sor byang chub rtogs pa ni rang gi lam nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na yang 'dzin pa su yang mi 'byung ba ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The question is raised by “why is that?”

original: smras pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is “it is thus,” and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rtogs pa'i dus su ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rtogs pa'i dus su ste /
translated: Here means at the time of realizing the path of the pratyekabuddha.

original: gzhan gyis bstan @91b mi dgos pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi sa rtogs pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan @91b mi dgos pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi sa rtogs pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that pratyekabuddha means one who realizes their own stage without needing to be taught by another.

original: mdor bsdus te brjod pas don rgya chen po bstan pa'i sgo nas don gang yang ma smos pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te brjod pas don rgya chen po bstan pa'i sgo nas don gang yang ma smos pa'o //
translated: By stating in brief, the meaning is not stated at all by teaching an extensive meaning.

original: rgya cher brjod pas don bsdus pa gsal bar byas pa'i sgo nas yongs su snang bar ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher brjod pas don bsdus pa gsal bar byas pa'i sgo nas yongs su snang bar ma byas pa'o //
translated: By stating extensively, the meaning is not fully illuminated by clarifying the concise meaning.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i sgo nas rab tu ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i sgo nas rab tu ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: By teaching the nature as it abides, it is not well-established.

original: nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te //
translated: In order to summarize, Therefore, and so on is stated.

original: de'i phyir don med pa'i rgyu gang kho nas smos pa la sogs pa ma byas ba rgyu de kho nas yang dag par 'dzin pa su yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don med pa'i rgyu gang kho nas smos pa la sogs pa ma byas ba rgyu de kho nas yang dag par 'dzin pa su yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, by the very cause of meaninglessness, the cause of not performing stating and so on, by that very cause, no one at all will correctly uphold it.

original: bstan bya nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bya nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Because there is nothing to be taught.

original: ji ltar sprul pa'i me tog rnams rang bzhin med du zin kyang yul nges pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid song ba de bzhin du dngos por gyur pa'i gzhi med na yang rtogs pa'i chos so sor nges pa thob pa yin
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa'i me tog rnams rang bzhin med du zin kyang yul nges pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid song ba de bzhin du dngos por gyur pa'i gzhi med na yang rtogs pa'i chos so sor nges pa thob pa yin
translated: Just as the flowers of a magical creation are indeed essenceless, but when not analyzed, they are just as they are, delightful when seen, in the same way, even when there is no basis that is an entity, the Dharma of realization is individually cognized.

original: no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhi'i dbang du byas pa sbrul pa'i me tog gi rnam pa nye bar dgod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhi'i dbang du byas pa sbrul pa'i me tog gi rnam pa nye bar dgod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the example of the flowers of a magical creation is presented from the perspective of a basis.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods...

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ...taught this Dharma discourse...

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin can gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin can gyi rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'o //
translated: This Dharma discourse of the solitary realizers is the nature of the ten virtues and so forth.

original: bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: The phrase I also is a specification.

original: mchod pa'i don kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchod pa'i don kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is for the sake of worship alone.

original: mngon par sprul te zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par sprul te zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The phrase manifesting means that they are produced by the power of meditation.

original: sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs kho na la de bzhin du byas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs kho na la de bzhin du byas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Immediately after the generation of the resolve, just so means that

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then Śatakratu, head of the gods, etc.

original: mngon par gtor to zhes bya ba ni mngon par phyogs pas gtor par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gtor to zhes bya ba ni mngon par phyogs pas gtor par gyur pa'o //
translated: Scattered means that they were scattered by being directed.

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la rjes su brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la rjes su brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to express his approval of Śatakratu, head of the gods, etc.

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The word after has the sense of in accordance with.

original: de dang 'byor pas dbang po'i sgra la las kyi byed pa'i tshig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'byor pas dbang po'i sgra la las kyi byed pa'i tshig tu byas pa'o //
translated: By that connection, the word head is used in the sense of an agent noun.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa'i dus kyi rjes la sbrul pa'i me tog gi de kho na nyid bshad pa'i zur gyi rten gyi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa'i dus kyi rjes la sbrul pa'i me tog gi de kho na nyid bshad pa'i zur gyi rten gyi ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After Indra's speech, in order to teach the nature of the basis of the corner of the explanation of the reality of the magical flowers,

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don gyi rjes su byed pas 'di snyam du sems par gyur to //🔽'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni da @92a * //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don gyi rjes su byed pas 'di snyam du sems par gyur to // 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni da @92a * //
translated: he thought this, following the meaning to be explained.

original: ltar nyams su myong par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ltar nyams su myong par gyur ba'o //
translated: These means that they have been experienced in this way.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum smos pa ni rang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum smos pa ni rang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three is because it is his own abode,

original: de yang rang gi dmigs pa rung ba'i yul nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang gi dmigs pa rung ba'i yul nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: and that also illustrates the suitable object of his own observation.

original: sngon mthong ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Seen before means experienced before.

original: ci me tog 'di dag thams cad sngon chad yod par ma mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci me tog 'di dag thams cad sngon chad yod par ma mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: Were all these flowers not seen before?

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis mngon par gtor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis mngon par gtor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By the scattering of the lord of the gods, Indra, and so on.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'o na rang bzhin ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'o na rang bzhin ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is their nature?

original: me tog 'di dag ni sbrul pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: me tog 'di dag ni sbrul pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: These flowers are magical creations, he said.

original: 'di dag ston te ngas dmigs par rung ba'i yul rnams na yong par sngon chad mthong bar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ston te ngas dmigs par rung ba'i yul rnams na yong par sngon chad mthong bar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: They are shown to be so, I have never seen them before in any place that I can recall.

original: mthong ba'i lam las 'das pa'i yul nas kyang khyer te 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las 'das pa'i yul nas kyang khyer te 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And, They have not been brought from some place beyond the path of seeing,

original: de lta bu'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have no such power.

original: de bas na me tog 'di dag ni yid kyis sprul pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na me tog 'di dag ni yid kyis sprul pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, these flowers are of the nature of mental creations.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to explain that very point, he said, Thus, etc.

original: de la shing zhes bya ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //🔽gel pa ni ma li ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la shing zhes bya ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o // gel pa ni ma li ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, tree is one that has flowers and fruit.🔽 Shrub is jasmine, etc.

original: 'khri shing ni aa ti mug ta ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khri shing ni aa ti mug ta ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vine is atematiya, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus rtogs pa skyes pa shes pa'i phyir lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus rtogs pa skyes pa shes pa'i phyir lan smras pa ni /
translated: In order to understand the Buddha's power, he replied,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Noble Subhuti, etc.

original: / yid la snang bar gyur zhing du yang ci ltar na ma skyes pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: / yid la snang bar gyur zhing du yang ci ltar na ma skyes pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: And if they appear to the mind, how can they be unarisen?

original: yid la skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: yid la skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: To this he says, Because they are mentally arisen, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du na yid las skyes pa'i me tog gang yang med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du na yid las skyes pa'i me tog gang yang med de /
translated: Because in reality there are no flowers arisen from the mind,

original: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entities of grasped and grasper are false.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: shing la sogs pa las skyes par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa las skyes par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not arisen from trees, etc.

original: khyed nyid kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed nyid kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you yourself have refuted that.

original: me tog 'di dag ni ma skyes pa ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni me tog rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma bkag gi / skye ba bkag pa yin pas de lta na ni rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: me tog 'di dag ni ma skyes pa ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni me tog rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma bkag gi / skye ba bkag pa yin pas de lta na ni rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: By the words these flowers are unarisen, the nature of the flowers is not refuted, but their arising is refuted. Thus, they are accepted as permanent,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that is not reasonable.

original: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Kausika, etc.

original: 'khri shing las skyes pa zhes brjod kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'khri shing las skyes pa zhes brjod kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Although it is said born from a vine, it should not be said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Kausika, that which is unborn, etc.

original: @92b gang gi phyir gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: @92b gang gi phyir gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because that which is unborn is not a flower, and that which is not a flower is not born.

original: rtag pa ni rim gyis sam cig car dag gis don gyi bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mi srid do zhes bya bar 'dod do //🔽de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos las khyad par byas ba yin no /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim gyis sam cig car dag gis don gyi bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mi srid do zhes bya bar 'dod do // de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos las khyad par byas ba yin no /
translated: It is accepted that a permanent thing is not possible in its own nature, because it is devoid of the activity of an object, either gradually or instantaneously.🔽Among them, the realization of a pratyekabuddha is distinguished from that of a śrāvaka by the abandonment of the conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas khyad par du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas khyad par du byas pa yin no //
translated: The unsurpassed realization of a buddha is distinguished from that of pratyekabuddhas by the non-abandonment of the conceptualization of the apprehender.

original: rten gyis kyang rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam na ji skad du bshad pa'i nyan thos kyi bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa mi dmigs par bsgoms pas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa
analyzed: rten gyis kyang rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam na ji skad du bshad pa'i nyan thos kyi bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa mi dmigs par bsgoms pas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa
translated: Since the basis is also the cause of realization, the path of pratyekabuddhas is superior.

original: dang rjes su mthun par byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dang rjes su mthun par byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva should not fully understand dependent origination in accordance with the way things are, by meditating on the aspects of the four truths of the śrāvakas as explained above.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As such,🔽because the conception of apprehended objects is impaired

original: gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
translated: and because the conception of an apprehender is not abandoned,

original: rtan gyis bes ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: rtan gyis bes ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: the path of pratyekabuddhas is like a rhinoceros.

original: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //
analyzed: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //
translated: It should be understood that it is correctly subsumed.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs nas ji skad du bshad pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam skye pas /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs nas ji skad du bshad pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam skye pas /
translated: After realizing the factors conducive to penetrative insight, the path of pratyekabuddhas arises as explained above.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: ae ma'o 'phags pa rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ae ma'o 'phags pa rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase Ah! The noble Subhūti... and so on.

original: rten gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas dro ba'i don ston pa'i phyir shes rab zab ba'o //
analyzed: rten gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas dro ba'i don ston pa'i phyir shes rab zab ba'o //
translated: The phrase ...is profound wisdom indicates the meaning of heat through the teaching of the reality of the basis.

original: ming dang tshig tu btags pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung por btags pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig tu btags pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung por btags pa'o //
translated: The phrase ...the designation of name and phrase... indicates the designation of the aggregates of consciousness and so on.

original: thos pa las byung pa'i shes pa'i don du gzhung dang don brjod pas na ston pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung pa'i shes pa'i don du gzhung dang don brjod pas na ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ...the teacher... indicates the teaching of the meaning of the wisdom that arises from hearing through the expression of the text and its meaning.

original: kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa dang mi 'gal bas chos nyid dang yang 'gal par mi byed do //🔽bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'i don du rigs pas brtan par byed pas na gsal par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa dang mi 'gal bas chos nyid dang yang 'gal par mi byed do // bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'i don du rigs pas brtan par byed pas na gsal par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ...without contradicting the conventional... indicates that he does not contradict reality by contradicting the conventional.🔽The phrase ...the elucidator... indicates the elucidation of the meaning of the wisdom that arises from contemplation through the stabilization of reasoning.

original: sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'i don du bsam gtan gyi rim pa nye bar ston pa'i phyir nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'i don du bsam gtan gyi rim pa nye bar ston pa'i phyir nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ...the demonstrator... indicates the demonstration of the stages of meditative stabilization for the sake of the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa brda las byung ba'i chos btags pa dang mi 'gal par chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir na /🔽de ltar chos thams cad la dmigs par gyur na dro bar gyur ba skye bo zhes sprul ba'i me rtog gi rang bzhin bshad pa nyid kyis ston par byed @93a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa brda las byung ba'i chos btags pa dang mi 'gal par chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir na / de ltar chos thams cad la dmigs par gyur na dro bar gyur ba skye bo zhes sprul ba'i me rtog gi rang bzhin bshad pa nyid kyis ston par byed @93a * //
translated: It is said that because one realizes reality without contradicting the phenomena of names and signs such as form,🔽when one focuses on all phenomena in that way, the heat stage of the path of preparation arises.

original: pa'i phyir shes rab zab pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir shes rab zab pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it explains the nature of the fire of wisdom that burns the fuel of the aggregates, it is said to be profound wisdom.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal par //
analyzed: btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal par //
translated: Without contradicting the reality of imputed phenomena,

original: ston pa'i rnam pa dro gyur ba //
analyzed: ston pa'i rnam pa dro gyur ba //
translated: the teacher’s aspect becomes heat.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And it is said:

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa rang nyid kyis nges par byas nas khas blangs pa de ni 'phags pa rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa rang nyid kyis nges par byas nas khas blangs pa de ni 'phags pa rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
translated: The noble Subhūti, having ascertained and accepted that through his own conception, said, “It is so, Bhagavan.”

original: de bzhin du 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sprul pa las skyes pa'i me tog dang 'dra par rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la bslab par bya'o //🔽legs par smras pa nyid kyis rjes su 'dod par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sprul pa las skyes pa'i me tog dang 'dra par rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la bslab par bya'o // legs par smras pa nyid kyis rjes su 'dod par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Similarly, one should train in this means that one should train in the path of the Solitary Buddha, which is like a flower produced from a magical creation.

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In order to show that one should follow the good advice, it is said, Exactly so, Kausika!

original: koo shi ka de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: What is the result of that? It is said, Kausika, if one trains thus, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang mi slob bo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang mi slob bo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
translated: The general meaning is: One does not train anywhere by way of an objective mental support.

original: gangs 'di dag la zhes pa ni brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rnams la'o //
analyzed: gangs 'di dag la zhes pa ni brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rnams la'o //
translated: The word these refers to the eighth and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i dbye bas tshig gnyis smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i dbye bas tshig gnyis smos pa yin te /
translated: Buddhahood and omniscience are mentioned twice by way of the division into the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la slob pa ni phyin ci ma log pas slob na nges par de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la slob pa ni phyin ci ma log pas slob na nges par de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The learner is the one who trains without error, because he definitely attains the state of a tathagata.
